games.name: Earthcore Prominence
games.body:
A long time ago, before men stepped upon this planet, before gods established their pantheons, before consciousness grazed the Earth, there was you.  

There you were , staring at a vast blue, cold surface, carrying fire. You, responsible for lighting the core of this enormous, very wet rock, were going to bring human life to it. You held the fire at the end of your staff, ready to ignite the center most part of Earth, ready to fuel movement in very ground you stood on.  

And not unlike Prometheus would one day defy great dangers to bring fire to men, you were about to dive deep into this tunnel and face the many dangers roaming, swimming around hungry for a snack...  

/!\ WebGL doesn't support Unity's particle systems. To get the true VFX experience, download the windows version!  

Controls:  
- WASD or Arrow keys to move  
- Left click to cast spell  
- E to change spell  

![osszhT.png](///raw/92e/71/z/6a98c.png)

games.name: Diving for Oxygen
games.body:
A short colony simulator where you try to lead your little divers to productive ends, like producing energy and oxygen, so that they can keep breathing.

There is no clear objective to the game, but you'll probably figure out the bounds of the sandbox after playing a little bit. For further details, spoilers: the main objective of the game is to keep the divers alive. For that, they need oxygen, which is produced by divers with the "Oxygen mechanic" job. To make oxygen, they need energy, which is produced by divers with the "Energy producer" job. There is a third job, "Hauler", which can help the other two jobs be more efficient by allowing them to keep working while the hauler moves around the relevant resources. The 3 lines of information on the divers' cards are: Job, Morale, and Oxygen. The job can be changed in the Command Divers menu. If morale falls too low, the diver will go for a walk instead of working to recover some. If oxygen falls too low, the diver will try to find oxygen to refill it. The fun of the game is really just watching the simulation go, didn't manage to add in too much interactivity.

Keyboard and gamepad controls are supported, and the overlay at the bottom explains what the buttons do, but not the mouse (as you might expect from a colony sim).

The game is also on [itch.io](https://nc.itch.io/oxygen).

Jam details: I was originally going for the compo, but needed a bit more time. So the music and art was made by me during the jam. Music with Make Noise's Strega synthesizer (cut and filtered a little with Bitwig Studio), and art with Krita.

![screenshot-01.png](///raw/6e/z/6b07a.png)

games.name: Listen to Me! - Multiplayer co-op (2 players)
games.body:
** Controls **

| **Category**   | **Action**         | **Key(s)**          |
|----------------|--------------------|---------------------|
| **Driver**     | Accelerate         | W / Up Arrow        |
| **Driver**     | Reverse            | S / Down Arrow      |
| **Driver**     | Steer Left/Right   | A / D               |
| **Driver**     | Handbrake          | Spacebar            |
| **Driver**     | Car Horn           | E                   |
| **Navigator**  | Toggle Map         | V                   |
| **Shared**     | Toggle Radio       | F                   |
| **Shared**     | Switch Stations    | 1, 2, 3             |
| **Shared**     | Look Around        | Mouse               |

**Listen to Me!**

Prepare for an unforgettable co-op adventure where every word‚Äîand every second‚Äîmatters. In "Listen to Me," you and a friend are thrown into the chaotic, infernal streets of Los Abismos, a city where reality and nightmare collide. The stakes? Deliver a steaming hot pizza against a backdrop of hellish upheaval. But there‚Äôs a twist: in this madcap, adrenaline-fueled journey, communication is everything.

![SS5.png](///raw/f25/c2/z/6a7bc.png)

**The Story:**  
In Los Abismos, a city once known for its vibrant culture is now overrun by cataclysmic chaos. The ground trembles as hellish flames burst forth from the asphalt, and treacherous sinkholes open up to the very depths of the underworld. Amidst the pandemonium, you and your co-op partner are the city‚Äôs unlikely heroes‚Äîpizza delivery drivers on a mission to save the day. With every delivery, you defy the relentless forces of doom and prove that sometimes, the only thing hotter than a pizza is your determination to overcome the abyss.

![SS1.png](///raw/f25/c2/z/6a7bf.png)

**Gameplay:**  
"Listen to Me" is a dynamic, split-second cooperative experience where both players must communicate, strategize, and react in unison. One of you takes the wheel as the driver, mastering responsive steering, acceleration, and a high-stakes handbrake that could be the difference between narrowly avoiding a sinkhole and plunging into the depths of hell. The other, the navigator, must guide you through the maze-like streets of Los Abismos, calling out hazards and ensuring every twist and turn is perfectly timed.

Every delivery is a pulse-pounding race against time, with the environment evolving around you:
- **Sinkholes to Hell:** Sinkholes don't just suck you in‚Äîthey‚Äôre portals that lead directly to the fiery pits of the underworld. Dodge them, or risk being dragged down to eternal damnation!
- **Hellish Eruptions:** The city is alive with the sounds and fury of the underworld. Infernal rifts burst from the streets, transforming everyday chaos into a symphony of destruction.
- **Dynamic Challenges:** As the environment shifts and intensifies, your teamwork and quick thinking become paramount. Listen to your partner‚Äîbecause in "Listen to Me," every command could be a lifeline.

![SS2.png](///raw/f25/c2/z/6a7c3.png)

**Art & Audio:**  
Immerse yourself in a world crafted with meticulous detail. The custom art style of "Listen to Me" perfectly balances the surreal beauty of a city on the brink of collapse with the gritty, high-energy reality of your mission. Every visual element is paired with a dynamic audio experience powered by FMOD:
- **Dynamic Music:** The music adapts to the chaos around you, rising and falling in intensity as you race through the streets.
- **Immersive Sound Effects:** From the roar of the engine to the screech of the brakes and the ominous rumble of hell‚Äôs fury, every sound is designed to pull you deeper into the experience.
- **Co-op Audio Cues:** Communication isn‚Äôt just spoken‚Äîit‚Äôs heard in the very fabric of the game‚Äôs soundscape, ensuring that both players are in sync, even when words fail.

**Why "Listen to Me" Stands Out:**
- **Innovative Co-op Gameplay:** Every moment requires perfect teamwork. Whether you're steering through a hail of demonic fire or narrowly avoiding a sinkhole, you must truly listen to each other to survive.
- **Aesthetic Brilliance:** With custom art and meticulously designed audio, every scene is a masterpiece of chaos and beauty.
- **High-Octane Action:** Fast-paced, challenging, and full of surprises, "Listen to Me" pushes the boundaries of cooperative multiplayer gameplay.
- **Darkly Humorous Narrative:** Embrace the absurdity of a pizza delivery service operating amid the collapse of the underworld‚Äîa story that‚Äôs as hilarious as it is harrowing.

**Join the Delivery:**  
In a world where the ordinary meets the infernal, "Listen to Me" challenges you to deliver hope‚Äîand pizza‚Äîagainst impossible odds. Gear up, communicate, and dive into the madness of Los Abismos. The fate of the city (and your dinner) depends on your ability to listen, react, and work together.

Get ready for a wild ride where every command counts, and every moment is a battle against the abyss. Are you ready to deliver?  
**Listen to Me** is waiting‚Äîlet the infernal adventure begin!

![SS3.png](///raw/f25/c2/z/6a7c8.png)

games.name: Nightmare Descent
games.body:
![Sprite-0002.png](///raw/9bf/33/z/6b18a.png)

Nightmare Descent is an eldritch horror card game where the only way out is to wake up. Trapped in a surreal dream beneath reality, players must descend through shifting layers of madness. Every level takes you deeper into an unknowable abyss, where unspeakable horrors await.

Choose your path‚Äîface terrifying entities head-on with dwindling resources, or flee deeper into the unknown, hoping to survive just long enough to wake up. If you‚Äôre lucky‚Äîor cursed‚Äîyou may awaken and escape. But every decision chips away at your sanity.

Will you wake up,

Or will the Nightmare claim you?

Bugs:
-Cards using variable values do not work correctly
-After winning or losing, the game does not reset correctly

DrSmey - Programming, Art, Design
Noctiluca - Art, Design
pentragon - Art, Design
Tyrrer - Audio, Music!

long ago, Orpheus ventured into hades to rescue his wife, Eurydice. Our story begins a few years earlier. Orpheus has fallen into a well and finds his soul trapped in the depths of Hades! Only Eurydice, armed with her trusty bucket, can save him.

Select: Spacebar

XBox Controls:

Select: A Button

If you are stuck try purchasing some upgrades from the characters to help you along!

Notes:
This is an entry for Ludum Dare 57. It was made by Tyler Hale, Stephen Watson, and Jack Turpitt between the 5th and the 7th of April 2025.

games.name: The fate of Carl
games.body:
Karl fell... but not in vain. In this world, where underground mines hold dangers as much as treasures, the dwarf Karl was a legend. He dedicated his life to serving the Company.
He died doing what he loved - digging. Now his story is not just a memory, but an inspiration for new generations of miners. Karl is gone, but his spirit remains in every blow of the pickaxe, in every drop of sweat that runs down the face of another recruit. Glory to Rock and Stone.

The project was worked on:

k-48: Gameplay Systems Alchemist, Code Wizard.

games.name: Into The Abyss
games.body:
![Into_The_Abyss_169.png](///raw/72e/a5/z/6af9d.png)

Made under _72 hours_ by @constance, @hikiyoshi and @kamizenki a.k.a _Hiyuka Studios_.

## DESCRIPTION

You‚Äôre an __archaeologist__. Alone, at the edge of a giant hole in the earth. Armed with nothing but your __trusty pickaxe__, you begin your descent into the unknown.‚Ä®Into the Abyss is a __digging-focused__ platformer where exploration goes straight down. Your mission: __reach the bottom__, __uncover the truth__ behind the abyss, and do it as fast as you can, after all you can get a worth treasure. But be careful, watch out for those treacherous __traps__ set by who know anyway.

## CORE GAMEPLAY

___Dig Your Own Path___:‚Ä®Break through dirt, stone, and ancient ruins with your pickaxe. You decide where to go‚Äîno set paths, no shortcuts.

___Find Hidden Treasures___:‚Ä®Scattered along the descent are lost treasure chests filled with rare materials, secrets, and boosts. Getting them isn't easy‚Äîbut it‚Äôs worth it.


## CONTROLS

- A, D: Move around
- Space: Jump
- S, Left Mouse Button: Dig at cursor position
- E: Interact
- Escape: Return to Menu


## TOOLS

- Unity 6
- Visual Studio Code
- Aseprite
- Photoshop
- Audacity

## KNOWN ISSUES

Feel free to let us know if there are still any bugs or issues leftover that we missed in the development process.

## CHANGELOG AND BUG FIXES

Nothing in here yet, be it'll be, properly.

## INGAME CAPTURES

WIP...


## CONTRIBUTIONS

- @constance - Lead Programmer, Level Layout Designer, UI Designer.
- @kamizenki - Lead Artist, Game Designer, Audio Designer.
- @hikiyoshi - Mechanics Designer, Particle Effect Designer.

games.name: Project Planetfall: The Exodus Directive
games.body:
# Save humanity from impending doom!

In the year 2075, astronomers discovered an asteroid heading towards Earth with an alarmingly high confidence of impact. The United Nations has assumed rule of the entire planet, creating manned drill ships to explore the subterranean parts of the planet. If all goes according to plan, there will be a network of thousands of navigation beacons and subsurface caves to construct emergency shelters and save the human race. You are Doug, pilot of the Iron Eulogy and the material scientists who invented the metal alloy the ship is built from, stronger than steel and harder than diamond. 

*NOTE: Please use the GitHub download link for the latest working build. Hours before the deadline, we encountered issues with physics not working well on the build. Hopefully it's a small gaff and we can fix it before the final playable build, but if not, please keep that in mind. Thanks!*

![Overall.png](///raw/909/d5/z/6b140.png)

# Gameplay

Use WASD to move and Space to interact with a module. Use the mouse to manage items and hit space again to end interaction with a module.

The player may carry one item at a time and insert it into appropriate slots in modules.

There are many important modules on the ship:
NOTE: Most modules have a power state. Modules with a power state do not do anything when turned off.

## Engine
Control the speed and heading using the helm located on the engine.

![engine.png](///raw/909/d5/z/6b144.png)

## Power Plant
Produce power for the ship at the power plant. Load fuel to keep the ship running. If power demand exceeds production, an alarm will sound and all modules will perform at a reduced efficiency.

## Cooling Array
Remove heat from the ship with the cooling array. Load coolant to prevent an overheat condition. If the ship is overheated for 30 seconds, the crew perishes and the game ends in defeat.

## Collection Drills
Resources are collected by using WASD on the collection drills when the ship is stopped. Ore amount and type is indicated by the scanner interface.

![Drill.png](///raw/909/d5/z/6b149.png)

## Storage Locker
Items are stored in the locker in the middle of the ship. 

![Storage.png](///raw/909/d5/z/6b14b.png)

## Foundry
Craft upgrades, coolant, fuel, and navigation beacons at the foundry. Recipes shown are based on available resources. Collect more resources and go deeper to unlock more recipes.

![Crafting.png](///raw/909/d5/z/6b14e.png)

## Jettison Hatch
Eject excess cargo as needed through the jettison hatch. Ejecting a navigation beacon of the correct tier (based on Fathom number) will end the game in victory and record your depth, a.k.a your score.

# Goal of the Game

Manage your power, heat, and resources to go as deep as possible! Note that every 1,000 m you will advance a Fathom.

## Fathoms and Sectors
-Fathom 0-2: Upper Strata (T1)
-Fathom 3-5: Lithosphere (T2)
-Fathom 6-8: Asthenosphere (T3)
-Fathom 9+: Mantle (T4)

## Defeat Condition
The crew will perish if the internal temperature is above 50 C for 30 seconds.

## Victory Condition
Place a navigation beacon in the jettison hatch of the same tier based on your current Sector. This will end the game and record your depth/score!

# Assets

All assets were created by the team or modified from existing media to be transformative.

## Game
-Unity Editor 6000.0.45f1

## Audio
-Audacity
-MUSIC MAKER 2024

## Sprites
-Aseprite

# Thank You
We hope you enjoy our game! LD57 was a blast!

games.name: Cursor Descend
games.body:
Are you a master of the mouse? Then you've come to the right place.

![screenshot2.jpg](///raw/18c/36/z/6a3a2.jpg)

In Cursor Descend, you will guide a tiny needle-like cursor on a journey ‚Äî starting from the mouth, descending deep through the body, and finally escaping through a mysterious exit. Precision is everything, and your only tool is the cursor.

This game was made for the Ludum Dare Jam #57. And this is my very first jam game!

I hope playing it is just as fun as it was to create:)

# **Gameplay and controls:**

Hold left mouse button to move. Hold spacebar to speed up. Scroll the mouse wheel to rotate your direction.

The camera scrolls downward automatically‚Äîyou'll need to keep your cursor on the path.

At the end of your run, your final score is calculated based on:

The total distance traveled

How long you held the left mouse button during your final streak

And your ‚Äúscroll wheel heat‚Äù

# **Credits:**

"The Way Out" Kevin MacLeod ([incompetech.com](http://incompetech.com/)) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 4.0 License¬†http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/

Kenny Impact Sounds¬†Licensed under Creative Commons CC0

# **Game Engine:**

Godot 4.4.1

*This game is¬†Made by FoxEcho¬†for Ludum Dare¬†#57*

games.name: DeepJamGameCan'tThinkOfAName
games.body:
CONTROLS:

ARROW KEYS: MOVE

Z: JUMP/CONFIRM

X: ATTACK/CANCEL

C: CROUCH/SLIDE (WHILE RUNNING)

A: PREVIOUS WEAPON

S: NEXT WEAPON

well, it's not much, and it doesn't really fit the theme, but this is my first time doing a game jam ever, and besides reusing some old sound effects I made and paraphrasing some of my old code from other projects, everything I made (so basically just the code and music...) was from scratch, so I'm proud enough of that.

you can kind of "bullet jump" by starting a slide and then immediately jumping, I even made that boost your momentum a little bit. as you can imagine I spent most of my "development time" just playing around with that. if I end up expanding on this that's something I'd like to focus on really building the game around. you also jump much higher if you're crouching/crouch-walking when you jump.

i wanted to add basic enemy behavior and player death, but vertigo had other plans for me this weekend. honestly, I want to add a lot more to this, I might just keep working on it. but as far as I got done during the jam, this is it. hopefully next time I can make something a bit more concrete and "actually a game"-ish but I'm not unhappy with this.

Space War Man by Emcee Flesher (OpenGameArt)

music by me, sound effects by me, code by me

games.name: Depth of field
games.body:
# Depth of Field

World Peace? Power? Happiness? Riches?

Puzzle your way towards the one single **goal in your life that really matters**.

In Depth of Field, Bob the Alien is stranded in the strange landscape of an unknown alien planet. Hostile Flora, razor-sharp crystals, and his own sanity are in the way of finding his way through this maze.
Luckily, Bob has a few tricks up his sleeve. Next to his impressive jumping ability, he is also fantastic at squinting his eyes to focus different layers of the environment, which comes in handy when faced with troubles you can't simply jump over.

## Controls

- Move with LEFT and RIGHT arrow keys
- Jump with SPACE
- Switch layers with UP and DOWN arrow keys
- Mute sound with M
- Change sound volume with V

games.name: Hyperspacedive
games.body:
Made in ~15 hours, but missed the Compo, so entering Jam instead!


:exclamation: **PLEASE NOTE** :exclamation:
*A very small percentage of people may experience epileptic seizures or blackouts when exposed to certain kinds of flashing lights or light patterns. This game does contain such, so be aware of that before running the game! *

## You dive deep into hyperspace!

There is no time! Not even for a start menu! Dive right into action! Avoid the green hyperspace bubbly matter or your ship will loose energy! There are 11 levels, each a little bit different. It's doable to reach the final levels, I promise (tested).

![ld57_4.gif](///raw/d51/2/z/6af7e.gif)

## Disclaimer

I have spent last 2 days on doing some sort of proof-of-concept for pico-8 (with OOP and 2D transformation matrices...), not knowing the system at all, and brushing up on Lua. And here we are. This is somewhat playable, though not really a finished game - but I wanted to explore and evaluate 
pico-8 and Lua for any future endeavors (the evaluation is positive).

And I really, really wanted to have something somewhat finished. Wasn't able to join Compo (busy weekend), but otherwise it's all on me. The code is available, but also atrocious.

games.name: The Misadventures of Sir Delaware Jones: In the Temple of the Wooden Skull
games.body:
![Title.gif](///raw/484/1/z/69b50.gif)

‚ÄúHi, my name is Sir Delaware Jones and I invite you to join me on my latest adventure. I was doing a nice river safari on the mississippi river, but destiny had other plans for me: It led me directly to the temple of the wooden skull!‚Äù

Our clumsy misadventurer Sir Delaware Jones wanted to go on a calm boat tour on the mississippi river. Unfortunately he confused the planes at the airport and went to egypt, instead. A short ride on the Nile river brought him to the infamous temple of the wooden skull - the temple with the hightest risk for the lowest reward. Help him explore the depths of the ever changing maze in the temple pyramids and collect treasure after treasure in this mind-bending puzzle experience.

* Push a tile into the maze and make new paths!
* Collect treasure and use your power-ups wisely!
* Mind the shifting walls and do not get trapped!

How deep can you go with the help of Sir Delaware Jones?
**Please have fun and share your best score in the comments!**

![SDJ_TotWS_V1.0.gif](///raw/484/1/z/69b22.gif)

## Important

* You need a working Java Runtime Environment to run the game (JRE or JDK)
* You might need to unzip the file for the game to be able to run
* If the game does not start after double-clicking the jar, please try to run it from the console (java -jar SDJ_TheTempleOfTheWoodenSkullV1.0.jar)

## Version history

** No major changes to the game have been done since the first release (V1.1) **

* 1.0 - First upload
* 1.1 - First release
 * Fixed typo in title
* 1.2 - Latest version
 * Recompiled for Java 21 (or higher)

games.name: MS Drowning
games.body:
![MSDrowningScreenshot1.png](///raw/877/93/z/6b27a.png)

Set in a future dystopia, you find yourself as a soon-to-be decommissioned robot operating on a deep-ocean ship, the MS Drowning. You have no choice but to follow your shady boss's instruction and search the ocean floor for something that appears very important to her. With every hint you find down in the depth, the goal of the mission becomes more and more mysterious, and it's up to you to find out what really is happening here.

Can you make it?

== Controls ==

You are a deep-ocean robot, *use [W], [A] and [D] to move*. Your jump with [W] can later be upgraded to a double- (triple- or even better) jump by buying the Booster upgrade.

You are *equipped with a claw arm, which you steer with your mouse and which you can attach to objects or the ground by pressing the mouse and dragging in the direction you want the item to move.
Drag the items to the elevator to return them to the ship and sell them for money.

Moving on the ocean floor costs you energy (also upgradable), which is shown in the top.

If you're stuck, you can *reset your player by pressing [R]*.

*Pro Tip*: Your robot arm can also hook onto the ocean floor, which allows you to use it as a grappling hook - allowing for crazy cool underwater pro-player movements.

games.name: Fear of Sea
games.body:
![banner.png](///raw/bdc/2/z/6aa45.png)

# Descend into the Abyss - And Your Own Mind!
In Fear of Sea, you‚Äôre trapped in a steel coffin, going hundreds of meters below the surface. Your only goal: find hidden treasures lost to the ocean‚Äôs darkness, but down there, the pressure isn‚Äôt just physical‚Äîit‚Äôs psychological.

**Every dive is a high-stakes puzzle. You must carefully plan your route, dodge deadly sharks, and keep an eye on your oxygen level.** The deeper you go, the less margin for error. Hit the rocky seafloor, and your vessel might not recover. Stay down too long, and you'll never resurface.

This is a game about dread, strategy, and survival. There's no combat. No help. Just you, your submarine, and the crushing weight of the sea.

# Screenshots:
![pack-screenshot.png](///raw/bdc/2/z/6aab2.png)



# Key Features:
- üåä First-Person Submarine Cockpit: Feel every creak and groan of your vessel as the depths close in.
- ü¶à Tension-Fueled Shark Encounters: Outmaneuver aggressive predators lurking in the dark.
- üß≠ Strategic Route Planning: Choose your path wisely‚Äîone wrong turn could be your last.
- ü´Å Oxygen Management: Every second counts. Balance risk and reward as you search for treasure.
- üéß Psychological Atmosphere: Audio design and environmental storytelling push your fear to the edge.

Can you brave the deep long enough to make it back alive?

**Welcome to Fear of Sea.**
No one can hear you drown.

games.body:
![BannerLD57.jpg](///raw/f42/21/z/6a87d.jpg)

![potatoplanetdriller1.png](///raw/f42/21/z/6a876.png)

### LORE

Nobody knows what happen to our planet but you and your crew aren't one to ask question. You saw an opportunity for good Potato Cash and you didn't hesitate ! You bought a drill, repurposed it and now adventure and money await.

Dive into a mouthwatering world where the earth itself is made of ingredients! In this fast-paced local co-op adventure, pilot a powerful food-mining drill deep underground to unearth culinary treasures. Burrow through layers of potato plains, meat meadows, and vegetable veins while your creation is cooking in the oven. Work together inside your cramped culinary contraption to craft delicious recipes but don't let your masterpiece to long on the fire or you might ruin it 

### HOW TO PLAY

You can play alone or up to 4 locally in a vessel that moves through fields of ingredients and hazardous zones. Your goal is to collect ingredients running through it and assemble them to make recipes.
Then you can sell them with the computer. You can cook ingredients to make them better and make a better dish but if you let them too long to cook they will burn.
Some ingredients cannot be combined resulting in a horrible dish.

### CONTROLS

**SPACE** to play

**ARROW KEYS** to move around

**E** to interact

Controllers can join the game as well by pressing the action action button
- When starting the game, either press space or controller action button to pop a player
- You can control the ship to go left and right with the arrows button on top of the ship


Credits for music [HATMIX](https://opengameart.org/content/canary)

games.name: Steve the Smith
games.body:
# Intro‚Äã
Steve must go down into the depths of the mine to collect ores to smelt and sell. Using your pickaxe traverse the mine and collect ore. You have a magic spell to return to the surface, but it cannot bring back any of the ore you mine. To do this, you will need to charge up a ore portal spell. This will receive a charge for every 10 levels you go down.

Don't run out of durability on your pickaxe, or you will be automatically returned to the surface, and lose any ore you didn't send back.

## Progression
‚ÄãProgress is saved whenever you visit the shop or the mine.

## Controls
Movement - WASD
Jump - Space
Mine
 - Up - E
 - Left/Right - F ‚Äãdepends on which way you're facing
 - D‚Äãown - C

## Shop
In your blacksmith shop, you can smelt and sell ores. Click Smelt and select the ore you'd like to turn into a bar. Rare ore require 2, while common require 5, to smelt.

Once done, click on the cave entrance button, to head into the mine

## ‚Äã‚ÄãMine
‚ÄãIn the mine navigate around and break the rocks. You have a limited durability, so keep an eye on it. After you've went down at least 10 levels, the ore portal spell charge will increase. Click the button to send ores you've collected back to the shop. If you want to head back to the shop early click the door button

games.name: Depth of Moments
games.body:
Depth can mean many things.
 Some might think of oceans. Others ‚Äî of dungeons, the mind, or something more mystical.
 We weren‚Äôt sure at first either ‚Äî until we stumbled upon our version of it:
 the depth of a moment.

![5.png](///raw/16f/46/z/6ae24.png)

This is a story about memories.
Small, warm, awkward, important. Sometimes almost forgotten, but somehow still precious. The kind that stay with us and quietly keep us warm on especially cold nights.We wanted to make a game about simple things ‚Äî sitting by the fire, burning marshmallows, a guitar that‚Äôs still not quite in tune.
Because it‚Äôs these little, imperfect, sometimes silly moments that bring out the truest emotions ‚Äî and become the mosaic of our lives.

![9.png](///raw/16f/46/z/6ae35.png)

Sure, we only had three days, and we didn‚Äôt manage to build everything we imagined.
 But we focused on what mattered most: the atmosphere.
 The kind you don‚Äôt explain with words.
 The kind that lives in the tiniest details.
We hope you can feel it too.

![7.png](///raw/16f/46/z/6ae41.png)

games.name: More in depth
games.body:
A game where you have to go more in depth to solve puzzles and complete the levels*.


The game is made with Godot Engine. My first time using it, and I am surprisingly pleased. I will use it more from now on.

As usual, the jam didn't go as expected. Initially I had different ideas, I wanted to make an adventure game using some mechanics derived from different meanings of depth, but ended up with something quite different (though the main mechanic is more or less the same).

Overall I'm satisfied as this time I submitted a "full" game, with menus, audio and a whole level. Good enough for the first Ludum Dare. Let's see if I can make it better the next time.

--------------------
*I say it in plural but there is only one level. I didn't have time to integrate everything and packed only what was working so I could submit it in time.

games.name: Inner Worlds
games.body:
Francis, Alexis, and Louisa are three best friends with dramatically different personalities and outlooks on life. One dreadful day, a terrible argument finally broke out between them, and as their relationship fractured, they found themselves drawn into the Depths, a place which makes their thoughts and emotions into reality.

Unfortunately, their turmoil and conflict took on a shape of its own in the Depths: as their friendship broke apart, so did their very bodies! Now scattered in pieces across the Depths, only one way forward remains for them: to reconcile and reconnect by exploring their inner worlds!

Reassemble the trio and unlock their lost talents as you proceed. Frances uses her strength to topple obstacles, Louisa leaps over holes in the ground without a care, and Alexis's introverted nature lets her avoid enemies and reveal secrets. Beware of hazards in the Depths: death is only a minor inconvenience, but there are dozens of deadly traps and hostile spirits eager to bar your escape regardless!

Keyboard controls: WASD/arrow keys to move, Space/Z to perform actions.

Gamepad controls: D-pad/left analog stick to move, bottom face button (Nintendo B/PlayStation X/Xbox A) to perform actions.

Created in Godot 4.4.1. 3D assets created in Blender. 2D textures created in Aseprite. Uses Monogram font by datagoblin.

games.name: Dungeons Below
games.body:
My First Ludum Dare. It was a journey through pressure and growth
This was my very first Ludum Dare, and going into it, I didn‚Äôt know exactly what to expect‚Äîjust that I wanted to push myself, build something from scratch, and see how far I could go in 72 hours.

When the theme ‚ÄúDepths‚Äù was revealed, I immediately thought of hidden spaces‚Äîbasements, dungeons, eerie places buried under the surface. I settled on building a game about curiosity, darkness, and discovery. Originally, I imagined a multi-level basement, but due to time constraints and the need to use free assets, I shifted to dungeon environments.

From the start, things were intense. I struggled with setting up systems, tracking bugs, fixing lighting issues, managing collisions, and a hundred other small but crucial details. It was exhausting‚Äîmentally and physically. I lost track of time, skipped meals, and barely slept. At one point, the pressure felt like too much, and anxiety crept in. But somehow, I kept going.

I can‚Äôt say it was smooth or even that I enjoyed every moment of it‚Äîbut I grew. A lot. I learned how to prioritize, when to stop tweaking things that weren‚Äôt critical, and how to build even when everything felt like it was falling apart.

At the end of it, I finished my game. It‚Äôs simple. It‚Äôs flawed. But it‚Äôs mine. And it was made during a time of emotional weight and uncertainty. Releasing it felt like a personal victory‚Äîbecause it represents not just a game, but a moment where I didn‚Äôt give up, even when I felt like I could.

To anyone else trying this for the first time‚Äîknow that it‚Äôs okay to feel overwhelmed. What matters is showing up, learning, and finishing something that matters to you.

I‚Äôm proud of what I made. Not because it‚Äôs perfect, but because I got through the process and learned so much more than just game dev.

Now about the game: 
In this game you are trapped in a dungeon and have to get out of the dungeon alive. And the player has to find the exit before the monsters kill them.![Screenshot 2025-04-06 193741.png](///raw/0c6/36/z/6a46d.png)

## Introduction

**Lyfe** is a rhythm-action game that tells the story of a warrior who accidentally falls into the **Rhythmic Dungeon**. Players need to grasp the timing of the music and operate the warriors to react in the critical moment:

In your first descent to the dungeon‚Äôs depths, can you find your rhythm and fight your way out?

games.name: Mutant Ocean
games.body:
# Welcome to the Mutant Ocean research programme,
you have been selected as an Operator for the Automated Diver unit.
50,000 years ago humanity seeded the oceans of Almenic IV to research mutations in non earth oceanic environments. Now it is time to take samples of the mutated life forms and retrieve the three Autonomous  P.E.A.R.L monitors which contain a mineral and nutient dense physical record of the oceans.

## To control the Automated Diver:
Use WASD Arrow Keys or the Left Analog Stick to move
Press Space or the Right Action Button to swing the sample net
Press Shift or the Bottom Action Button to Dash

## Objectives:
Your role as an operator will be terminated should you fail to reach the profit target for a dive. Your role will be apsred should you succeed in collecting the P.E.A.R.L monitor for the area.

Collect samples of fish, rarer fish will spawn lower, scans indicate abnormal biologies with the deepest dwelling fish absorbing environmental metals and integrating them into their biology.

You have a limited number of sample jars but may purchase some more in the Overview Screen.

Collect samples of seaweed and coral, these are less valuable but do not  have limited storage

By collecting the pearl for an area you will be able to progress to the next dive site, each dive is deeper and spawns rarer and more dangerous fish.

# Credits
Made for Ludum Dare 57 with the theme of "Depths" in 72 hours.

Game designed and programmed by [Hyphinett](https://hyphin.net)
Background Music by Hyphinett

Art by [Tetraminose](https://bsky.app/profile/tetraminose.bsky.social)

SFX & Additional Music by [Kaitlyn "IDKAY" Cooper](https://bsky.app/profile/idkayuk.bsky.social)

Font: [Salty](https://somepx.itch.io/pixel-font-salty) by [Somepx](https://bsky.app/profile/somepx.com)

games.name: Dream Abyss
games.body:
### Setting:
Our game is titled *Dream Abyss*, aiming to present a journey diving deep into the dream of a boy.

The boy encounters loads of terrible stuff during the day - one is zombies from a movie he watched.

These zombies start attacking him in his mind - and he has to do into depth of his dream to avoid them eventually.

### Game Information:
The rooms in the boy's dream are randomly created. At the end of each level, there is a staircase downwards to enter a new level.

Each level is more difficult than the former - there will be increased number of spawn points and more rooms.

The character has three continuous stages: light sleep, deep sleep, and rapid-eye-movement.

During light sleep, minds work at a small level so he has low visibility to things around him.

During REM, his minds work fast and walks at a higher speed (in his dream), has high visibility, but the rate of zombies spawning becomes higher.

The conditions of deep sleep is in between the two extremes.

He has a sword to protect him - he must swing his sword to make zombies disappear.

After diving down five levels, he finally stops suffering from the nightmare.

### Controls:
WASD - move horizontally/vertically

Left click - activate sword (for 1 second)

The character faces towards the mouse.

To kill enemies, activate the sword and swing it to them.

games.name: Adam, Rejected
games.body:
Scientist Mandy Shelby creates bodies: live bodies. But when some of her creations do not meet her expectations, she is not one to continue on a doomed project. Her children are worthy. If they are not, there is only one way to go, and that is down.

Meet Adam. Once one of Mandy Shelby's children, now a rejected monster, tumbling down a shaft to his new, dank, forever home under the rocks. But this skellie will not sit idly by. And so his journey upwards begins, with you to help him.

We hope you enjoy our attempt at the Ludum Dare game jam!
Happy crawling :)

MashedPotato, LisaQuill and SmallTalkInc

games.name: Bamboozled
games.body:
Help Papi and Chiwawa get to the other side of a rice field! Chop bamboo to get across deep puddles, balance between length of individual poles and their quantity to safely get to the other side, and don't get wet in the process!

Controls:
Climb bamboo: Z
Chop bamboo: X (chops bamboo top, adds pole to inventory)
Open inventory: C
On bamboo: Shift to aim jump. 
When aiming: jump with Z
You must select a pole from inventory before jumping into water.

You lose if pole is shorter than water depth (shown in aim mode)

You win if you get to the other side!

"Are we the baddies?" asked literally no piranha ever. There's no such thing as a "bad guy" in the food chain. Yeah, you got it right ‚Äì you play as a piranha, and your task is to grow a school and devour everything in the ocean's DEPTHs.

games.name: Voidrunner
games.body:
# BEYOND ENEMY LINES

![SolarBeam.png](///raw/e68/3/z/6af53.png)

## Key Features

- :rocket: **Physics-based space combat:** It's all about momentum. Orbit around enemies, lead your shots. Stay on the move to avoid fire.
- :boom: **Destructible terrain:** Asteroids crumble, ships turn into wreckage. The terrain works as cover... for a time.
- :shield: **Projectile piercing:** Shots can pierce through objects, slowing them down. Projectiles inherit your ship's velocity: go faster and do more damage.
- :bow_and_arrow: **Every shot counts:** Your targets aren't sitting still. Aim your shots carefully, and keep moving to avoid the return fire while you reload.

## How to Play

Mouse and keyboard required.

- **Move the mouse** to turn your ship.
- **W/A/S/D** to move.
- **Left click** to fire your primary weapon.
- **Right click** to fire your secondary weapons.
- **Left Shift** to boost forward.

## Credits

- **Sam Minh Ly**: System design, level design, balancing, audio
- **Mika Molenkamp**: Programming, UI, audio
- **Jorrit Neslo**: Environment art, UI art, visual effects, shader magic

Font is 'Ethnocentric' by Typodermic Fonts, 'Abel' by MADType, licensed under SIL Open Font License. Sounds from freesounds.org. Music is iX by cinameng, and Fate of the Irrbloss OST by xCirrex.

# GOOD LUCK, PILOT

_(No web build this time, sorry! We found out at the very last minute that WebGL doesn't support Unity VFX Graph... sad times.)_

games.name: Inner Stratum
games.body:
![ITCH_Gamepage_Banner_V3.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a874.png)
Join your Favorite Drilling Enterprise on a harrowing Journey through the Inner Stratum! Excavate away and be the first one to reach Level 100! Dig up resources, repair malfunctioning Equipment and bear witness to totally normal anomalies. While you manage drills and chutes on your monitors you must juggle repairs and lower yourself into the depths to reach the company‚Äôs final goal: The mysterious Level 100.

![itchmore.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8d3.png)

WARNING: Dear Employee, sadly we could not get the game working completely in time! But there is a little bit to explore and play around and we hope you will take a look and leave some feedback, as we plan to continue the development! We have no working Tutorial, but you might understand what the game is about if you read through this page!

![explain.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a860.png)

Your Job:
Drill down to Level 100
Use Elevator to reach Level 100

Your Method:
Use your workstation to:
-	Get live data on your drills
-	Manage their speed
-	Monitor your progress
-	Look out for interesting Opportunities
Use the maintenance Area to:
-	Repair broken drills
-	Swap out drills and other Modules
Use the Elevator to:
-	Lower yourself into earth‚Äôs bosom
-	Search for Resources to speed up your journey
-	See fabulous sights to behold

Our Gratitude:
-	Bottomless

See the Handbook for more Information!

![Image_Sequence_008_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a870.png)
What will you find on your way?
![Image_Sequence_012_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a871.png)

Welcome dear employee! If you have made it this far, congratulations are in order.
Congratulations!
The highest honor is bestowed upon you. The pioneering spirit of Humankind has endured, and the company‚Äôs utmost trust lies in you now!
‚ÄúGo forth, work fruitful and multiply.‚Äù ‚Äì Founders Message of the Day
Sincerely, 
Management

FAQ.
How did I get here?
-	You didn‚Äôt, we dit! Because we can!
What am I doing here?
-	You will be the first to reach Level 100!
What will I find?
-	Greatness awaits.
Is there a Hallpass?
-	Sadly, no hallpass commodities are available at this time. Sorry ‚òπ
How to I operate this Machinery?
-	We are glad you asked ‚Äì lets find out on the next pages! We are in this together, how exciting.

![Image_Sequence_003_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8a9.png)
‚ÄÉ
Chapter I: The getting started 101 ABC
A ‚Äì stands for Alignment, align your seat with your Workstation and yourself with its merry Contents
B ‚Äì stands for‚Ä¶ we are, of course, just kidding. 

You are situated in what we call a ‚ÄúRoom‚Äù this ‚ÄúRoom‚Äù contains various commodities for you to use to fulfill your manmade duties!
You are tasked to drill a singular hole to the depth of 100 Levels. Afterwards you will hop into the elevator and lower yourself towards the embrace of the depths. All to raise your self-esteem and our coffers!
To do this you get to utilize multiple chutes ‚Äì your just need to drill one of them deep enough!
A selection of things to look forward to:

The drills will get damaged, and you will have to repair them!
The chutes will contain resources that you get to extract!
You will be the first to find out what effect this tremendous depth has on the human body!

![Image_Sequence_009_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8af.png)

Chapter II: The Workstation and YOU
Aboard your Station is a variety of tools at your disposal. So, get started, Captain!
To set the sails of progress into the Sunset you will find your digital Rudder. The computers display a variety of statistics and allow you to manage the drills, elevator and everything that comes attached to your winch ‚Äì the so-called modules. 
Unwind yourself and watch your progress, this place is all about strategy and management:
See your progress and the Chutes in detail interesting spots such as resources will be displayed here.
Get an overview of your active modules and their Heat and Damage.
Configure drill speeds.
And decide what modules you want to cycle to different chutes and what to repair.

![Image_Sequence_1_005_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8b9.png)

Chapter III: Drilling in the Age of Repairs
We care about emissions; we care about green planets and all and we definitely care about you.
Every Level you drill away will slightly damage your Drill, the deeper you get the harder the crust will become, and the more damage drilling will cause.
The faster your drill spins and whirls the rocks away, chipping at the very core of existence, the more heat will build up. The deeper you get; the less heat will dissipate on its own. Heat exceeding the first quarter of your display will damage the drill over time.
But worry not! Repair is on the way. Raise your drills up and move them into the repair bays using your Workstation, stand up and take a look at what‚Äôs wrong. Maybe change a fuse or two.
Remember: Never despair, always repair!

![Image_Sequence_1_006_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8bb.png)

Chapter IV: The elevating Chute Experience
You can use your Elevator module and lower yourself into the chutes by stepping inside and pressing the right buttons. What presses Up goes up and what comes up comes down in history!
Open your door and take a look at an empty wall staring back at you at worst, or your next motherlode at best! Get those resources to optimize your workflow.
Scrap will let you repair your drills in an instant!
Coal can be used to send your drills on overdrive, making them nearly twice as fast without causing any additional heat!

![Image_Sequence_1_008_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8bd.png)

Chapter V: In Case of Anomalies
You may find objects that can‚Äôt be mined by the drills, those must be raised with your winch in order to unblock the chute. To do this you have to empty the Chute from any modules and lower it without the latter to grab it and bring it up to you!
You may have heard of mysterious happenings, haven‚Äôt you? ‚ÄúAnomalies‚Äù? 
The good news is, there are none! You are completely safe!
The bad news is: someone lied to you. Simple as.

Credits:
Lukas Becker (Game Design),
Luca L√ºck (3D Artist),
Cedric Keutler (3D Artist),
Laura Breuer (2D Artist),
Hakim Weingart (Programmer),
Leon Kirschbaum (Programmer)

Special Thanks:
Jakob Kirchhoff (3D Artist),
S√∂ren Dreesen (Sound Design)

![Image_Sequence_1_007_0000.png](///raw/19c/36/z/6a8be.png)

games.name: Magn√©tico
games.body:
# Magn√©tico
*A game about treasure, magnets, and very pressing debts.*

In **Magn√©tico**, you play as a down-on-his-luck magnet fisherman trying to pay off a hefty debt to the cartel. 
With only 3 days to scavenge $500 from the murky rivers of Mexico, 
you‚Äôll need luck, precision, and a sharp eye for detail.

Toss your magnet into the water in search of ancient Aztec treasures‚Äîbut beware! Not everything that shines is gold. 
Some finds are authentic artifacts, others are cheap souvenirs, or worse‚Äîconvincing fakes. 
You‚Äôll have to carefully inspect each item before deciding to cash it in‚Ä¶

**Can you survive the week, or will the cartel come collecting?**


## [Play in browser!](https://yoavkagan.itch.io/magnetico)


## ‚ö†Ô∏è Note  
- Web build had some issues, for a better fishing experience we recommend playing the **Windows build** ‚Äî sorry!  
- Also‚Ä¶ we had to rush the ending for the deadline, so **there's no quit button** üòÖ  
(Alt+F4 works great though.)


![ScreenShot1.png](///raw/7bf/06/z/6b15b.png)

![ScreenShot2.png](///raw/7bf/06/z/6b156.png)
---

## üéÆ Gameplay  
- Fish for hidden relics with your trusty magnet  
- Inspect items for clues of authenticity  
- Decide what‚Äôs real and what‚Äôs junk  
- Sell treasures to build your fortune‚Ä¶ or fall short  
- You have 3 days. No second chances.

---

## üïπ Controls  
- **Mouse only**  
- **Hold left click** to throw the magnet and fish

---

When in Drilling Mech:

## Post-Mortem
This was our first time working with Godot, coming from Unity and Unreal Engine! Right now the game is essentially a walking simulator with a cool (but admittedly a tad jank) mech to play around with. We'd envisioned a fuel system where the player would need to exit the mech and gather fuel to continue the journey, but alas Game Jam's gonna Game Jam. (The mech still has fuel, but it'll take a long time to drain it all) Perhaps we'll revisit/finish this, I really like this character controller and enjoyed Godot and especially gdscript way more than I imagined I would. Hope you have fun playing around with it!

games.name: Further Below
games.body:
![FB-logo.png](///raw/64d/z/6a6ed.png)
## Over a year spent in a deep sea base that's now being decommissioned, and you're the last one left. Surely the submarine that's due to arrive tomorrow will pick you up.

This is my **9th text adventure** Ludum Dare entry after LD47 and LD50 through to LD56, created in Twine, and my **22nd consecutive Ludum Dare entry** overall. Typo/grammar reports are always welcome.

:warning: I am hearing there are potentially some security warnings because my website is http instead of https. Apologies for that.

### üéÆ [‚û° PLAY 'Further Below'](https://flaterectomy.com/games/Further_Below/) (WEB)

 

---

### :joystick: Controls/How To Play
* Things are pretty basic: you click on options, preferably if that option makes sense to you.
* Access audio volume options in the side-panel menu on the left.

![screen1.png](///raw/64d/z/6a711.png)

---

### :exclamation: Notes
* Created with [Twine](https://twinery.org/), using [HAL v2.3.0.](https://github.com/ChapelR/harlowe-audio/releases/tag/v2.3.0), and audio made in [FL Studio](https://www.image-line.com/).

![screen2.png](///raw/64d/z/6a712.png)

---

### :family_mmb: Credits

-  @flaterectomy | code, art, writing & audio | [bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/flaterectomy.bsky.social), [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCn1zg3Jdr8LNnulISBtQs6w), [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/7n5TRXaiwRGhk0e1dVfV8A?si=EeDge30qRsGdf_RPDSNwMA), [Bandcamp](https://flaterectomy.bandcamp.com/), [website](http://www.flaterectomy.com), [portfolio](http://portfolio.flaterectomy.com)

---

### :notebook_with_decorative_cover: Blog Posts

* [Pre-LD: Wallpaper](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/57/$408204/in-it-i-am-or-will-be)

---

games.name: Miku Miku Dungeon! Penguin Ice Rescue
games.body:
![MikuMikuDungeonLogo.png](///raw/230/53/z/6b389.png)

Save penguins in this silly RPG featuring Penguin Miku!

The Town of Klondike is home the noble penguins, where they work hard to delve into the depths of the ice caverns, looking for wealth and riches. A dangerous job, many penguins are lost within the icy caverns.

![Pascal_Cant_Hear.png](///raw/230/53/z/6b381.png)

Enter Hatsune Miku and her ally, Pascal the Penguineer. Hatsune Miku must descend into the icy depths and rescue the noble penguins... but wait.. something nefarious is happening!!

You're a rabbit and you are moving to Australia trough the DEPTHS of the planet. Many dangers lie ahead, but luckily you're armed with a grappling hook (RMB) and a rocket launcher (LMB) which also serve as your only mobility options!

games.name: Descent Protocol
games.body:
Deeper and deeper and deeper we go.
Some interesting plants were discovered in the remains of an abandoned facility. We are ready to pay you a hefty sum if you bring some of them back to us. 
Brave your way through the overgrown corridors and vast caves to collect all the marked samples of this weird flora.
We heard you're good with a rope - I'll bet it will come in handy in this endeavour.

![0-1.png](///raw/127/25/z/6aa92.png)

**Controls**

On feet:
- Move - A,D
- Jump - Space
- Aim - Mouse
- Launch grappling hook - LMB

On the rope:
- Swinging - A,D
- Up/Down - W,S
- Jump off - Space

Menu - Esc


**Troubleshooting**

If you have any error messages during the first launch of the game, you need to install UE Prerequisites first. You can find them in DescentProtocol\Engine\Extra\Redist\en-us\UEPrereqSetup_x64.exe

Escape the Depths is an adventure game where you have to mine you way through the underground and fight enemies along the way. Can you find the exit portal and escape?

Play it here or on itch.io. (Fullscreen recommended)

games.name: Depths of Darvasa 2
games.body:
![Created with GameMaker 4_7_2025 9_44_29 PM.png](///raw/693/2/z/6b113.png)
![Created with GameMaker 4_7_2025 9_46_27 PM.png](///raw/693/2/z/6b114.png)
![Created with GameMaker 4_7_2025 9_46_57 PM.png](///raw/693/2/z/6b116.png)

### A Sequel?? 
Depths of Darvasa 2 is a direct sequel to our game jam game we made back for Ludum Dare 48. 
You don't need to play the first game to understand the events of this game. But if you'd like to know where it started, check it out [here](https://ldjam.com/events/ludum-dare/48/depths-of-darvaza)! 

### How to play
You can use either keyboard or gamepad. It should detect both PS5 and Xbox controllers. I haven't tested it with older controllers but they should work.

Move     - Arrow Keys or DPAD/Left Analog stick.  
Shoot    - Z Key or the X button  
Jump     - Space bar or the A button  
Interact - X Key or the B button   


### Story so far...
Darvasa is home to a corporate mining industry. Recently, there's been an explosion at one of the facilities. It's your job as a member of the Conflict Resolution Outfit Unit to determine the cause of the accident, descend into the depths of Darvasa once again and find the foreman in charge of the operation. If he's still alive... 

### Credits
Skawly for the cover art <3   
Conduit for the voice acting and amazing OST!  
Jeremy and Dalton for hanging out while we worked on the jam.   
Tony for helping me play test the initial build!   
AND YOU, for taking the time to play my game. Thanks!

games.name: The Depths of Science
games.body:
The Depths of Science
After a war between humans and machines, the world has fallen under the control of robots. Only a few humans have survived.
You are the chosen one - the last hope to end the reign of the machines.
It is said that the self-destruction button lies deep within their heavily guarded laboratory.
Now, you have the chance to free humanity.
All you need to do is go deep enough to find what you seek.

In this game your only goal is to get the furthest down. But be careful: The robots wait!

Controls: WASD - move
Mouse - look around and shoot

games.name: Diamond Dive
games.body:
Dive for diamonds and don't get crushed by spikes!
Try to gather as many diamonds as possible in the shortest amount of time.

![cover.png](///raw/d7b/16/z/69a58.png)

NOTE: This game is incomplete, I stopped working on it before the time ran out for the compo.

Bug fixes: (after 48h)
* Rev2: fixes a hidden diamond collection bug inflating diamond count

No Audio

Controls:
* keyboard or xbox 360 compatible controller
* wasd/left stick - move
* j/A button   - accept

Like my previous entry, this is build in a custom C like programming language for windows using OpenGL.
I am reusing a lot of code for rendering and other systems from a previous project, the gameplay and presentation however was done from scratch.

I'm not doing the compo since I am not gonna share my whole codebase, since I'm using it for future commercial projects. (this includes my compiler for my custom language and my game dev framework that I build up so far)

*Free Palestine!*

games.name: Depth Gem
games.body:
Descend into caverns to collect gems under a time limit!

### [Click to play here!](https://html-classic.itch.zone/html/13315467/index.html)

- Use the left/right arrows to move around
- Use Z to jump

![depth_gem_2.png](///raw/109/46/z/6b1a8.png)

- Use X to mine gems, if you can reach them
- Hit the switch at the end of the cavern to unlock the exit
- Take a risk and mine gems while the cavern collapses for a bonus multiplier

After every round, you'll have an opportunity to regain any lives you lost by spending gems. Be careful with how you explore caverns and try to collect more gems each run!

![depth_gem_3.png](///raw/109/46/z/6b1ab.png)

games.name: Blackwater Depths
games.body:
Your mission is simple - reach the anomaly detected deep within this submerged cave system.
No contact has been made since the signal appeared. No explanations. No return transmissions.
Your vessel, though small, is built to withstand the crushing depths. You, however... are untested.

Descend carefully.
Avoid hostile fauna.

games.name: Fantascope Chasm
games.body:
Will update more info here when packaging / last minute bugfixes are complete!

Will also be adding HTML5 and Windows binaries soon!

Update 4/8/25 3:46am CDT:
Added HTML5 Export as well as Windows, along with bugfixed Linux version

 Finished massive bugfix session. The main culprit was the health restoration hearts were being spawned on an incorrect parent node causing, but not limited to:
 - Random crashes
 - Index out of bounds
 - Layers that should stop spinning to keep spinning
 - Gates to next depth layer not opening when triggered
 - Final boss to not spawn
 - Other misc issues and corrections


Since during the Jam we never implemented settings, credits, or how to play, how to play:

Mouse to aim, W to move towards mouse, S to move away from mouse. Left mouse for melee attack, right mouse for ranged. There is a short cooldown on melee and you have limited Mana (which regens over time) for ranged attacks.

When moving down layers, you will sometimes YEET across the screen, this is due to the game deciding that you were in an unwalkable area and relocating you (sometimes violently) to a walkable area.

games.name: Are you smarter than a fisherman?
games.body: You are a hungry fish eating other fish. But watch out, the fishermen are trying to catch and eat you. They may seem stupid at first, using simple worms to catch you. After a while, they become smarter and start using fake fish as a bait. It's up to you to find out the differences in behaviour so you won't get caught. Every fish you eat counts.

games.name: The Undead
games.body:
Enemies are storming your base, but you're not just shooting back‚Äîyou‚Äôre building your defense while blasting away! In this top-down shooter meets tower defense hybrid, every shot counts, and every tower matters. Can you hold the line and survive the onslaught, or will the wave of chaos overwhelm you? Get ready to defend, shoot, and strategize your way to victory!


## Controls  
- Place a turret if enough money is available (**E Key**)  
- Move player forward or backwards (**W/S Keys**)  
- Strafes player left or right (**A/D Keys**)  
- Fire bullets (**Left Mouse or spacebar**)  

## Game Round
1. Each round starts with a quiet period where you can place turrets and collect dropped coins
2. Next, a new wave of enemies begins. Survive until the last enemy is destroyed and move onto the next game round; Die and its game over.

games.name: Turtles All The Way Down
games.body:
Turtles All The Way Down is a surrealistic rage platformer, where you play as Turt Le Turtle and try to discover the depths of the ocean.

Controls: M1 to launch yourself.

Turt has two dashes that reset by colliding with the platforms.

Normal platform: Safest in the game.

Fish: Sideways movement, you can ride them.

Propeller: Collision on all sides, can be climbed easily.

Naval mine: Explodes and launches you when landed on, still grants you your 2 dashes back.

Coding: Vertti 

Music, sound design and director of photography: Julle 

Concept: Vertti, Julle and Mansku 

Drawing: Mansku

games.name: Echoes of the Deep
games.body:
**Echoes of the Deep** is a deep-sea exploration and survival game that plunges you into a mysterious ocean abyss. Pilot a specialized submersible through caves and corals, where every echo hints at hidden dangers. Balance oxygen and Health to stay alive amid looming threats‚Äînatural and otherwise. Explore the Depth to Find Objects and Grow in your Journey of Deep Sea Diving. Will you brave the silence and discover the truth hidden beneath the waves?

https://youtu.be/8H0T6_0A9-Y

Built Game has been Uploaded on to the source code. Check It Out.
**Controls:**

Mouse Left/Right click to Pick Up Objects  
Approach the Shelf and Click F to Open Shop and G to Close Shop  
To Sell Items - Click button to sell  
Press U to place picked object to inventory  
Press I to open Inventory  

**Swimming Controls:**

Press Ctrl to Descend down  
Press SpaceBar to Ascend Up  
WASD to Move  
Hold Shift to Swim Fast  

**Walking Control**

WASD to Move  
Space to Jump

games.name: Darkest Depths
games.body:
The roguelite auto-battler inspired by Darkest Dungeon.

Assemble and grow the right team of greedy adventurers and find your next fortune. Reach the deepest and darkest depths you can.

---

Controls:

- Hire heroes to build the right team
- Let them battle through the monsters for you
- Level up your heroes to get stronger every dive
- Keep the team topped up with potions
- Flee the depths at the right time to avoid a loss
- Manage dungeon runs to avoid stress-related injuries

---

I may occassionally release small updates which fix or polish some things. I've tagged that build as the post-jam version so feel free to either check out the original or the improved submission :)

**Important Note**

games.name: U-251
games.body:
## U-251

> The year is 1945.
> The war has been lost.
> You have been tasked to transport
> the imperial Gold treasure into safety,
> to a secret base in Antarctica.


Escape the allied forces in this Bullet hell/Stealth game. Decide carefully if you want to rush on the waves or take a deeper, less dangerous route but which drains your pressure and is littered with minefields.
The game is not completed but still challenging to beat.

### Controls

- Use WASD to move around on the map. You can only turn while moving.
- Use Q+E to move up and down. Use the right height bar to check for enemy mines, torpedos and the ground.
- Use Page up + Page down to zoom
- Use SPACE to spawn a noisemaker attracting the enemy torpedos in range (5s cooldown)

TIP: don't run into or (to) near the coast

**DISCLAIMER:** This game uses some elements of conspiracy theorys as a lore element. This is not due to us belivieving in them but to poke fun of them.

### Thanks
Since we are not good at sound or music design we used open art created by the following persons on OpenGameArt.org:
- Ove Melaa
- Scribe
- Chabull

Heightmap data has been rendered using
`https://tangrams.github.io/heightmapper`

games.name: SUNK
games.body:
## üéØ Description
If you're having some friends over and you don't know what to do, then our game is for you! SUNK is a local multiplayer game where you compete with others who is the best treasure hunter! But be careful, since you ALL share the same oxygen reservoir and you increase oxygen consumption FOR EVERYONE with each treasure you carry! Return to the submarine with your treasures to secure them into the next round! But be careful, because when you return to the sub, you have to wait for the next dive to collect more, AND you no longer use the oxygen tank, giving your rivals more time to find even better treasure!  

---

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Warnings & Mechanics
- **Oxygen System**  
  ‚ùó Watch out for your **shared oxygen**!  
  ‚ö° **The more treasure you carry:**  
  - üê¢ The **slower you swim**  
  - üèãÔ∏è‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è The **more oxygen is used FOR EVERYONE** 
- ü•á So be sure to bring the treasure you collected to the sub **BEFORE OXYGEN RUNS OUT!** 
- ü§ø But don't be too careful! When you return to the sub you no longer consume oxygen, giving your rivals more time to bring treasure!
- 3Ô∏è‚É£ There will be 3 rounds of dives, each dive going deeper than the last!
- **Treasure Depth**  
  üîª **The deeper you go**, the **better the treasure!** 

 

---

## üéÆ Controls
| Player       | Movement Keys       |
|--------------|---------------------|
| **Player 1** | `W` `A` `S` `D`     |
| **Player 2** | `Arrow Keys` (‚Üë‚Üì‚Üê‚Üí) |
| **Players 3 & 4** | Controller `Left Stick` |

---
## üë• **Development Team**

| **Programmer**  | @Urosh   |  
| **Audio Design** | @Acetisal     |  
| **Sprite Art**  | @Pecurka      |  
| **Sprite Art**  | @Vlahovic     |  

---


üöÄ **Good luck, divers!**

games.name: SINK.
games.body:
An underwater welder is tasked with travelling to the base of a oil rig to perform maintenance, but the way down is treacherous and one misstep could sever The Diver's precious lifeline.

![scrnshot0.png](///raw/bd1/46/z/6b091.png)

![scrnshot1.png](///raw/bd1/46/z/6b040.png)

![scrnshot2.png](///raw/bd1/46/z/6b042.png)

*SINK.* is an underwater 2.5d platformer made in HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS with no libraries and no engine. All the art, for better or worse, was also made by me.

**Tech**
- Languages: JS, HTML, CSS
- Editor: Visual Studio Code
- Art Programs: Krita, Photopea

**Controls**
- Click Play to start
- A and D to move left and right
- W and S to move forward and back
- Space Bar to jump
- T to weld an anchor for your tether

*Disclaimer: This is my first Game Jam, and I bit off a bit more than I could chew with the limitations I set for myself.  I had plans for sound, a storyline, and of course a proper ending, but they were pushed aside in favor of how much time I had to put into the physics and graphics. Live and learn.*

games.name: Gemsweeper
games.body:
Minesweeper meets deep-rock excavation!

Carefully excavate a crumbling mine in search of gems, energy, and framing materials. Use arrow keys or WASD to move around and excavate. 

The core mechanic here is that each soil type contributes a different, slightly random amount of strength to both its row and column. If the strength of a column or row ever drops too low, the entire mine collapses and it is game over.

Green gems are the scoring currency. Pink bolts give energy, which is constantly decreasing while moving and even more so when excavating. Orange framing materials let  you automatically shore up an area that would otherwise cause a collapse.

games.body:
![mainscreen.jpg](///raw/38a/3/z/6a5d5.jpg)

"Commander, today is the day. After years of research, experimentation and construction the submarine is ready. This submarine will take you to the unknowns of the world: the bottom of the ocean. Will you help humanity achieve this milestone?"

In Pressure Depths you must reach the bottom of the ocean. This will not be easy! You will need to fix, correct or calibrate things in order to keep moving. If you make mistakes, or are too slow you will cause hull breaches. Too many breaches will cause the ship to explode, losing the game.

When things need fixing an alert will show. Get there as fast as possible!

Pressure of the Depths is a puzzle game in which you must keep a submarine operational to reach the bottom of the ocean. Can you help mankind to this achievement?

Move around with wasd + space to jump. Interact with E.

You can play the game on itch.io!

All assets are made by ourselves, only the ambient background sound and the alarm are royalty free assets.

We strongly advise to play with sound on!

games.name: MESSIER 104 CBH
games.body:
An arcade style game where you control a **SPACESHIP** flying around a **BLACK HOLE** while trying to survive and collect as much score as possible. 

**Disclaimer**: The HTML embed here is a bit buggy, go to the [itch.io page](https://kuboi.itch.io/messier-104-cbh) for a smoother HTML experience

![screenshot1.png](///raw/632/46/z/6a5a8.png)

## How To Play

![screenshot4.png](///raw/632/46/z/6a5bf.png)

### Controls

![screenshot5.png](///raw/632/46/z/6a9eb.png)

## Mechanics

### The Ship
The ship is the character you are controlling.
* The ship has **HEALTH** - loses some health if it gets hit by an **ASTEROID**
* The ship has **FUEL** - loses fuel when accelerating

### The Black Hole
The black hole keeps pulling you and other object towards it.
* Grows with time - The bigger it is the harder it pulls
* If you get sucked in it's an instant game over
* The black hole has a **max size**
    * There is a little *surprise* awaiting you if the black hole reaches it;)

### Asteroids
Asteroids get pulled by the **BLACK HOLE**, try to avoid them.
* If you get hit you get knocked back and lose a bit of **HEALTH**
* The bigger the asteroid, the bigger the knockback and damage dealt to your **SHIP**

### Orb Pickups
Between the **ASTEROIDS** are also some shiny orbs getting pulled by the **BLACK HOLE**, you can pick those up!
![screenshot2.png](///raw/632/46/z/6a5ae.png)

## Scoring

### Score
You collect score from the **SCORE ORBS**. High score is saved and you can have fun trying to beat it!

*Dev highscore: 52*

### Time
The time you stay alive gets tracked on the screen. This is currently not being saved, so just try to remember your best 

*Dev highscore: 04:34*

## Dev Notes
* Will add an itch.io page soon
* I have plans on increasing the scope of the game in the future, had to cut some ideas because of the time frame

games.body:
![Cover.png](///raw/e3a/36/z/6ac45.png)

It was just one of those questions that people ask each other to be polite. To be nice. To be friendly.



But sometimes, simple things can cause buried bones to shift towards the surface - or sink you deep into the dirt with them. Or maybe it's all just fun and games, and you're just too sensitive... yeah, maybe that's it.



Down the Rabbit Hole follows Violet as she tumbles through the depths of her mind and finds herself reliving past encounters in new, nightmarish dimensions. A story about recovering from toxic relationships by doing battle with those you once cared about most: new friends, old friends... and yours

games.name: DEEP DEEP DIG DIG
games.body:
# DEEP DEEP DIG DIG

![title.png](///raw/72e/7/z/6a71e.png)

## üìó LORE

There is **always** one more persistent than the others.
Pushing you to your limits, desesperate to excavate what that could be stuck for eternity, hiding in dark depths nether to be reach by the humankind. 
You're supposed to be the hunter, so why the prey seems to have all the power?
Yes I'm talking about the unspeakable:
The persistent booger...

But today... **table turns**.

**YOU ARE THE ALMIGHTY BOOGER!**

![1.jpeg](///raw/72e/7/z/6a71f.jpg)

## *Ô∏è‚É£GOALS

Your goals are simple:
- **Evade** the menacing finger
- **Fuel** your way by collecting your green brethen
- **KEEP. GOING. DEEPER.** üöÄ
- Be crowned as the **best booger on the planet** *(online leaderboard)*

![2.jpeg](///raw/72e/7/z/6a720.jpg)

## üïπÔ∏èControls :

**Hold and release** to propulse yourself.  
The longer the further.  
This will consume part of yourself.  
**That's it.**  


***Tips:***
- Collect **green mini boogers** üü¢ to fuel yourself and **raise your combo** multiplicator
- Don't hit hairball (reset your counter)
- Don't get stuck in the hair on the "wall"
- Score is based on distance traveled and combo
- *You might want to hear the music when your combo is high...*
 

## TEAM

We were a team of 3 for this one. 

- Quentin Ferr√© - swiss army knife talent *(lots of art, lots of design, some prog, few sounds)*
- Yannick Montes - code or die 
- Adrien Coppola - just listen to the music, and google his name. Or his youtube.


## CREDITS

Melted Monster by Dm Letter Studio - Dimas Prasetyo https://www.dafont.com/melted-monster.font

games.name: Depths
games.body:
![New_Project_66.png](///raw/d23/46/z/69f9a.png)
Can you escape what you can't see?

Trapped in total darkness, your only tool is sound.
Use sonar pulses to illuminate your surroundings‚Äî
invisible walls, lurking enemies, secret passages, and ancient puzzles
hidden deep within the cave.

Every pulse reveals the world around you‚Ä¶
but also reveals you.
Some things down here don‚Äôt like being found.

Controls:

WASD ‚Äì Move
SPACE ‚Äì Jump
E ‚Äì Emit Sonar Pulse
Left Click ‚Äì Interact
ESC ‚Äì Settings
Scan wisely. Think carefully. Escape‚Ä¶ if you can.
The cave is listening.

Made by:
AlexRak2
TJ
Twest
Hoistenize

games.body: I would really appreciate it if you rate my game.

games.name: THE ABYSS CALLS
games.body:
In our game you explore a region of the far out sea in small submarine trying the find the cause of the mysterious disappearance of ships. Since this is the first videogame we've ever made we'd be happy for Feedback!

To run the game execute the .exe file in the dist folder in the .zip, or run the the_abyss_calls.py file on the branch huan-son in our git repo.


## Controls:

###  W S A D : Movement
 
###  Space   : Shooting

games.name: Metro Solitaire
games.body:
"Solitaire: A Journey through the Moscow Metro"

Lay out the cards that depict real architectural masterpieces! You will find not just solitaire, but an exciting journey through the legendary metro stations of Moscow.

Feel the lively pulse of the metropolis:

💙 Relaxing gameplay of the classic "Klondike Solitaire" with meditative music

💙 A collection of 52 stations ‚Äî from the Soviet beginning to modern delights

Ideal for those who love Moscow, appreciate cozy games and just want to relax. Can you win? It's time to find out the answer.

Start the game - let each move become a step through time and beauty! 🚇 🌟

Made for ludum dare 57 after deciding that we will in fact be the one to determine our game's depth.

games.name: In Focus
games.body:
## Introduction
In Focus is a small puzzle game where you are trying to solve levels by moving the player character(s) to a star and adjusting your depth of field to do so.

Designing puzzles is hard so they are very easy and this submission is more of an interesting twist compared to other top down puzzles (or at least I have not come across a similar one).


## Controls
- WASD - Move
- Scroll Wheel - Adjust depth of field (have objects go in and out of focus and therefore interactable/controllable)
- R - Restart level!


![Screenshot2.png](///raw/2e8/42/z/6a881.png)


## Closing Words
Please let me know your thoughts on the idea as I may just be blinded by this being my own creation and thinking that the idea is better than it is in reality. I hope you'll enjoy my little game!

games.name: Oh Look, Squids and Boulders
games.body:
First game and first game jam. I didn't really like the engine that I used, and I only had 2 days to make it, but I made something, and that's good enough for me. 
You're on a boat, there's squids and boulders; don't touch 'em. That's it.

Itch version, 'cause it was made it Godot: https://trudgle.itch.io/oh-look-squids-and-boulders

games.name: Dig, Dug, Doug
games.body: The evil **Drill Society** has infiltrated **Doug the Mole's** cave and they're trying to steal his meticulously accumulated crystal collection. Help him dig into the depths of the underground in order to bury these criminals six feet deep once and for all!

games.name: Digger 3D
games.body:
![Image Sequence_003_0000.jpg](///raw/e4d/3/z/6b1e9.jpg)

# A simple game about digging. How creative!

This was more of an experimentation game. Got the oportunity to try creating a 3D pathfinding using Unity DOTS and to use the new Behavior package for the enemy AI. Also, the map uses a procedural mesh similar to Minecraft.

To play, unzip the files into a folder and execute the .exe.

## Controls:

- WASD: Move
- Space/Click: Dig Forward
- Q: Dig down
- E: Dig up

Try to collect as much gold as you can!

games.name: Into the Depths
games.body:
Into the Depths is a solo, push-your-luck, campaign card game. It's analog, meaning you'll need a surface and a standard deck of cards to play. Something to write with and on is needed, too, but you can use a digital notepad or Google Doc or whatever.
# Do You Dare Enter the Depths?
As shopkeeper and owner of The Summit Shop, at the foot of the Mountainy mountains, you struggle to earn enough to survive. One day, you discover an old mine that's full of trinkets and goodies.

After earning enough to comfortably make it through the week, you discover a crack that leads deeper. And deeper. And even deeper...

With each new area comes more valuable trinkets, but also a shadowy figure determined to make you leave. And a drill-powered crystal of darkness. Mysteries surround you, but all you care about is that you get MORE...
# No Printing Required
While this IS an analog game, you don't have to print anything. I do recommend opening the PDF twice, though: once to follow along with the game, and again to check on the card effects (after you reach chapter two).
# This Is a LONG Game, But You Can Make It Shorter
Playing through the entire game should take an estimated 2-3 hours total, but may take more or less time depending on your reading speed. The document is 40 pages long, including the cover and table of contents: about 2/3 narrative and 1/3 rules for playing through the five chapters. The full game also requires playing through most, if not all, of the first four chapters at least once.

To make the game shorter, you may pretend you've failed at each chapter as many times as necessary to unlock all of the upgrades to your boons for that chapter. Doing so does skip over part of the meaning of the game, though, and detracts from the experience. The game is purposely set up to be very difficult at the beginning of each chapter, then get easier and easier, both to capture the repetitive nature of mining and also to show you that repeating something makes you better at it. Even when luck is a huge part of the driving force.

games.name: Depth Defying
games.body:
A game inspired by the nutty putty cave incident (sorry in advance for people who don't know what this was). Hold onto your breath and traverse through a tricky cave system in pitch black. Try not to panic (try hitting space bar a couple of times to steady your breathing), use left click (on the ground next to the player)to crawl through the cave and get to the end.!

 This is me and my best friend's first game jam ever, and we used this jam to learn godot, game design/sound design and interacting with GDScript.I've used godot sparingly in the past, but this is my bestie's first time, so pls be kind lol. The game still has a couple of quirks and bugs here and there, so we apologize in advance

We really enjoyed the process and I hope you enjoyed the game <3, excuse us for the shit art

Ty KenneyNL for the free player sprite `![Gameplay.PNG](///raw/826/84/z/6acfa.png)![Menu.PNG](///raw/826/84/z/6acfd.png)

games.name: ProfundiDUDE - In Search Of Planet Telex
games.body:
Dude, the intergalactic pilot, sets off on an adventure in search of the mysterious Planet Telex ‚Äî a place he first discovered in the lyrics of a Radiohead song. Is the planet real, or merely a creation of the British rock band‚Äôs imagination?

Face off against space pirates, dodge asteroids, and have your entire perception of reality twisted before your eyes as you plunge into the abyssal depths of outer space in ProfundiDUDE.![Captura_de_Tela_83.png](///raw/75f/e5/z/6af56.png)![2.png](///raw/75f/e5/z/6aea8.png)![Captura_de_Tela_78.png](///raw/75f/e5/z/6aeae.png)
