games.body:
![PosterDeepInTheInternet.png](///raw/539/36/z/6a26b.png)
Deep in the Internet is a simple game about avoiding pop-ups

After you try to buy a really anticipated and expensive game without money a conveniently timed pop up that offers the game for free shows itself, you click it in desperation...

This is our first Ludum Dare Gamejam and for three of us the first time developing a game, any kind comments and feedback are appreciated!

games.name: Apprehension
games.body:
**Depth**... Are you descending into a dungeon, or diving deep into your own soul?



Explore a dark labyrinth in this short horror experience with procedurally generated levels. We had big plans for tons of cool mechanics, but in the end, we focused just on delivering the horror atmosphere. Hope you enjoy it!


‚ö†Ô∏è **WARNING: Contains jump scares (not very loud)**


üéß IMPORTANT: Sound is a core gameplay mechanic ‚Äî make sure to play with sound on (ideally with headphones)!


‚ö†Ô∏è NOTE: Our shaders broke in the Web version, so the retro filter isn't working there. If you want the full terrifying atmosphere, please download the Windows build ‚Äî it‚Äôs quick and totally worth it! ^-^


**If you're playing the Web version ‚Äî make sure to switch to fullscreen!**



**CONTROLS**

W ‚Äî Move forward

A/D ‚Äî Turn left/right

E ‚Äî Interact

G ‚Äî Equip camera

Space ‚Äî Use camera




Everything in this game was created by our team:


**DEVELOPERS**


**GreenRadiation** ‚Äî concept, game design, programming, management

**Onezerox** ‚Äî programming

**Pfannkuchen** ‚Äî all visuals and sound setup

**Marynka** ‚Äî recorded all sounds and composed all music




*P.S. We also made a little devlog!*

![Concepts.png](///raw/8ee/91/z/6ad67.png)

games.name: Fill the depths
games.body:
![Second gif.gif](///raw/b28/36/z/6a63c.gif)

# Description
Death has come for the dinosaurs because their time has come to an end. Use the scythe to launch them into the depths of the earth, where they will become oil, a valuable resource for future generations.

![first gif.gif](///raw/b28/36/z/6a637.gif)

# Controls
LMB - launch the scythe

![giffff.gif](///raw/b28/36/z/6a674.gif)

# Mechanics
Hit the dinosaurs with the scythe repeatedly to fill the oil gauge. The more bounces you get, the more oil is produced.

games.name: Sinking Hope
games.body:
During a deep sea expedition, your submarine is suddenly attacked, and your coworker's submarine is swallowed hole. Sea monsters tear into your ship, eating parts off of it, and sinking it. Desperate, and stranded at the bottom of the ocean, you must use a metal detector and an ancient trident to find the missing parts of your submarine, and repair it by any means necessary.


|      Controls       |                |
| ------------------- | -------------- |
| **Interact**            |  E|
| **Tab**       | Metal Detector|
| **L-Mouse**       | Attack|
| **R-Mouse**       | Aim|
| **L-Shift**       | Dash|

games.name: Hoard
games.body:
"Oh, what is it you want? I'm pretty sure I have one of those here somewhere... Let me dig down in here and see..."  
Boxes of a given shape and color appear on the left. You need to deliver a particular item to the right. Partial matches give some points, but more are given for a perfect match. How deep will you dig to find what you need?

Controls:  
WASD/Arrow Keys: Move around the board  
QE: Turn Left or Right  
Space: Pick up or drop off an item

games.name: Explorem Ipsum: Catacombs of Time
games.body:
## Explore the mysterious Catacombs by collecting 4 mystical puzzle-solving artifacts!

* The Anchor of Xyzzy, an ancient relic that enables teleportation.
* The Hook Device, ancient technology for short traversal and remote object acquisition.
* The Switch Gizmo, a strange contraption that swaps your place with another object.
* And finally, the Capture Gauntlet, which allows you to put large heavy objects into your pocket.

## Controls
* Move: WASD or Arrow Keys
* Action: [Z / X] or [Space / Shift]

## Level Editor
The level editor was made during the jam! It's not super intuitive to use but it was good enough to make all the content in this game :sweat_smile: 

![133885587800196444.png](///raw/993/1/z/6b38c.png)

games.name: Kataboshti
games.body:
You are a cockroach. Not just any cockroach ‚Äî one that spins, gathers filth, and forces its way through with sheer grime-powered momentum.

In Kataboshti, you explore grotesque organic environments in third-person view. Press the spacebar to spin on the spot, collecting dirt and debris as you go. The more you gather, the bigger your disgusting ball becomes. Once it's ready, dash forward and smash through whatever's in your way.

Across three increasingly weird stages, you‚Äôll face physics-based challenges that require creativity and stubbornness. No lives. No Game Over. Just you, the dirt, and a strange journey ahead.

The more you spin, the weirder it gets.

‚Äî

Team: Djosef Wytemalhos, Eric Dantas & Sabrina Lacerda.!![Captura de Tela 2025-04-07 aÃÄs 21.13.04.png](///raw/036/46/z/6ae95.png)![Captura de Tela 2025-04-07 aÃÄs 21.12.18.png](///raw/036/46/z/6ae9b.png)![Captura de Tela 2025-04-07 aÃÄs 21.15.30.png](///raw/036/46/z/6aea5.png)

games.name: Fixey 2 (VR Only)
games.body:
![chrome_N795MthH7T.png](///raw/f58/z/6a4eb.png)
Fixey 2 is a quirky underwater repair simulator. 
![vlc_x9vXa1fimx.png](///raw/f58/z/6a4ec.png)
In this game, you take on the role of a technician tasked with patching up leaks and keeping a submerged substation running under pressure. 
![vlc_KH08RRPmDy.png](///raw/f58/z/6a4ed.png)
With a series of test chambers that gradually ramp up in complexity, you'll use your skills to plug in power, twist valves, and even operate a remote robot arm, all while a snarky overseer keeps you in check.
![vlc_HUZK8xIGc8.png](///raw/f58/z/6a4ee.png)
Built using OpenXR, it is optimized for any SteamVR headset with smooth locomotion and convenient long-distance grabbing to ease your underwater repairs. 
![vlc_2LgGKLU6Lh.png](///raw/f58/z/6a4ef.png)
Android builds for Quest, Pico, and Vive XR Elite are coming soon, so stay tuned!

Dive in, fix up, and see if you have what it takes to keep everything from going underwater!

Average runtime: ~15 minutes

The art has some rough edges in a few places because I ran out of time!

games.name: Cavers Cantina
games.body:
## Note that the embed doesn't seem to be working properly on this site, but it works fine at kristinamay.itch.io/cavers-cantina

You are the proprietor of Cavers Cantina, a place where adventurers and other cave explorers find the potions and food they need to succeed. Unlock new tools and ingredients to help them! Play it here or at kristinamay.itch.io/cavers-cantina !

Each time an adventurer visits, they will have a specific request that will tell you what kind of food or drink they are looking for.

![Screenshot 2025-04-07 193317.png](///raw/2d1/f1/z/6ab8e.png)

Click and drag items from storage to the food/drink appliance you choose. Every recipe uses two (and only two) ingredients.

Don‚Äôt forget to check out the encyclopedia (‚Äòe‚Äô) to see a list of all the ingredients and recipes you have discovered so far.

Discover all 50 potions to help all 10 (or 11??) unique customers get through the caves alive!

## --Dev notes--

UGH THIS GAME. I was much too ambitious so I ended up with a game that, while fully finished and playable from end to end, was missing a number of features I intended to implement. So, when you're playing, if you think, "gee this would be better if X" I probably meant to do it and ran out of time.

This was a solo dev effort, just not enough time to get everything wrangled for the compo. So, since I was submitting for the jam anyway, I decided to get some cool free sfx in there!


If anyone needs a mac or windows build instead of html5, please lmk and I can get one up.

## --Credits--

All art, code, and game design
made by kristinamay
for Ludum Dare 57

font is ‚ÄòMacondo‚Äô (fonts.google.com)

thanks to my playtester Matt!

games.name: Quackscape
games.body:
You're a duck in a barrel at the bottom of the ocean. Paddle fast, dodge danger, and swim your way to the surface before your air runs out!

developers: lu dughetti, cata orgniani, emiliano martel

games.name: Unfortunate Mishaps of Subsurface Uranium Mining
games.body:
Unfortunate Mishaps of Subsurface Uranium Mining is a wacky game where you need to steer your drill deeper and deeper while managing critical resources to keep the mission going. Your goal is to collect as much uranium as possible. Do it while managing oxygen and temperature levels, refilling your fuel, repairing the drill and putting down fires.

Controls and gameplay:

- Use **WASD** to move and mouse to look around.
- Pick up or use objects with **LMB** and throw with **RMB**.
- Collect minerals and avoid obstacles using the **Left, Right and Turbo buttons** placed around the central monitor.
- Throw minerals into their respective intakes.
- Put down fires and fix integrity issues with your trusty extinguisher and/or wrench.

Game by CLOWNWORKS

games.name: Neon Wars
games.body:
Neon Wars is a full 3D tower defense game, set far away in the deepest part of space. 

Defend your base tower from hordes of enemy robot soldiers and tanks using laser towers, rocket towers and very cool stun mines! If your tower is sent to the deep, you have lost!

Each defensive structure will cost you money (‚Ç¨), but don't dig too deep in your pockets, as your highscore will equal the money you have left, when the game ends. 



Aim of the game:
- Defend your tower in the middle at all costs

Camera Control:
- Click and hold Mouse 1, then move the mouse.
- Scroll to zoom.

Tower Placement:
- Buy towers by clicking on the icons in the menu to the left.
- Place towers by left-clicking on any block except purple ones.
- Stun mines can only be placed on purple blocks.
- Quick-buy towers/mines using F1‚ÄìF3.

Other:
- Enemies attack in waves ‚Äî be prepared!
- High score is equal to your money (‚Ç¨), so spend it wisely.

games.name: Marianas Miner
games.body:
![title.png](///raw/2df/2/z/6b028.png)

## You have dug too deep!

Mining in the darkest depths of the deepest ocean for sunken treasure, you have unleashed the Cephaloids from the abyss beyond! Escape up to the surface before it's too late!

### Controls

* Arrow Keys / WASD: Move
* Space: Shoot Harpoon
* Escape: Pause

To dig, press against the rock with the directional controls.

Navigate past the top of the map to win.

### Instructions

Navigate your vessel from the depths of the ocean up to the surface. You will need to dig through earth and rock to escape from the undersea caverns.

Your submarine is equipped with a limited supply of harpoons. Harpoons can pin Cephaloids and can even pierce through a whole line of them for a combo bonus. You can pick up your harpoons that missed a Cephaloid, and you can find more harpoons amidst the treasures of the sea.

If a Cephaloid catches you, you lose a life. Your harpoon supply resets to 5 with each life.

Collect treasures and move toward the surface to score points. Extra lives are awarded every 25,000 points.

### Scoring

* Gold: 500 points
* Diamond: 2000 points
* Chest: 5000 points
* Pinning a Cephaloid: 100 points + combo bonus
* Moving toward the surface: 10 points per foot of depth
* **Extra life every 25,000 points**

games.name: Into The Abyss
games.body:
Welcome to Into The Abyss!

The objective of Into The Abyss is to get into the depths of the abyss to discovery what lies beneath...
Level up your own submarine by getting deeper and deeper and unlocking upgrades for your submarine.

You start with base rooms for your submarine and you can change and level them up by specializing them in what you prefer.
This are the types of room available:
 Basic
 Ballast
 Machine Gun
 Cannon
 Flak
 Mechanic
 Armor

You start with Basic rooms but unlock more the deeper you descend Into The Abyss.

Customize your submarine and defeat the enemies blocking your path to the depths

Ballast room:
Building this room allows you to explore the darkness of the abyss more freely, this is one of the most important room available in the game.

Machine Gun:
Shoot the enemies with this good fire rate but limited range and damage.

Armor:
Armored section of the hull, greatly increases HP. Optimal to withstand direct damage.


Repair the rooms by using the Mechanic room: it will start repairing the room over time so watch out and don't go too low on HP. Increasing the level of the room allows to speed up the repairing process to get you faster in the action.

Beware not to get all your rooms destroied as it will result in a game over.

games.name: Sound the Innersea
games.body:
![banner_title.png](///raw/de4/94/z/6afbc.png)

# PLAY

https://tukisboolukis.itch.io/depths

Saturn's sixth largest moon, and the most reflective body in the solar system. Its 20 kilometer thick icy shell hides an ocean. This inner-sea is warm, dark, and teeming with life...

   Your expedition is tasked with breaching the moon's crust and exploring the depths below. The seafloor is believed to rest 10,000 meters below the ice. 

   Assume the controls of your remote submersible. Dive for the seafloor. 
Can you sound the Innersea?

![web_sub.png](///raw/de4/94/z/6b00a.png)


# CONTROLS:

Aim sub: RMB

Shoot weapon: LMB

Swap weapon: SCROLLWHEEL (must be unlocked)

Sonar ping: SHIFT

Thrust: SPACEBAR


# Gameplay

You must manage your sub's HULL and ENERGY while below the ice. ENERGY replenishes automatically while idle.

To repair the HULL, hunt alien GASBAGS for their useful fluids-

You'll need DATA for upgrades. SCAN alien remains by pointing your sub's scanner toward them long enough.

Use your SONAR often to avoid dangerous aliens and upgrade your sub back at BASECAMP when you die.

![screenshot2.png](///raw/de4/94/z/6b232.png)


![screenshot1.png](///raw/de4/94/z/6b235.png)

# Credits

### TukisBoolukis: Coding

### TheSmellofOxygen: Art, SFX, Music

 And ykydowk on cgtrader.com: spotlight effects

# Tools

Godot 4.4

Aseprite

Bitdragon

BFXR

games.body:

You can only go so far before you have to return to the start, but you can use gold you find to buy things to make your adventures easier. **left clicking** on the map will change the a tile to a "room".


**clicking** again will change it to a "path".

**clicking** a third time will make the space empty again.


**click** outside the map will allow you to attack

**E**  interacts with stuff.

If you aren't in range of an interactable, **E** will use a potion instead.

games.name: Grapple to Glory
games.body:
Have you ever thought to yourself, "Self, you know I like to rage at games and Jump King makes me rage a lot. Well, self, what if Jump King was upside down?" 

No? That's just me? Oh well... anyway, the theme was depths and you're in a magic cave trying to grapple down an unforgiving path that wants to blow you

back to the beginning of the map.

Can you meander from grappling spot to grappling spot while trying not to fall into the wind that somehow exists coming from the bottom of a cave?  Can you find the treasure that this mysterious wind is protecting? 

Probably not. This is a game jam and I barely finished. Don't get your hopes up too high.

Anyway, SPACE is action/grapple, move with A and D, boost while swinging with A and D. If you fall too far, you get sent back, so don't fall.

Good luck!

games.name: From The Depths
games.body:
![Screenshot 2025-04-07 203216.jpg](///raw/070/b3/z/6b270.jpg)

## Fight Your way out of the depths of hell!

**Find the boss, kill him, ascend!**

(inspired by The Binding of Isaac)

**Make it to the 5th level to win!**

(Level is shown in the top right corner. I forgot to label it. what's there is for my debugging but it works)
(The game doesn't have a "win" scenario. it just goes on forever)

**LEVELS SCALE!** 

On each level, there are more rooms, more enemies spawn per room and move faster. Health replenishes each floor. Couldn't make health drops :( sorry. I tried.

Controls:

```
W - forward
A - left
S - down
D - right

LMB (Left Mouse Button/click) - Attack - swing sword
RMB (Right Mouse Button/click) - block - raise shield in front of you

To release the mouse, press Alt + Tab (sorry I didn't make it a button)

```

Woo Hoo! Another Solo Jam under my belt. Haven't done it alone since my first Jam! and it's (technically) a full game!... and by that I mean it has 

**Things I wish I could have done:**

1. Health and item drops
2. Different weapons, including bows and other swords
3. different shields with different sizes or weights or something
4. more enemies and bosses - sorry there's only 1 enemy type of each but at least they scale per level
5. Win state - although I do like the infinite version.
6. tweaked enemies
7. better sounds - yeah... my sounds are pretty basic clips of recordings of myself
8. music - ugh this needs it but I lowered the priority on that to get the game out. a few sound effects were last
9. improved environments - yeah they are flat and boring as hell but I was trying to push this through on my own! QQ I wanted to add rocks and textures and torches and spikes and pits and so much more.
10. controller support
11. better player controls. you can't even jump. wasn't critical so I put it off and ended up not having enough time
12. title screen menu and more options. 

Tools used:
Game Engine: Godot
3D stuff: Blender
2D stuff: Piskel (past: LibreSprite/Asperite, inkscape)
audio: Audacity (for simple sound manipulations) (past: LMMS for music composition)

games.name: Through the hell
games.body:
Welcome to the battlefield soldier! You have the honour of being a messenger on the front line. Run across neutral territory through trenches and barbed wire. There is chaos and death everywhere, but remember: victory depends on your speed and luck! Will you be able to fulfil an assignment on which the lives of hundreds of soldiers depend! The spirit of patriotism and agility will help...

The distant echoes of battle recede, then as if the whole reality passes through you. Moments you remember that all this has already happened and now the same order sounds again and again, which repeats from time to time that ‚ÄòThe war will never end‚Äô.

You have the burden of living through the horrors of war again, but this time your soul is at stake. Get to the crisis point and find a way out of this endless hell, because you have an eternity to do it...

__________________________________________________

games.name: Hooky Fish
games.body:
You are an experienced fisherman and your main goal is to catch the mysterious anglerfish, which is famous for its rarity and lives only at the deepest depths. 

Choose your strategies carefully, use different lures and fishing rods to catch anglerfish and prove to everyone that you are the best fisherman in the world! 

The game has a story mode in which you need to catch an anglerfish, and an endless one in which you can compete for the title of the best fisherman with other players.

Turn on your skills, intuition and patience, and let your underwater adventure to the depths begin!

![Ap1hOL.png](///raw/540/b4/z/6b3d9.png)

games.name: M.I.N.E - Massive Indifferent Neverending Exploitation
games.body:
# About
![MainMenu.png](///raw/38f/83/z/6b275.png)
Explore the deep, unending, underground. You might even find... Spice....

Tought that will take effort and many attempts.

Manage your mining company. Send your workers down into the hell that is the mineshaft.

# How to play

You get a starting inventory of items (tools, transportation options) and a bit of money. Dig shafts, place ladders, earn money, get rich.

### Buying  & Selling
![OverviewShops.png](///raw/38f/83/z/6b253.png)
1. Click the store to buy items
2. Click the respective depository to sell the collected minereals.

### Placing tools
![PlaceDigger.png](///raw/38f/83/z/6b227.png)
1. Select "Mining tool" category
2. Select "Pickage".
3. click on available digging site

### Placing transportation
![PlaceHorizontal.png](///raw/38f/83/z/6b261.png)
1. Select "Horizontal transportation" category
2. Place it on any available site.

**Important:** When placing horizontal transporation items, the direction is VERY important.

### Removing and Upgradde *- with two Ds, for it's double dose of pimp*
![ToolMenu-Arrow.png](///raw/38f/83/z/6b29d.png)
1. Remove the clicked tool or transportation item.
2. Upgrade the item - upgrade must be in inventory beforehand (greed => disabled)

# Know issues
 - We developed on PC - but mobile *should* be supported. iOS less so than android for some reaason.


### Edit
- Improved description

games.name: Deep Dive
games.body:
Pull off gravity-defying stunts, rack up trick combos, and stick the perfect landing. Just don‚Äôt dive too deep!

Deep Dive is an arcade diving game where style meets precision. Check the water‚Äôs depth above deadly spikes, launch with finesse, spin through the air, and nail your entry. One wrong move, and it‚Äôs game over. How deep will you go for glory?

## Helpful hints
- Playable with keyboard or a controller.
- The scoring system has ...*depth*.

## Showcase
![Jump.gif](///raw/d67/a3/z/6b2ec.gif)

![Trick.gif](///raw/d67/a3/z/6b2e7.gif)

![Entry.gif](///raw/d67/a3/z/6b2ef.gif)

## Extra notes
- There is a sandbox mode if you want to practice tricks without worrying about depth.

games.name: Third Depth
games.body:
P.S. This game was created with less than 15 Hours with two people only so please forgive if there are any glitches. This is the reason we didn't get any time to do sound.

![Two Depth World](///raw/5fa/46/z/6a84e.png)

![Dimension Shift](///raw/5fa/46/z/6a850.png)

You are a being from a world of 2 Depths. One of the FlatWolder.
But you have been blessed with the ability to Depth Shift into the Third Depth utilize this power to go through the level and finish the game

Navigate a clean, shape-driven world where what you see isn‚Äôt always what‚Äôs real. Switch between 2D and 3D views, solve spatial puzzles, and avoid enemies who cannot follow where your depth can take you.

Master the Depth Shift and uncover a world that was never truly flat to begin with.

Controls:
Arrow Keys: Move
Space: Jump
Z: Activate Depth Shift
R: Reset level
Esc: Pause

You, daring scholar, are determined to reach the bottom floor of the pyramid. But as you descend, beware: some mysteries are better left buried, and some doors, once opened, can never be closed...

games.name: Gleaming Depths
games.body:
# DEEP DIVE: THE OCEAN'S DEPTHS

![Diver Logo](///raw/714/1/z/6b148.gif)

## Description
Plunge into the mysterious abyss as a daring diver on a quest to reach the ocean floor. Your adventure begins near the surface, but the true treasures and challenges await in the deep unknown.

## Game Features
- Descend deeper into the ocean by collecting and extending your diving rope
- Hunt dangerous sea creatures with your trusty harpoon
- Collect coins from defeated creatures to upgrade your equipment
- Engage in dice-based combat system that combines strategy and luck

Every fathom brings new challenges and rewards as you navigate through increasingly hostile waters. Manage your resources wisely, upgrade your gear, and test your luck with the dice to become the master of the deep!

## Screenshots

| ![diver9.gif](///raw/714/1/z/6b1cd.gif) | ![diver8.gif](///raw/714/1/z/6b1cb.gif) |
|:------------------------------------------------:|:------------------------------------------:|
| Kill deep creatures                              | Combine Dices                              |

## How to play
- **MOUSE** - Use mouse for input

![Game Controls](///raw/714/1/z/6b16c.png)

games.name: How the Moon Got Its Colors
games.body:
![logo.png](///raw/7ae/5/z/6b0a2.png)
In ancient times, when humankind was yet young and spirits still roamed the land, the world blossomed with deep and vibrant color.

The moon in its gray pallor looked upon the world's rich hues and coveted them. With each passing night, its jealousy grew and grew, until one night, the moon descended to the earth to weep. Its jealous tears flooded the world, washing all color from the land. Before long, the entire earth was dull.

A brave earth spirit heard the cries of anguish and ventured out toward the sound. As it touched the moon's tears, it realized how to restore the depths of color to the world...

![ShootIcon.png](///raw/7ae/5/z/6b0a4.png)

**All art, music, sound effects, and writing created in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 57: Depths.**

Stay tuned for our post-jam version, which will include composer notes explaining how we interwove **17**(!) different tracks to represent the blooming and deepening of complexity and color as the game progresses. Yes, the jukebox is for those of you who would rather make music by turning knobs than catching tears.

*We hope you enjoy this fable, our love letter to you in these tumultuous times. May we continue to create together.*

![LD25__story_book_flower_yellow.png](///raw/7ae/5/z/6b0a6.png)

games.name: DI(V)E - Beneath the Waves
games.body:
![itch banner.png](///raw/19d/06/z/69980.png)
_______________________________________________________________________

Hey Rookie!
Yeah, sorry for the sudden wake-up, but something weird‚Äôs going on. Again. No, not the coffee machine this time‚Äîwell, also the coffee machine‚Äîbut that‚Äôs not your concern.

We just picked up a signal from our waste disposal vessels. Emergency-type. Origin‚Äôs... below us. Like, deep down. Somewhere it really shouldn‚Äôt be. No idea how it ended up there... let's just hope the retired biomass it was carrying hasn't leaked... who knows what effect that'd have on the environment... and our paychecks.

Anyway. Someone‚Äôs gotta check it out. Guess who‚Äôs next on the roster?

Grab your suit, take a deep breath and find that trash sub ASAP! 
Oh, and whatever you do ‚Äî hold on to that flashlight!

Good luck down there. Try not to die, yeah?


You were hired as part of the
Ludum Dare 57

Theme: Depths

 ______________________________________________________________________

[LOG-ECHO 069.B | Recovered Fragment ‚Äì Origin: Ludum Whiskers]
 
"Personnel Manifest? Or just another pile of names carved into the biomass?"

SYSTEM RECORDS: (Handwriting partially corrupted, assumed translation below)

TheWhiteShadow
‚Äì code engineer, responsible for most of the system logic. Blamed for the flickering lights on Floor 3. Still denies it.

Mervvel / Marvin
‚Äì also coding. Often found arguing with pipes. Pipes never respond.

lensu
‚Äì environmental visual specialist. Designed the walls. Possibly also lives in them now.

idk some itchio guy / Nadine
‚Äì creature concepts. No one has seen her, but her designs keep showing up.

MissSpelled / Anouk
‚Äì responsible for cutscene structuring and narrative fragments and soundeffects. Rumored to speak directly to the vents.

HowToBeHayes
‚Äì designed the diver‚Äôs suit and built the game pages. Left mysterious coffee mugs everywhere.

Milumalu
‚Äì reshaped the outside zones. Plants, rocks, stuff that might be breathing. Good eye for spooky things.

END LOG
(If found, please return to the nearest station. And stop reading other people‚Äôs files.)

games.name: Dream-Scape
games.body:
# Bugs and Technical Issues

**NOTE:** The HTML5 build of this game takes a while to load and compile locally, please be patient

**NOTE 2:** We currently have a bug with the materials on a couple of characters in the HTML5 build, the most obvious being the player character on the first level. You can still finish the level as intended, just be aware the player character is unfortunately invisible for this level.

The Windows build has neither of these issues, if you are able to play it!

**NOTE 3:** Press spacebar to start the game!

# Story and Gameplay

This game is a platformer where you enter the depths of your dreams and have to find a way through them to escape your nightmare.

## Controls

- A/D or Left/Right: Walk
- Spacebar: Jump (and Double Jump) (and also starts the game!)

# Credits

- UE C++ code by @xeltide
- UE Blueprint scripting by @xeltide, @mantaraygun, and @bravelytyped
- 3D meshes, textures, and animations by @xeltide and @mantaraygun
- 2D sprites by @bravelytyped
- SFX by @bravelytyped

games.name: Gaga Diver
games.body:
![ld57_cover.png](///raw/a9a/12/z/6a61f.png)
![gagadiver_trailer.gif](///raw/a9a/12/z/6a6af.gif)
## Introduction
A duck is learning how to grab fishes like a bird.
Let's diving deeper, and flying higher.

## Control
Left/Right Arrows - horizontal movement
Space - boost when diving OR flying. 
E/Up arrow - interact, to buy abilities
Tab - pause game when pressing

## How to win
this is a high score game, try to get higher score before your energy use out.
When your energy use out, you will back to shore automatically, and end current game round, please try again.

## How to play
- dive deeper, fly higher
- use boost to go deeper or higher
- touch fishes will get fish count and score
- when arrive a new depth, some score will be gained.
- different "fishes": snail, small fish, frog, long fish
- bump to obstables will decrease energy

## Credits
- Code/Design Justus
- Art/Concept Jkllin
- SFX chip-tone
- BGM Suno

games.name: Nine Lives Deep
games.body:
# Nine Lives Deep
Since childhood, Matteo and Leonardo have heard tale of a legendary treasure, one which only a cat who came from the moon can find it. 

But only Matteo is a cat, and he came from the piers. Leonardo isn‚Äôt so sure, and thinks Matteo might be destined for more.

Together they will brave the turquoise depths, braving monsters and waves along the way in this top down combat adventure game!


## Controls:
* W/A/S/D -**Move**
* Left shift - **Dash**
* Spacebar (Holding anchor): **Throw anchor. **
* Spacebar (Not holding anchor): **Pull anchor towards yourself**
 
## Combat
![combat.gif](///raw/db1/6/z/6b44c.gif)
You deal damage by hitting enemies with your anchor, there are two ways of doing so:
* Moving around & building momentum (typically spinning it)
* Throwing or Pulling the anchor (using Spacebar). 

Proper description coming soon!

games.name: The Fall
games.body:
# The fall
## A game about life, a game about death

Free falling game where you play as an autumn leaf trying to prolong the inevitable.

## Mechanics
Avoid the plank obstacles and try not to get pushed by gusts of wind in a never ending abyss.

## Controls
- A: Move Left
- D: Move Right
- Right Click: Dash

## Notes
### The Game was developed with the independent game engine [Hazel](https://hazelengine.com/), created by [The Cherno](https://www.youtube.com/@TheCherno), this is a small test to create a simple game with the engine and provide feedback on the user experience.

games.name: BeastBound
games.body:
# Backstory üìñ

## FIGHT! ‚öîÔ∏è EXPLORE! üåç CRAFT! üî®

In BeastBound, you play as a young tribal child separated from your community. As you try to reunite with them, you navigate through difficult environments encountering new mobs and building materials to craft with. You craft better weapons to protect yourself and become unstoppable.

![Untitled.png](///raw/b7c/16/z/6acb9.png)

![lol.png](///raw/b7c/16/z/6ace8.png)

![lav.png](///raw/b7c/16/z/6acf8.png)

# Controls üïπÔ∏è

- WASD keys: Walk
- Shift + WASD keys: Run/Sprint
- Mouse to aim, LMB to shoot
- Numeric keys 1-6: Switch weapons
- E: Craft at the workshop

# Tools Used üõ†Ô∏è

- This game was created in HTML5 using the p5.js JavaScript library (https://p5js.org/) in the Glitch collaborative environment (https://glitch.com/).
- All art was created in LibreSprite (https://libresprite.github.io/).
- The game's background music was synthesized using Bosca Ceoil (https://boscaceoil.net/).
- All the sound effects were synthesized using sfxr (https://sfxr.me/).

# Strategies?? üß©ü§î

The game does not restrict the player to follow any set path, you can walk straight to the Underworld (hardest region) at the start of the game. But we recommend you finish the Plains first -> then Desert -> then Forest (top-right) -> then Tundra (top-left) and finally the Underworld (below). Focus on crafting superior weapons so you can quickly decimate a large number of enemies.

While the Rock Minigun is the best weapon, it is heavy and slows down your movement. You can alternate between a slingshot or hands (1/2/3) and the Rock Minigun when you're moving and shooting respectively.

# Credits ‚≠ê

Programming by pranavcl
Artwork, sound effects and background music by VJ031206

games.name: Squirrel swirl
games.body:
![screenshot.png](///raw/d7d/43/z/6a890.png)


# Gameplay
Welcome to our IDLE / Tower Defense Game: **Squirrel swirl**

Explore the depht of the forest to gather ressources and defend yourself against the evil ducklings.

This game is set up in three phases:

1. Noon phase: Build your path into the woods to collect different ressources. But be mindfull, as the amount of resources increases step by step.

 - Acorn: Used to build new roads

 - Meat: increases the productivity of your horde

 - Crystal: used to upgrade your tower

2. Dusk phase: Short phase to prepare yourself for the upcoming wave.
 - Frost tower: decreases the speed of the enemies
 - Damage tower: increases damgage output
 - Speed tower: increases the tower attack speed

3. Night phase: Fight against a wave of enemies (unskippable)
 - amount of enemies increases every night

## Controls

Interact: left mouse button

move camera: WASD or put your mouse to the edge of the screen
skip to next phase: SPACE

Focus camera on the base: Q

Focus camera on the road: E

Pause: ESC

## Note

You can either play the browser version or as a download. If you have performance issues we recommend playing the download version.

## **Known Bugs**

‚ÄãIn the browser version, keyboard input may not work occasionally. Use the downloadable version instead. 


# Thank you for playing :v:

games.name: Hellevator
games.body:
![Captura de pantalla 2025-04-08 035455.png](///raw/20e/3/z/6b1e7.png)

Make your way through the depths of the subsoil salvaging ancient relics and selling them for profit. But don't be greedy, or the catacombs may claim you forever.

# How to play!
## - LEFT CLICK TO INTERACT
## - RIGHT CLICK TO *ZOOM*

In the elevator you will see different buttons:
- Close doors
- Open doors
- Descend
- Ascend and END YOUR RUN.

# Description!

You can descend through the floors and play with your odds since all levels have a probability of ending you. Take a chance, win, and you can take the three treasures per floor that you can recover, or you can continue descending without opening the door to be safe and try on another floor with better odds. But be careful, if you skip too many levels you will run out of oxygen and you will be forced to open the door, even if you are very sure to find your death on the other side. And also, if you load your elevator too much, it will start to fail, it will skip floors for you, making you lose that precious oxygen.


![Captura de pantalla 2025-04-08 041136.png](///raw/20e/3/z/6b218.png)

## Credits!
- chispaLBC: Main programmer.
- CosmicMocha: 3D artist.
- Nekuake: Sound and auxiliary programmer.

EVERYTHING* is made from scratch and without the use of AI. From the models, which were created during the jam, to the sounds, which were recorded as fooleys and then edited with manual tools.

*The font for the elevator panels is [Schindler Led Large by S-Prod](https://fontstruct.com/fontstructions/download/543945)

![Captura de pantalla 2025-04-08 041339.png](///raw/20e/3/z/6b223.png)

games.name: FORMIDRILL
games.body:
:arrow_down: Go to the links section to **Play in Browser** :arrow_down: 
  
  
**Explore treacherous depths of the Earth!**

Your anthill has just developped a new machine, the Formidrill! It is the most powerful excavator ever built by ants, and your Queen intends to use it to explore deep down! Come aboard with her and try to survive whatever is waiting for you down there!

A nervous narrative real-time tactical game where you must think fast to allocate your worker ants to the right functions of the drill to fight back against angry worms and prevent overheating!

![ant_cleanworm.png.PNG](///raw/c07/03/z/6b080.png)

# How to play

Formidrill is a nervous narrative real-time tactical game. As you go down into the earth, you must fight against worms and control the drill's internal temperature.
* **Fighting worms**: place ants in the gun rooms and shoot worms with your mouse. Be careful, the left cannon only shoots left, the right cannon only right!
* **Controlling temperature**: the more you go, the faster the temperature will rise! Place ants in the cooler room to bring the temperature down.
* **Keeping your ants alive**: more ants mean more actions. Remove your ants from a room before it is attacked by a worm so it is not eaten alive! If you loose one ant, that may happen, watch out for new eggs laid by the queen, they need your workers' attention to hatch!
* **Some more surprises arrive later in the game**, no spoilers here!

![ant_pump.png.PNG](///raw/c07/03/z/6b08e.png)

‚Äã**Remember: keep cool, be aware, look everywhere for signs of danger!**

# Assets
Everything in this game has been made in the course of Ludum Dare 57, including:
* Gameplay mechanics
* Graphics
* All musics and sounds
* Shaders

Exceptions :
* Fonts
* Our logo splashscreen (Taboul√© Recipe)

# Tools
* Game engine: Unity
* Pixel art: Krita
* Music: FL Studio

![ant_walk.png.PNG](///raw/c07/03/z/6b097.png)

# Changelog
## v1.0
Original game release during the Ludum Dare.

games.name: DeepSigma
games.body:
THIS IS OUR FIRST GAMEJAM!!
(please be kind)


DeepSigma is an adventure video game set in the dark depths of the ocean. One day, a mysterious signal is picked up from the bottom of the sea. You are Walter, an experienced diver, and you decide to set out in your submarine to find out where it is coming from.

But something goes wrong.

The submarine crashes. Everything goes dark.

Now you are stuck on the ocean floor, alone, with no way out. To survive, you'll have to explore, solve puzzles and face strange presences hiding in the dark.

But the ocean won't let you go.

Are you ready to face your fears, there where no one can hear you![ICONA VIDEOGIOCO.png](///raw/f19/36/z/6a27c.png)

- When finishing a level, you do get back your 5 lives, but the UI won't update

![IMG_2337.png](///raw/5ce/1/z/6aff4.png)

A Well To Wonderland is a fast down-scrolling game.

You are Alice, falling through three stages of the wonderland

A lot of stuff is on your way and you want to clear the path to avoid the crash.

You're late, you're late ! Pick up the pace to make it in time !

Use space key to control speed and avoid the blinkable obstacle

games.name: GOLD HUNGER
games.body:
A small game. I'm unhappy with what I did but I still want people to test it and give me honest and constructive feedback.

![Capture d‚Äô√©cran du 2025-04-07 19-42-06.png](///raw/b17/e5/z/6a3f1.png)

# How to play

Your goal is to **mine the minerals** because you need to **eat them if you don't want to starve**.

The **more the mineral is precious the more food points you get**:
 - 1 point for copper
 - 2 points for gold
 - 3 points for platinum
 - 4 points for diamond

Dig by clicking or by pressing the space bar.

**Move with the arrow keys**.

The **up arrow** lets you jump.

The higher your score is, the more points you get to get upgrades and go deeper.

**Note**: With time you starve faster

# Building from source

I can only provide a linux build for now because my engine currrently doesn't support anything else.

I'll try to make a web or a windows version as soon as possible.

To compile it from source, run:
```
git clone https://github.com/mibi88/MibiEngine2.git
git clone https://github.com/mibi88/ld57.git
cd MibiEngine2
./build_engine.sh
cd ../ld57
./build.sh
```

Then you can simply run it by typing `./main`.

I'll make a timelapse of me coding it soon. It was quite chaotic.

Controls:

games.name: Cursed Catacombs
games.body:
Explore the 3 levels of the ancient tomb, dodge traps and find what you need to progress to the next level.

If you fear the dark you can Press "2" and equip a lantern but beware it only burns for 3 minutes. If your lantern runs out of oil Press "1" to switch back to your torch.

You can run with "Left Shift" and crouch with "Left Control" if you need extra maneuverability to dodge those pesky traps. 

Good Luck and Have Fun. You Only Live Once!

games.name: Deeper
games.body:
Note: Unfortunately this jam came around a time in which I was quite busy, so I never had time to commit to the grind this go around. I was able to scrap this together in a total of about 8 cumulative hours of work, so I think its better than nothing. Regardless, please try it out!


![Screenshot 2025-04-07 171604.png](///raw/1f4/84/z/6b390.png)


Survive as long as possible by shooting the monsters and sparing your friends



CONTROLS:

wasd - move

Space/Left click - shoot

P - pause



HOW TO PLAY:

Humans look exactly like you but without a headlight.

Monsters may resemble humans, but have imperfections.



Not shooting humans adds them to your party.



Missing shots, shooting humans, and watching humans get taken away will increase the parties nerves.



If you or another human gets too nervous, they will die.


STRENGTH IN NUMBERS
STAY ALIVE

Pushing into the depths of space
---
In Depths Space 9 you push forward into the depths of space, on a mission to escape the claws of the cruel rule of the Glorpixian Empire. Your goal is to match the target star constellations so your warp computer can find the correct coordinates to your next jump location. But beware, as long as you are still in their territory the Glorpixians are near and try to locate your ship and hunt you down.

Can you make your escape in time?

Controls
---
- A: roll left
- D: roll right
- Shift: hold for fast roll

Notes
---
You don't need to be 100% exact on the alignment, your navigation system can fix smaller misalignments.

games.name: Moose Diver
games.body:
Collect coins from the ocean floor. Sell the coins and upgrade the moose diver's gear to reach greater depths and more valuable coins.

**How to play:**

Use the coin vacuum to collect coins. Bring back the coins to the island to sell them. Buy upgrades and repeat.
Be careful to not run out of oxygen as you will drop the coins you have collected if you do. Go back to the island to refill oxygen.

**Controls:**
* WASD, move character
* Space (hold), activate coin vacuum

To run the game download and unpack the zip file, then run MooseDiver.exe

I made everything myself during the jam except for:
Sound effects/Music, these are licensed assets
The base moose model and animations, borrowed from another game of mine
The UI assets, borrowed from that same game 

Let me know in the comments what you think about the game or if you have any issues :relaxed:

games.name: You Gnome the Drill!
games.body:
People always confuse Gnomes with Dwarves and compare them to each other. You've had enough of that!  
You are a Gnome who is tired of the Dwarves being known as the best hole diggers in all the land.  
For this reason, you built a giant drill to do the work for you... as long as it has enough fuel...

Gather resources as you explore the dungeon, but return in time  
to keep your drill safe from waves of attacking monsters! ![character.gif](///raw/486/f5/z/6a537.gif)
## Controls
**Walking:** A,D  
**Jumping:** Spacebar  
**Dash:** Right Mouseclick  
**Shoot:** Left Mouseclick  
![character.gif](///raw/486/f5/z/6a537.gif)
This Interface shows you the oil tank of your drill. If this hits zero it is game over.  
It drops over time and loses even more when an enemy hit the drill.
![OilTankV2Border.gif|10000](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aaca.gif)
You can refill your oil tank by collecting these crystals within the mine.
![OilCrystal.png](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aadf.png)
You can see how long until the next monster wave with this bar.  
As it gets closer to being full you should head back to your drill to defend it.
![DrillHPmoved.gif](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aacc.gif)
Picking up this crystal can help you get back faster. For each stack of this resource you can dash once using it up.
![DashCrsytal.png](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aade.png)
The last resource you can find is the ammunition for your weapon.  
You will need it to defeat the enemies attacking your drill so make sure to gather enough of it.
![muniCrystal.png](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aadb.png)
The enemies can deal damage to your character too.
![PlayerHPBorder.gif](///raw/a48/f5/z/6aad1.gif)
You can refill your health by picking up health crystals in the mine.
![HealthCrystal.png](///raw/a48/f5/z/6ab8d.png)

## Screenshots
The Drill digs Deeper and Deeper!
![Drill.png](///raw/486/f5/z/6a52b.png)
Go deep into the dungeon and collect resources!
![inLevel.png](///raw/486/f5/z/6a533.png)
But be back in time, to defend your Drill!

## Team
**Benedikt Mertes** / bene-labs **- Coding, Gamedesign**  
**Alexander Bobb** / Dephos **- Leveldesign, Gamedesign**  
**Christopher Graen** / Eos034 **- Art**  
**Nando Berg** / UmbraLux **- Art, Coding**  
**Johannes J. Kross** / P3ngui **- Music, Sounddesign**  

**Special Thanks** to **Jan Ble√ümann, Mike Missiamey und Moritz** for helping us out at the Jam on site!

![Drill.gif](///raw/486/f5/z/6a52a.gif)

games.name: Depth Dive
games.body:
![title screen 640x512.png](///raw/152/f/z/6a7bb.png)
# Jump in, fall deep, die often!

Welcome to a different kind of high dive!



You dare to jump into the water! The pool? Deeper than you thought ... What begins as a harmless jump turns into an unexpected journey - an endless fall, deep, deep down into the world. You break through layer after layer. Wait! Is this the Hollow Earth?!

Fall through absurd sectors, dodge obstacles and don't lose your head (or all your hearts).

How far can you fall before you're crushed? Will you survive?



## Gameplay

Survive all levels all the way to the bottom! Every hit costs you a heart. If you lose all your hearts, you restart at the beginning of the current sector.

How many lives do you need to reach the bottom?

![2025-04-07 23_40_35-NVIDIA GeForce Overlay DT.png](///raw/152/f/z/6a7e0.png)

## Controls üéÆ
- Arrow keys or WASD to move.
- ESC to pause the game, look at the controls or get back to the main menu.

## Team

Eddie ‚Äì Programming

Danya & Silvi ‚Äì Graphics

Patrick ‚Äì Sounds & Music

Jens ‚Äì Level Design

Basti ‚Äì Dialogue & Support ‚ù§Ô∏è

Rina ‚Äì Testing & Feedback

games.name: Potions on Paws
games.body:
Help Hexie with her potions by collecting fresh ingredients and brewing them up to truly experience the full depths of flavour.
Each potion can have a range of flavours, effects and all of this information is stored in Hexie's Nekonomicon! 

With each customer quest you fulfil in the store, they can offer you more ingredients and friendship to aid you on your potion making adventure. Did you make a potion that you don't need? No problem! Place it in the store front and wait for the perfect customer to buy it!

Your shop's basement is home to a collection of mini-games which offer different ingredients based on the level. With 25 different ingredients, what sort of potions will YOU make?

![Untitled 1.png](///raw/f77/c2/z/6b0c4.png)

**Controls:**
- `[W]` / `[A]` / `[S]` / `[D]` to walk
- hold `[shift]` to sprint
- `[E]` to interact with customers, advance dialogue and to place potions on shelves
- `[Tab]` to read your Nekonomicon
- `[Q]` to view your current quest
- `[F]` to view your _tasty_ ingredients in your inventory
- `[R]` to view your discovered potion recipes
- `[T]` to view your _awesome_ brewed potions in your inventory
- `[C]` to access your _magical, pocket sized_ cauldron for brewing

**Made with:**
- Godot 4
- Inkscape, Krita and Gimp
- LibreOffice Draw

games.name: Project: Coreline
games.body:
![Screenshot 2025-04-07 203306.png](///raw/c87/d5/z/6a62b.png)
_The Core is dying._

_The Earth's inner layers have become unstable, triggering massive quakes, extreme weather, and ecological collapse. To prevent total destruction, a massive drilling machine‚ÄîThe Core Excavator‚Äîhas been built._

_Your mission is to keep it alive._

_Build a self-sustaining surface base, manage resources, grow food, and power the machine. The deeper it drills, the harsher the heat, pressure, and challenges you'll face._

_You're not the hero._

_You're the system that keeps the hero running._

_Humanity's survival depends on your efficiency._

**About:**
Project: coreline is a city builder/ base building where you need to manager the resources to complete the stages until you the special project is complete.

__HOW TO PLAY__

**AWSD** or Arrows to move de camera. (also hold right click and drag).
**Left Click** to build and select.
**Right Click** to cancel building order.

You need to give materials to **The Core Excavator**, that is the big hexagonal building close to where you appear.

Residences: Give you workers slots but consume food.
Farms: Give you food but consume a bit of energy
Industry: Produce materials but need workers and energy.
Power Plants: Produce Energy but consume materials.

if you ever have negative food, workers or energy, you building will continue to work but at half the efficency.


![Screenshot 2025-04-07 203755.png](///raw/c87/d5/z/6a62a.png)

games.name: Avoid the void
games.body:
![Web_Portada.jpg](///raw/e7f/d5/z/6a781.jpg)

Walk across an endless old bridge, trying to escape a creature emerging from the depths, while keeping your balance against the wind. Mmm... yeah, looks like we made a difficult game again. Sorry, mates.

![donotfogme.gif](///raw/e7f/d5/z/6a990.gif)

We were inspired by PS1 graphics and the fog in Silent Hill (which, back in those days, was used to hide technical limitations. We used it to hide our lack of time, haha).

Hope you enjoy it!

Btw: We recommend headphones and gamepad :)

games.name: Detectorists
games.body:
A treasure-hunting game that's a love-letter to BBC's The Detectorists show.
The local metal detectorist group has organised a big rally on a lovely summer day.
Compete against 4 other enthusiasts to find the most treasure (and get it all on the finds table before 5pm!)
Coils to the soil people - make sure you recycle all your can-slaw!

Environment and characters are from Synty's Polygon series, ambient sounds from freesound.org, animations from mixamo.
I'd recommend putting on a playlist seeded by Johnny Flynn's Detectorists theme tune.

Controls are WASD or arrow keys. Find treasures by looking for the strongest signals. Don't forget to get your treasure registered at the Finds Table before 5pm for it to count to your total score.


**Having material issues with web build - I'll post a link as soon as its working**

games.name: Is Water Wet?
games.body:
![Screenshot 2025-04-07 at 9.12.19‚ÄØPM.png](///raw/7db/z/6afd0.png)

A Gelato Labs production for Ludum Dare 57 "Depths"

Dive bravely into the vast depths of the ocean to seek enlightenment by answering the age-old question: Is water wet?

Great fishlosophers will push you to ponder this mind-bending debate in ways once thought unfathomable!

But you may wonder how this is possible?  Don't fret - the best means to answer a question of this caliber is quite simple - by asking more questions!

Remember, you may only pose three questions for each fishlosopher so frame each one carefully!

In order to help guide your journey there are tests of speed and accuracy along the way that will offer you partial clues to key words in which to inquire.

Now venture forth and make the unknown known!

The Gelato Labs "G-Team" for LD57 is:

Kyle Farwell (kfarwell): Programming, Writing, Art

Ryan Refcio: Writing, Programming

FuuGhoul: Art

games.name: Below
games.body:
Controls: WASD, QE for ascent and descent. Escape (for an obvious purpose). And whatever you see in the game.


üåä Below
A survival base-builder set in the cold, crushing dark

The surface is a memory. The abyss is your reality.

You awaken to the dim hum of failing systems and the creak of metal under immense pressure. All around you: endless black. Your submarine ‚Äî your only way home ‚Äî lies shattered on the ocean floor. A mangled silhouette against the void, lifeless and unreachable. You're trapped in a battered submersible, a bubble of flickering light in a sea of silence.

Welcome to the bottom of the world.

In Below, you take on the role of a stranded deep-sea explorer, forced to adapt, build, and survive in one of the most hostile environments imaginable. Scavenge from the wreckage of your ship. Harvest glowing kelp, mineral-rich stones, and ancient wrecks littered with forgotten technology. Every resource is hard-earned. Every venture into the black is a calculated risk.

Out there in the murk, sea mines drift quietly ‚Äî relics of forgotten conflicts or perhaps left behind by something that still waits. They don't blink. They don't warn. They end you.

Your only hope is to expand your fragile outpost into something more ‚Äî a lifeline built from scraps, powered by makeshift engines and your will to live. Craft processing units. Channel limited power. Build airlocks, fabricators, and repair stations. All of it working toward one goal:

Bring the submarine back online. And rise.

But the deeper you go ‚Äî the longer you stay ‚Äî the more it starts to feel like you're not alone down here. The silence isn't empty. It listens.

üéÆ Features
üõ† Base-building and resource management in a vast underwater trench

‚öôÔ∏è Processing and power systems designed for survival under pressure

üí£ Navigate a mine-infested seabed ‚Äî one mistake and it‚Äôs over

üå´ Immersive fog and low visibility amplify the tension

üß≠ Explore, upgrade, and unlock the tools needed to escape

üß© A complete single-level experience with an emotional arc

games.name: In The Depths And For Jems
Voidcurrent
games.body:
**![57-3.png](///raw/43f/36/z/6ad1a.png)Time:** 2245, late post-industrial era  
**Location:** "New Ocean City," Pacific Federation  
**Core Event:**  
The transnational energy corporation "Critical Point" constructed an **Abyssal Nuclear Fusion Reactor** underwater, which suffered a core meltdown due to human operational errors. Over a hundred million tons of highly concentrated radioactive wastewater were injected into subterranean fissures. To cover up the disaster, the company secretly activated an emergency cooling system, causing the contamination to seep into the global water cycle through tectonic movements.  

As a result, marine life began to undergo horrifying mutations‚Äîecological order collapsed, and the sole purpose of all marine creatures became clear: **to reach land.**  

In response, terrestrial regions designated **Forbidden Sea Zones** to prevent the invasion of these mutated marine creatures. Initially, their forms were still recognizable, but as ecological cycles repeated, the question emerged: **Are we still who we were?**![57-2.png](///raw/43f/36/z/6ad0e.png)![57-4.png](///raw/43f/36/z/6ad1c.png)

games.name: In the DEPTHS
games.body:
## Explore the depths of the world and light up your path while surviving among the enemies!

Remember! The land is your friend!

Collect coal, gold & diamonds, and use them to upgrade your character.

---
### This is a short guide on how to reach 1000m:

Step 1: Dive into the unknown, stay around 50m deep and collect as much coal as you can.

Step 2: You need to upgrade time, lamps & intensity upgrade in order to go deeper. The lamps will help you a lot when getting deeper.

Step 3: When you feel strong enough, reach 150m and start collecting gold. Gold is used to survive in general.

Step 4: Upgrade the number of lives to survive against the enemies, touching magma blocks or falling from high altitudes. You should also upgrade your impulse to have an advantage. Shock upgrades will help you when you are stuck between stone blocks and can't move anymore.

Step 5: When you reach 500m, you'll find diamonds and you can upgrade the special upgrades.

Step 6: Feel free to reach the deepest point!

---
### Controls:
- Drag your mouse to launch the character.
- Use the right button or press 'E' to place a lamp.
- Use the left button or press 'Q' to do a shock.
---
### Upgrades:
1. Time -> The current time that the player can play a round.
2. Lamps -> The number of lamps that can be used.
3. Intensity -> The intensity of the lamps. (this parameter affects the range of them)
4. Health -> The numbers of lives that the player has. VERY IMPORTANT!!!
5. Shock -> The number of shocks that can be used. It will help you when you are stuck between stone blocks and can't move anymore.
6. Impulse (limit) -> The maximum impulse of the character.
7. Fall Reduction -> The minimum speed that the player will get damage when hitting a stone / magma block. Upgrading it will increase the minimum speed for damage.
8. Death Defy (limit) -> The chance that the player will not get damage.
9. Ultra Light -> The multiply of Intensity. When collecting a PowerUp, the Ultra Light upgrade will be visible in the game for 12 seconds.
---
#### The HTML5 build is supported by Windows, Linux and Android devices, but the performance is low. Recommend to download the .exe build instead for PC!

games.name: Depth of your Thoughts
games.body:
![Screenshot 2025-04-06 172752.png](///raw/fc6/36/z/699c0.png)

So here it is : a game that seems to be quiet and calm. But in reality is much louder than it sounds. 

My idea was simple : I didn't want to create an ocean game, and I didn't want a super fun gameplay neither. 
"Depths" reminds me the deep thinking I can have every night, like many other people. 

There is not much stuff to do, really. 
I'm more like a "contemplative" and "story" game fan person. 
And also it's my first 3D prototype, I started gamedev 1 month ago! So it's my first gamejam too and even if I struggled a lot, I loved it !

And yes: it's half french/half in english. Mostly because the thoughts sounded more natural to me in my native language. But to be honest: I was so into managing the camera and animation bugs that I just didn't realized at all that the text were still in french haha!

Can't wait to play yours, they all seem super cool ! 

PS: reminder for me
- Worked on ot from Saturday 10am to Sunday 6PM
- Total work time: 20h30

games.name: Umbra Glyphs
games.body:
## JAM GAME by  
Fernando Y3 (fernandoy3), CLEE (clee), Ezer (ezer), Kkiyoro (kkiyoro), SharkFujin (sharkfujin), and presidz (presidz)

This project is a 3D visual novel-style game developed using Unreal Engine 5 during the Ludum Dare 57 Game Jam (72 hours). It incorporates several open-source and Epic-licensed assets. Full credits and license information are listed below.

This game tells the story of a poet who once served as a royal minister. After a dynastic change, he lost his power and became an ordinary citizen. As a new era dawned‚Äîone marked by strict control over speech‚Äîthe poet chose to abandon his memories of former glory and status, attempting to forget the pain and responsibility of the past.

Through five ancient stone tablets scattered across the game world, the narrative gradually reveals the poet‚Äôs internal struggle as he begins to recall his former identity. Each memory unearthed becomes a heavy burden, forcing him to confront the conflict between who he was and who he has become.

In the end, the poet chooses to forget once more‚Äîto turn away from his past and bury that chapter of history forever.

This is a story of loss, escape, and inner turmoil. It explores the delicate relationship between identity, memory, and the choices we make to protect ourselves from truth.


## Third-Party Assets

### Advanced Locomotion System V4  
- Type: Character Movement System  
- Source: https://github.com/dyanikoglu/ALS-Community  
- License: MIT License  
- Usage: Used for high-quality third-person movement, including walking, running, jumping, and crouching.



### 3D Models from Epic Games Fab Platform  
The following assets were downloaded from https://www.fab.com/ and used under the Epic Content License:

1. Stylized Wall Mesh  
   - Link: https://www.fab.com/listings/82e45a3a-9ec3-4ecf-a22c-c016b5f6f9db  
   - Usage: Used as the main wall structure in the game scene.

2. Rock Mesh Pack  
   - Link: https://www.fab.com/listings/ced19ea1-31ed-437f-ae64-2b6b1561fede  
   - Usage: Used for environmental decoration and terrain boundaries.

3. Fire Visual Effect Mesh  
   - Link: https://www.fab.com/listings/f28ba983-21d5-4baf-ad39-b5597093b590  
   - Usage: Used for simulating fire-themed scenes and ambient effects.


All other game logic, narrative scripting, level design, and original assets were created independently by the team within the 72-hour time limit.

games.name: Align The Sea
games.body:
![thumbnail logo.png](///raw/0e6/44/z/6aa24.png)
### Story 
Sequel to "Align the sky". After the attack on the flying cargo ship, Unnamed fellow fell to his demise, expecting no the end. Miraculously, he wakes up on a pirate ship. Having nowhere to go, the captain takes him in. Too bad. Not long after our unfortunate fellow gets marooned because he farted too much on the ship. Too much for this captain's cup of tea. He gets thrown off the ship and stranded on a desserted island. 

 ![comic all 1-2.png](///raw/0e6/44/z/6aa88.png)


### Gameplay
- To survive, dive into the depth of the ocean and collect trash. 
![garbage  icon.png](///raw/0e6/44/z/6aae5.png)

- Be aware of how much oxygen you have when diving. Swim to the surface whenever you're out of breath or collect bubbles. 
![Bubble.png](///raw/0e6/44/z/6ab5b.png)

- Defend yourself from dangerous sea creatures by farting. 
![fykyk.png](///raw/0e6/44/z/6ab4f.png)

- Use the trash you've collected from the ocean and use the crafting table to create and upgrade your shelter, and diving upgrades. 
![gttt.png](///raw/0e6/44/z/6ac59.png)

- When diving gets too dark, why not craft a lantern? Turn it on and remember to reload when it's empty.
![fjymr.png](///raw/0e6/44/z/6ab90.png)

HINT
- Defeating a shark may help you breathe better under water
![gills shark.png](///raw/0e6/44/z/6abb3.png)
- Pick up seaweed to swim faster.
![Seaweed_Crack.png](///raw/0e6/44/z/6abad.png)

### Controls
F = to fart

Hold F = fart boost

E = to enter the sea, walk all the way to the right 

Arrow keys = to swim around

T = to turn on lantern

R = to reload the battery for the lantern

ESC = main menu 


### *Roles*

Nurf - coding, sound and voice acting

N0va - pixel art

ShuNo.3 - art

games.name: Revenge of the Ocean
games.body:
![cover_image.png](///raw/8aa/f1/z/6b193.png)

Take this cute little octopus on a journey where you stay in mostly one place and fight the same fish over and over.

I had only around 11 hours to make this game, so it's a miracle it's a game at all. I really hoped to get the fish moving, and the octopus moving in a nicer way, and making it a bit more rogue-likey with some upgrades for the player, and maybe even rooms. But I didn't have time.

During the submission hour I changed the health stats on the fish because they were way too high, it wasn't really possible to win, unless you were a bullet hell expert, and then it would just be terribly boring. For example, the "tutorial level" (the first one, which is really easy to go through if you know how to avoid the "bullets") was twice as long. The last levels, with two fish at once, would take ages (now they are 4x easier/faster to kill). It was only a few numbers in the code (max health), nothing more.

This is our 3rd Ludum Dare entry and our first 3D project.

In this game you will have to spend a night at a pub trying to crawl back from the deepest point of your life.

games.name: Rappel the Porter
games.body:
**You are Rappel, the porter for hire. Reach from the depths of your bag so your team can go down to the deepest parts of the dungeon...**

_Teams of adventurers hire you to carry their equipment, give it to them promptly when asked, and to diligently collect all the loot._

_Since the appearance of the Big Hole dungeon, your services have been in great demand thanks to the perfect match between the dungeon's structure and your physical abilities._

_It's still not that well paid, but it's the adventurers who die when you mess up, and thanks to the abundant loot and seemingly bottomless nature of the dungeon, your future employment is likely guaranteed._

_Do your best._


![screen.png](///raw/372/9/z/6ab56.png)


### Controls
...everything important with a **mouse**:

* Hold **left click** to grab objects,
* Hold **right click** to roll up your arm,
* Use the **wheel** to rotate objects.

As well as:

* **Escape** to exit.
* **M** to mute the music (it may or may have not been made made in the last hour).

### Known bugs

* There may be cursor issues on the web version. Try the downloads if this happens to you.
* Several others I'm too tired to list.

#### Fixed in the _Fixed_ version

* Broken score keeping when doing several runs in a row (tiped gold was not reset).

### Thanks for playing!

Everything is home-made:

* **Reuh** and **Houmgaor**: programming, opening Godot for the first time when the LD started, being surprised when it didn't work as hoped;
* **Trocentraisin**: music, sounds, doing pixel art for the first time during this LD.

Rough start, but it ended alright all things considered (':

games.name: Bloody Heart
games.body:
Made in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 57!

Descend into madness. Bloody Heart is a game about rage, revenge, and the occult horrors from beyond our world.

Take control of a cards to hack-and-slash through waves of enemies. Find chests that contain better gear, combat powerful figureheads in the occult world, avoid the rats, and most importantly: finish what you started a long time ago.

Game made by myself, Celtican, with a guest appearance from Gardenovena, who made the capsule art!

![Tutorial.gif](///raw/2af/83/z/6b356.gif)
![Summoning Circle.gif](///raw/2af/83/z/6b357.gif)
![Slice and Dice.gif](///raw/2af/83/z/6b359.gif)
![The Tongue.gif](///raw/2af/83/z/6b35a.gif)

### Tools used
- Unity 6
- JetBrains Rider
- Krita
- Ableton Live 12 Suite
- Google Fonts

### Changes made during the submission hour

- Fixed The Seer dealing no damage.
- Fixed the quest item not fitting into the slot.
- Fixed sliders in-game not looking like the sliders in the main menu.
- Fixed the tooltip still being visible after consuming a potion.
- Fixed the evil villain speech appearing instantly.
- Fixed a typo in the final boss's text.
- Fixed rats eating the quest item.

### Known bugs

- The Seer is incorrectly titled The Silent in the card, but correctly titled The Seer in the tooltip.
- If you take lots of damage quickly, your hearts may animate incorrectly.
- Moving cards is framerate dependent. If you're on a slower computer, dragging cards will be slower. Sorry :(

games.name: Hellgrind 4: Ultimate Dungeon Crawler Hell Escape Fun
games.body:
You wake up and find yourself in unseasonable warmth. And lava running burning your toes. And skin-stealers eyeing your body. ‚ÄúWhat did I do to deserve this??‚Äù, you may wonder. Probably many things, but that doesn‚Äôt matter now. You just need to get the hell out of here. Luckily you‚Äôve been provided a gun, and a magical bag of unlimited ammo. All that‚Äôs left to do is to climb out of the depths of hell.

![screenshot.png](///raw/2fa/c/z/6ab7c.png)

WASD to move, Shift to sprint, Space to jump, Left Click to shoot, and R to reload. Look for the exit!

Made with a custom Vulkan-based game engine in Rust. Only compatible with Windows :(

games.name: Depthscalation
games.body:
A simple tiny messy platformer.

You're a unknown creature falling from a bottomless pit to your demise and your only hope is to rise up from the _depths_!

Gamepad should work (tested on a xbox gamepad, analog sticks for movement). Keyboard controls are __WASD__ or the __arrow keys__ for movement, use __space-bar__ key for jumping, but your jumps must be _accurate_! When landing on a rising platform you must hit the jump button as soon you land on a platform to boost up your jump!

Reach the top of the pit and land to safety to complete a level, nine levels in total.

I've included as downloads a Windows and a Linux version.

Made with Godot, on a crazy Monday :)

![screen_01.png](///raw/706/b5/z/6aa47.png)

![screen_02.png](///raw/706/b5/z/6aa71.png)

![screen_04.png](///raw/706/b5/z/6aa75.png)

games.name: Thoughts from the Depths
games.body:
Thoughts from the Depths is a small game about a person who descends with their submarine into the deepest regions of Earth's ocean. Their goal is to reach the Ruins of an Ancient Civilization ‚Äî the Ancient Castle of the Sea-Men.

The Sea-Men, in the distant past, nearly annihilated their own species to seal away the great cosmic being, Cthulhu. He had come from the wastelands of the vast cosmos and corrupted nearly half their civilization. In a desperate final act, their Queen poisoned her own soldiers, fearing they would fall under his control. She then set a trap ‚Äî one that fused Sea-Men technology with the very knowledge they had once exchanged with Cthulhu himself.

Now, in the present, the lone visitor walks the silent halls of the once-great fortress ‚Äî now dark and empty ‚Äî with a singular purpose: to release the powerful Cthulhu and unleash vengeance upon mankind.


![cover.png](///raw/bc7/6/z/6a9af.png)



Controls:
- Movement: ASDW/‚Üë‚Üì‚Üê‚Üí
- Interact: I/Space/Return
- Accelerate: J


Team:
- Gustavo Christino (Game Design, Code, Art Direction, Storycrafting);
- Caroline Costa Prado (Game Design, Sound);
- Sans Oliveira (Graphics).

games.name: Serp-slurp (Spicy hot chocolate 3)
games.body:
A 1-4 player (2 keyboard, 2 controllers) fastpace high-score based "survival" game in which reaction time and strategy are key.  

Four wizards have been swallowed  by a massive serpantine beast in a norwegian national park and must collect enough vitality to sustain their lifes for long enough. As they  
 keep sinking into the ouroboroses stomach they encounter vast enviorments and strange items. Will they ever get out? How long can they sustain themselves? How DEEP can they go?   (See what i did there >)  )  

As plattforms appear and dissapear the players must jump on them, loot the provided material and jump off before they sink into the stomach acid.  
Theres many more deep mechanics to spice gameplay however; WHY DONT YOU JUST PLAY IT!? PLAY THE DAMN GAME!!1!  

A game by:  
Kartoffel_Licht - codesman,music literaly build the whole thing  
Smugsman - artsman,sfx - made silly sprites and spoke  

(InkyOnyx - Made two character designs and provided emotional support)  

(More technical details here)  
Binaries included for   
freebsd-amd64  
linux-amd64  
macos-x86_64  
windows-amd64  

Make sure you have the latest version of https://www.java.com/en/ installed  

Also you'll need a somewhat modern GPU (supporting Vulkan)

games.name: Cloud Sea Catalog
games.body:
Explore a post-apocalyptic sea of clouds in this cozy photography game.

https://youtu.be/u1z8yeXmMYY

It's a little directionless but the primary goal is to fill out the collectipedia which you'll find in the pause menu. 
There are collectible hints scattered across the map so turn on some tunes of your choice and sail the cloud sea!

I used this LD as an excuse to rapidly prototype features I'd been wanting to do for a while (including: a vehicle, day/night cycle, render-texture based deformation shader, in-game camera and photo album, and photography-based objectives)

**CHANGELOG**
```
###CHANGE LOG (04/07/25 8:20 PM)
Initial builds uploaded
###CHANGE LOG (04/07/25 9:22 PM)
Fixed issue where certain photo subjects could not be captured in build
Fixed issue where hints were assigned to wrong collectipedia entry
Removed placeholder pickup asset
###CHANGE LOG (04/07/25 9:44 PM)
Fixed issue where falling in the hole was not reseting player or ship position
```

games.name: Scampi
games.body:
This game is made in 3 days for Ludum Dare 57! 
![Logo.png](///raw/c6d/65/z/6b3b6.png)
You are SCAMPI - a small company that pledged to clean the oceans from all kinds of toxic waste and trash and you finally got your first mission.
Your task is to clean up a small dying coral reef and you only have a small vessel with a single grappler and a trash barge at your disposal. Can you make it happen?
![Start of the level.png](///raw/c6d/65/z/6b02b.png)

## Controls:

WASD or arrow keys to move
Press W or UP while next to the barge to be lifted up
Press S or DOWN while on the barge to be released

Collect and bring TRASH into the barge to earn KARMA
Spend KARMA on the barge to get upgrades

Watch out for OXYGEN level!

Reach TOXICITY less than 10% to win the game
![Grab.png](///raw/c6d/65/z/6b02d.png)

## Credits: 

Programming/Music/Design by Alexander Polyakov

Art/Design by Nika Khudonogova

## Tools and libraries

[raylib](https://www.raylib.com/index.html) - render, sound, input, OS interaction

[flecs](https://www.flecs.dev/flecs/) - ECS

[Aseprite](https://www.aseprite.org) - sprites

[SunVox](https://warmplace.ru/soft/sunvox/) - music, sound effects

games.name: Range of behavior
games.body:
You're in a police interrogation and you must act according to the answers of the accused.

Will you be a good cop or a bad cop?


![Screenshot_1.PNG](///raw/1a1/a5/z/6aba4.png)


Made during the "Ludum Dare 57".

The theme was "Depths".

For the theme, i was mainly thinking about the "depth" (the range, to be more specific) of personnally some people can have.



I was alone for this project.

Unfortunately i coudn't work for all the 72h for the jam due to some personnal situations.

I was only able to work for about 24h in total, probably less.

Controls :

Left Click : Interract

R : Restart the game



Known Issues (had 24h instead of 72h) :

-There is no ending to the game. You were supposed to know if you made the right choice and then make it to an ending.

-There was supposed to be way more sounds than there actually is right now.

-The environment was supposed to change depending on what choice you've done.

(for exemples : the flipped table, a knife in the guy's leg, a cup of coffee, etc..)

-If you're doing a lot of good and bad choices, the grade at the end may be bugged.

games.name: BoP
games.body:
# This is Bob.

![6af35.png](///raw/eed/43/z/6b24d.png)

Bob is a nice skeleton.

But there's one problem...  
He should be **dead**, not **undead**.

**SEND HIM TO HELL!!! üî•üíÄ**

---

## üïπ Controls

Super simple ‚Äî made for mobile!

Just **tap** (or press Spacebar / click):

- **On the ground:** Tap to **jump**
- **In the air:** Tap to **dash down**

That‚Äôs it. Pure bone-crushing action.

---

## üõ† Tools Used

- **Blender** ‚Äì Models & Animations  
- **Onshape** ‚Äì The stairs of doom  
- **Godot** ‚Äì Game engine  
- **[Suno AI](https://suno.com/)** ‚Äì Music (yes, it's AI ‚Äî the game felt empty without it!)  
- **Logic Pro X & Audacity** ‚Äì Sound effects

All models, animations, and SFX were created during the jam.  
Only the music was AI-generated.

games.name: Dante's Mini-Golf
games.body:
Escape the depths of Hell with a rousing round of mini-golf!

Welcome to a modern day retelling of the classic Dante's Inferno!

Mini-golf your way through the  nine circles of Hell in this fiendishly difficult game  that you can play right in your browser!

Can you escape?? This game is extremely difficult. You have been warned.

Highly recommended to play using the full-screen button in the bottom right corner. It will make it easier to line up shots and in windowed mode the shot tracking tends to get a bit glitchy if it leaves the window.


Controls:

Hold the Left Mouse Button and pull backwards to line up your shots.
M to mute audio.

Created with: Godot 4.4.1, Aseprite, Bosca Ceoil Blue, Audacity


![screenshot1.png](///raw/d2e/55/z/6afe4.png)


This is my third ever solo submission to Ludum Dare and my first time taking on a project of this size in about a year. Feeling a bit rusty, but learned a lot this year! 

Would love to get advice so please feel free to leave me whatever criticisms you have in the comments!

games.name: Ib the First City
games.body:
Ib: The First City tells the story of a civilization founded around a cosmic Seed‚Äînot to flourish, but to be harvested. Players guide its eerie growth through shifting ages, shaping its fate with each decision. As the city ascends, so does the mystery of its true purpose.



# Gameplay
Rotate the ring and play cards. 
Play cards to gain or trade resources -  Life, Sanity and Shell.
It's a roguelike deckbuilder... of sorts.

![Unity_SBqawfxbeB.png](///raw/a7b/f1/z/6aadd.png)


## How to Win
Reach maximum Ascension. 
Kill monsters to take their souls and turn them into your Power.
Use Power to perform Rituals that unlock new cards. 
Use the new cards to gain Ascension.

## How to Lose
Getting any resource (Life, Sanity, Shell) to 0 will spawn a Doom card. If a End of Age card is played while Doom is present, it's game over. The game is also pretty fragile controls-wise, so please don't madly spam all the keys or it will break :D.



![Unity_5jhA0WpaO1.png](///raw/a7b/f1/z/6aad7.png)
# Inspiration
As a big fan of Ring of Pain (the GOAT!) and Lovercraftian mythos, I always wanted to replicate the mechanics and put an eldritch spin on the card-choosing approach. My goal for this jam was to prepare a working base to check if this idea even makes sense. I believe it does, but needs way more thinking and balancing. 

## Theme
The theme was not particularly respected, except for the fact that the city is supposed to be placed in some 'depths'. The big idea was that the Star Seed lands on the surface with enough force to stop only deep underground - then as the City grows, it digs itself out. Little has remained of this ambitious plan.

![Unity_50O3wnrhYM.png](///raw/a7b/f1/z/6aae0.png)
## Assets
I used a lot of different assets I had in my library, mostly from HumbleBundles and what was free. Card images are all generated with ChatGPT. 


Thanks for reading! I hope you enjoy your time in the First City

![Unity_Hm43OTb8Fd.png](///raw/a7b/f1/z/6aae1.png)
### Cheats
The game can get frustrating, so I left debug value controls on. 
Y/H, U/J, I/K, O/L, P/; - these keys control the resources. 

FIX 1:
1. Last (endless) level not regenerating correctly
2. Typos in card names
