games.name: Cave Hunter
games.body:
**Game Title: Cave Hunter**  

---  

### **Game Description:**  
**Descend. Survive. Conquer.**  

In **Cave Hunter**, you take on the role of a daring prospector, descending into a monster-infested abyss on a rickety **elevator platform**. Your mission? Mine valuable **minerals**, arm yourself with powerful **weapons**, and fortify your platform against relentless attacks‚Äîall while racing toward a final showdown with a terrifying **boss** lurking at the bottom.  

The deeper you go, the deadlier the caves become. Monsters will swarm you, damage your platform, and test your reflexes. **If your platform falls, it‚Äôs game over.**  

### **Controls:**  
- **Movement:** **WASD**  
- **Pick Up Items:** **E**  
- **Drop Items:** **Q**  
- **Shoot:** **Left Mouse Click**  
- **Aim:** **Mouse Movement**  
- **Interact/Repair:** **E**
- **Pause:** **ESC**  

---  
**Will you reach the bottom‚Ä¶ or become another victim of the depths?**  

*(If you have problems starting the game here, check the link below)*

games.name: Drifting to the deep
games.body:
![image.png](///raw/cd7/c4/z/6ad15.png)

Imagine it's the 90s, Eurobeat is playing on the radio, and you're trying to find a space in the Hilbert Hotel's underground car park. You would think that an infinite hotel would have a few spaces available, but so far no luck!

So keep drifting down into the depths of this infinite car park and let's see how far you can get.

For some reason, there is a timer for each sub-level, so hurry up!

Points are awarded based on how fast and how many levels you complete.

Steer with WASD or the arrow keys, boost with SPACE or Shift.

There is no drift button because you ALWAYS drift.

Maybe mute the game music and put on some actual Eurobeat, (Deja Vu works great).

![image2.png](///raw/cd7/c4/z/6ad35.png)
![image3.png](///raw/cd7/c4/z/6ad2a.png)

Credits:

@Sparrowson - Programming

@schlock - Programming and Level Design

@katjes13 - Visual Design and Level Design

@fischbroetchen - Visual Design

@blackout-x11 - Programming

Music by Benjamin Lau

games.name: Steel Coffin
games.body:
# üìñ Introduction

In the darkest days of the Atlantic War, a lone submarine sets out on a perilous journey beneath the waves. Tasked with providing critical support to Allied forces in Europe, your vessel must cross a vast, unforgiving ocean. Silent, and under constant threat. The cold steel around you groans under the pressure, and the only thing standing between survival and a watery grave is your crew‚Äôs grit and your command.

As enemy planes hunt overhead and the deep crushes in below, you must navigate a deadly balance of depth, speed, and silence. Every decision carries weight ‚Äî push too hard and systems will fail, rise too close and you risk detection. Manage your crew, repair what you can, and pray the hull holds. This is not just a mission... it‚Äôs a descent into the unknown.

# üéì How To Play

## üéØ The Objective
Your mission is to safely guide your submarine across the Atlantic and reach Europe. To survive the journey, you‚Äôll need to manage your crew and systems while balancing depth and speed. Keep the sub running, avoid detection, and hold together long enough to complete your crossing.

## üïπÔ∏è Basic Controls 

- **Left Mouse Button** To pick up and move crew members.
- **Middle Mouse Button/WASD** to pan the camera.
- **Scroll Wheel** to zoom the camera in and out.
- **Up & Down Arrows** surface and dive the submarine.
- **Left & Right Arrows** to increase and decrease your speed.

<sup>Cover image generated with AI</sup>

Hey guys,

It‚Äôs her first Ludum Dare, so I did my best to share everything I‚Äôve learned so far.
Even though we struggled a bit to come up with a fun way to make the game more engaging, we had a great time working together‚Äîand we‚Äôre already brainstorming new game ideas to try out as a team.
All in all, we‚Äôre happy to have finished a game, and we hope you have fun playing it! üòä

games.name: Deep Dive
games.body:
Dive from space down into the depths of the Earth, to discover true power.‚Äã‚Äã

Works on desktop (preferred) or mobile web (a bit janky - on mobile you'll need to use the [Itch.io version](https://mgiuca.itch.io/deep-dive) in order to go full screen).

## ‚ÄãHow to play

On the web: activate fullscreen mode in settings.

* Keyboard: Left/right or A/D to move. R to restart. Esc for menu.
* Controller: Left stick (left/right) to move. Back to restart. Start for menu.
* Touch: Tap left and right side of screen to move. Menu button in lower right corner.

[Play in browser at Itch.io if this isn't working](https://mgiuca.itch.io/deep-dive), or try refreshing the page.

![Screenshot from 2025-04-08 11-48-01.png](///raw/52a/36/z/6b138.png)

## ‚Äã‚ÄãCredits

Game design, programming, music, sounds by Matt Giuca.

Art from various sources, notably [Kenney.nl](https://kenney.nl/)‚Äã. See in-game Credits for full information.

## Tools

* Engine: Built with Godot 4.4.
* Music: Reaper, Surge XT synthesizer.
* Sounds: jsfxr, Audacity.
* Graphics: Gimp, Inkscape, Blender.

Collect as many gems as you can within 1000 moves!

Controls

- Arrows/WASD/Left stick/Tap: **Move**
- Enter/A/Tap player: **Descend** (only to already visited tiles)
- Backspace/B/Tap "Ascend": **Ascend**
- Escape/Start/Tap "Menu": **Open menu**

Tips

- Deeper layers have more gems, but also more enemies and fewer descent points.
- You can also ascend by moving into a larger tile.
- Tiles with enemies or locked doors are more likely to contain useful items.
- Look for descents on the layer below you before descending to it.

**Hotfix 1:** Fixed a bug where restarting wouldn't work if you ran out of health

**Hotfix 2:** Fixed a bug causing gems to be 10x rarer than intended

games.name: definitely not a meth game
games.body:
![StartScreen.jpg](///raw/157/36/z/6a554.jpg)

definitely not a meth game
LudumDare 57 (250405‚Äì250407)

Built a small game in Godot 4 after ~10 casual hours of prior tinkering.
- Project was 90% ChatGPT-guided
- Used AI-generated assets (BGM, SFX, splash screen).
- Graphics made in Figma

Key Features & Learnings:
- Instantiated assets with dynamic parameters.
- Godot 4 UI pretty comfy!
- Drag-and-drop mechanics with snapping zones.
- Line2D points system
- Visual/audio cues for user feedback and reinforcement.
- Used AnimationPlayer and _draw() for effects like pops, wipes, and tickers.
- Tweaked a UV texture shader, mostly by trial and error

Have fun and good luck!

games.name: Used To Be
games.body:
![g2.gif](///raw/4d2/63/z/6ae18.gif)

# Story
You're between 35 and 45. You will no longer recognize your reflection in the shop windows on your way to work. House ‚Äî office ‚Äî house. Coffee that hasn't smelled for a long time. A sofa where you drown but don't rest. 


They advised to "go to a psychologist." You postponed the visit exactly 437 times: either you were in a hurry, or you were lazy, or "it'll do anyway." But today, there's a crumpled business card in your pocket, a taxi with worn seats, and you notice how your palms leave wet marks on the doorjamb. 


The office does not look like a medical one. No questionnaires, no standardized tests. Just a chair, dim lights, and a quiet voice.: 

> "Just relax. We'll start when you're ready."

*The door closes.*

![g3.gif](///raw/4d2/63/z/6ae1d.gif)



---

# CONTROLS

**WASD** - move

**SPACE** - jump

**Q** and **E**	- rotate room

**F** - use interactive objects
---

# Team

**Heiden.BZR**‚Äã: programmer, sound designer, manager

‚Äã**Egor Murza**‚Äã: 3d artist & textures

‚Äã**Arkadii Mikhailov‚Äã**: level designer, game designer, narrative designer

**‚ÄãPhen**‚Äã: sound designer, level artist, ui artist, textures


---


**AI** used for: background music (**suno.ai**) & backpack 3d model (**meshy**). Other sounds are taken from free stocks.

games.name: The Depths of Darkwood: Drunkard's Survival
games.body:
# Welcome!
This is my take at the Theme. I wanted to introduce it more like lore and feel, not that much of a gameplay mechanic. For a lot of time i wanted to play around with the idea of a top-down survival (but with a twist), and i thought "NOW is the chance!". All feedback is welcome, and let me know if i should develop it into a full game. Thanks a lot for Playing!\

# [Story time]

You are the knight, who's fond of the king's daughter - the beautiful princess. You train hard every day, in hopes that she notices you. Every day is a struggle for her attention. There is an event soon, where you need to be the princess' personal guard. You think that is finally your chance! But later you learn that the event is actually the princess' wedding. You are heartbroken. And what is the best medicine for a broken heart? That's right! Alcohol. But you've had too much at the local pub and you seem to be lost on your way home into the Darkwood forest where flesh-eating slime reside. The only thing with you is your personal see-in-the-dark slime, who also happens to be your bestfriend and drinking buddy. Survive for as long as possible, and evade the deadly Mobs.
 
# {Controls}


WASD / Arrow Keys -> Movement

Space -> Roll

ESC -> Pause Game

games.name: Gas Giant Airship
games.body:
**Note:** It seems like the ldjam.com embedded version may not work on Chrome. The Alternate link below seems to work fine?

You know how some sci-fi universes have stations floating inside of gas giants, or dense atmospheres like Venus'? You control an airship bringing cargo between several of those.

![Airship.png](///raw/c33/z/6a195.png)

Different layers (depths) of the atmosphere have different air currents. If you use these properly, you can get to your destinations much faster, and if you don't account for the wind, you might not be able to get there at all.

This game isn't my best work, but hopefully the concept is at least briefly interesting. If you find the Normal mode boring, try Hot Air Balloon mode! It's weird and hard, but more unique and closer to my original idea (thought of when voting on themes - I repurposed my idea for "Layers").

#### Controls:
- **Left Click** to move towards the mouse
- **Mouse wheel** to zoom
- **Esc** to return to the main menu

games.name: Inner Beasts
games.body:
**Controls**: Arrow keys or W / A / S / D

**The Mind.**  
A chubby but determined psychiatrist begins a routine hypnosis session, and suddenly finds himself trapped inside his patient's nightmare-ridden subconscious.

Armed with his Lantern of Truth, he must journey deep into her psyche to confront three inner demons:

**Phlegma** - the embodiment of apathy  
**Fear** ‚Äì a shadow from the past  
**Anger** ‚Äì pure, destructive rage

Each level is a metaphor. Every monster reflects a hidden pain.

Your task is to help the patient take back control of her mind
    

---

**Features**

- A unique story told through the protagonist‚Äôs thoughts
    
- Original soundtrack composed for the game
    
- Symbolic, minimalistic art style
    
- Short, meaningful levels with emotional depth
    

---

**The Creators**

**JsCommander** ‚Äì code and art

games.name: Jellylight
games.body:
Drift into the deep in **Jellylight: Descent into the Deep**, a serene-but-spooky descent where you play as a glowing jellyfish plunging into the darkest depths of the ocean.

Keep your glow alive by collecting bioluminescent krill, dodge hostile sea creatures, and light the way forward as you fall further and further into the abyss. But be careful‚Äîif your light goes out, you're lost to the dark.

Will you reach the mysterious light waiting 100 meters below?

## Instructions
- **Move:** Use the WASD keys or Arrow Keys to glide left and right.
- **Pulse Jump:** Press the **Spacebar** to boost upward slightly.
- **Survive:** Avoid hostile fish, collect krill to recharge your glow, and descend carefully.

Your goal? **Reach 100 meters deep** without running out of light!

## Tools
- Unity
- Procreate
- Adobe Photoshop
- Logic
- Adobe Audition
- JetBrains Rider
- Fork

---

games.name: üêæ Deep Meowgotiations
games.body:
![itch-banner-01.jpg](///raw/90d/2/z/6acdb.jpg)

**Stack your cash, push your luck, and out-negotiate your rivals in this corporate cat showdown!**

Deep Meowgotiations is a card-based negotiation game where you play as corporate cats fighting for budget supremacy. Draw cards, collect cash, but beware - the deeper you go, the more the CEO watches! The cat with the deepest stack of cash wins.

[Play in your browser here](https://silasreinagel.itch.io/deep-meowgotiations)

---

## Full Description

### The Corporate Cat-astrophe

Welcome to WHISKR, the most PAW-some social media company in the world! Your team's MEOW-velous new project, SnapCat, is the next big thing in feline social media. But there's a problem - six department teams are fighting over the budget!

### The Game

* Draw cards to collect cash for your department
* Each decision takes you deeper into corporate intrigue
* The deeper you go, the more the C-Suite Chiefs watch
* Play as 10 different unique cat characters with special powers
* Risk it all for a kitty bank that overflows, or play it safe with a small pile of coins
* The cat with the deepest stack of cash wins!

### Features

* **Push Your Luck**: Go deeper for bigger rewards, but risk losing it all
* **Unique Cat Characters**: Each with special powers that change how you play
* **Risk vs Reward**: Push your luck or play it safe - the choice is yours
* **Corporate Cat Theme**: A fresh take on corporate life with feline flair
* **Card-Based Mechanics**: Simple to learn, challenging to master

### Theme Connection

The "Depth" theme is reflected in multiple layers of gameplay:

* **Negotiation Depth**: Each decision takes you deeper into corporate intrigue
* **Risk Depth**: The deeper you push your luck, the higher the stakes
* **Cash Depth**: The cat with the deepest stack of cash wins
* **Strategic Depth**: Multiple layers of decision-making in each turn

How deep are you willing to go for that budget? Will you stay in the shallows of safety and inch ahead of your rival, or dive deep for a massive payoff?

### Development Notes

Created in 72 hours for Ludum Dare 57, DEEP MEOWGOTIATIONS combines strategic depth with feline corporate chaos. The game was inspired by the tension of corporate budget meetings and my love for cats who think they own the world.

### Credits

* Everything: Silas Reinagel

## Controls

* Use your Mouse to click on the Game Interface Buttons

## Support

If you enjoy the game, please consider:

* Rating the game
* Leaving a comment
* Sharing with friends
* Following for future updates

games.name: Fridge Dive
games.body:
# **Fridge Dive**

---

**Fridge Dive** is a casual puzzle game. As night falls, you're hungry and need to carefully grab the food you crave from the fridge, all while avoiding collisions with other items inside the fridge. Every sound of collision could be the trigger to wake up your mother‚Äîcan you satisfy your hunger before she wakes up, or will you be caught red-handed?

---

## **Basic Controls:**

- **Move the mouse** ‚Üí Aim at the food  
- **Click Left Mouse Button** ‚Üí Grab the food  
- **Hold Right Mouse Button** ‚Üí Move the camera horizontally
- **Hold Spacebar** ‚Üí Pull the food out

---

> ![Screenshot 2025-04-08 005222.png](///raw/407/46/z/6a3b8.png)

---

## **Heartbeat Quick-time Event:**

- When the screen shows a shrinking circle, press Spacebar at the right moment ‚Üí Steady your heartbeat!
  
---
  
> ![Screenshot 2025-04-08 011630.png](///raw/407/46/z/6a3a8.png)

---

## **Winning Conditions:**

- Get everything shown in the menu.

---

> ![Screenshot 2025-04-08 012546.png](///raw/407/46/z/6a3bb.png)

---

## **Failure Conditions:**

- When the alertness bar fills up or you failed to steady your heartbeat, your mother wakes up.

> ![Screenshot 2025-04-08 012901.png](///raw/407/46/z/6a3c3.png)

---

## **Tips:**

- When you pick up the food, it shakes, so remember to time it right and zoom in to guide it through the gaps between obstacles.

---

# **It‚Äôs all for the midnight snack!**

---

## **Developer Notes:**
We came up with this idea from our personal experiences of rummaging through the depths of our fridges for food, sometimes behind our parents' back. We wanted to create a sense of tension when playing, so we added the QTE where you almost get discovered by your parents. Hope you enjoy our game!

games.name: SONAR
games.body:
Platform 871 stands as mankind's ultimate engineering marvel - the first floating nuclear
facility ever constructed on open seas. Spanning over 300 square kilometers across the
Pacific's western frontier, this leviathan of steel and concrete once channeled the atom's
fury into boundless energy for coastal nations. Now its molten core lies entombed in the
Mariana Trench's lightless depths, spewing radioactive venom that multiplies
exponentially through ocean currents.
Humanity and marine ecosystems face an existential crisis measured in hours. You've
been drafted into the final desperate strike force - descending 30,000 feet in a jury-rigged
submersible to retrieve every fissile fragment before Earth's hydrological cycle becomes
irreversibly poisoned. This is a one-way plunge into the abyss. Our vessels lack energy for
that depth. Survival demands scavenging energy from the very reactor debris we find.
Improvise. Adapt. Collect the core's malignant shards to fuel your crusade against
annihilation. The fate of all lives hangs on your ability to outthink the crushing darkness.

games.name: Europan Expedition
games.body:
# Explore the depths of sub-zero Europa.

## With the discovery of what appears to be a liquid cave system in the frozen outer core, this mission to Jupiter's moon Europa hopes to learn what they can about the oceans within.

## Controls
- **Steer left and right with `A/D`,`J/L` or `Left/Right Arrows`**.
- **Slow descent with `W`,`I` or `Up`**.
- **Toggle waystation deploy mode with `Space`**. There's an audio cue for on/off.
- **Then collide with a surface to deploy**. The waystation will attach and your submersible can keep going.

## Instructions

- **Your energy depletes constantly** in the cold. Info at the top left of the screen
- You will **return to the launch point when it runs out**.
- Max energy is 40, you start with max when you launch.
- **Deploy a waystation to recharge energy**. You get +20 when you deploy.
- **Touch a waystation on your next run to recharge**. You get +20 energy as well.
- Each run you can **use a chain of waystations to descend deeper and deeper**.
- **You need 50 materials to construct a replacement waystation** at the start of each descent.
- Materials info on the top right of the screen.
- Gathering a material resource gives you +10 materials.
- Takes about 15-20 mins on average for a full playthrough to the best ending.
- Use `M` to toggle the music.

![cover_image.png](///raw/8c8/2/z/6a67a.png)

## Tools
- Godot 4.4
- Aseprite
- Garageband
- Bfxr
- VSCode & iTerm for minor coding bits
- Figma & Trello for planning
- Chasm Palette - from LoSpec created by dysphoriaa

## Mini-mortem
This is the first game I've built in Godot, my goal for the jam was to learn how to build a game with Godot and to make  background music & sound effects (because I always drop them). Originally I was going to enter the Compo but I ofc bit off more than I could chew. I decided I'd like to add a little more than I could get done in the 48 hours, so it's a Jam entry but it's all built by myself, the game is much better for the extra time.

I said to myself before the jam: "No level design! It always takes too long!" :laughing: 

## Hints and known issues
- Don't restart if you're getting close to the end of the 5 days. Stick it out.
- There's no in-game restart, you have to refresh the page. Soz.
- The material resources are the little green diamonds scattered about.
- You can attach the waystation to the walls at the side if you need to.

games.name: Thats deep bro
games.body:
This is a game about rolling a fat reefer and taking a perfect hit from it :smirk: 

![rolling5.gif](///raw/da7/93/z/6b164.gif)

**How to play**
- Step 1: Left click to spread the weed on the joint. Use the weed spread meter to spread it evenly for a perfect experience.
- Step 2: Move the mouse and use the scroll to roll the joint (scroll up and down, as if you're rolling it for real lol). In this step you can correct some mistakes you did in step 1.
- Step 3: Hold left click to chief on your dooby. Take a proper long hit but dont hit it for too long or you might cough and everybody will think you're a rookie.

![rolling3.gif](///raw/da7/93/z/6b168.gif)

![rolling4.gif](///raw/da7/93/z/6b16a.gif)

You can press F or F4 to switch to fullscreen. And escape to quit.

**How is this related to the theme ?**

Eh well it isn't really. Originally I wanted to add a cutscene at the end of the game where I would generate randomly some dumb sentences that we tend to say when we're high, and there would be a guy that would say "Damn thats deep bro". This cutscene is where this whole game idea came from. Sadly I didn't find the time to do it :pensive: 

**Known issue**

For some reason after a certain time the game can fuck with some windows interface. I hope its not because of my horrible code but it seems that I am not the only one having this issue: https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/89712

Music made by my good friend Lord Grand Swag: https://soundcloud.com/lordgrandswag

games.name: Deep Truth

Hear me out, bro.‚Äã‚Äã

A sentence, spoken. A promise of what is to come. Like Socrates and Plato, now you will delve into the depths of truth to unveil what lies beneath. Among bottles of half-drunk beer and shafts of mushrooms nibbled, lies Nirvana.

Welcome to Deep Truth. The game about digging your rabbit hole together with a trusted companion - and falling through time and space to reach the ultimate conclusion. Perhaps Emma Watson made frogs susceptible to Wi-Fi? Perhaps the Bible tells the REAL story of 9/11 if you read it backwards at midnight. We will never know unless we delve deep into the pits of our minds to reach...

‚Äã‚ÄãDEEP TRUTH.‚Äã‚Äã

A tiny robot. A vast, forgotten world. And a journey to the center of it all.

You awaken deep underground - surrounded by glowing crystal plains, towering mushroom forests, and endless dark caverns. You don‚Äôt remember who you are. But something calls you from below, and you know you must follow.

Explore a mysterious underworld through turn-based, tile-based traversal. Each tile holds a surprise - resource caches, cryptic travelers, strange creatures, or remnants of long-lost machines. Some are funny. Some are haunting. Some may try to eat you.

Along the way, you‚Äôll find broken guardians, buried secrets, and odd little moments of quiet beauty.

Will you survive the depths and reach the heart of this world?

![CopperSoul1.png](///raw/83a/92/z/6ad76.png)

games.name: Rise to the Unknown
games.body:
Fuel an archaic elevator and race against the clock to rise to the depths of the Unknown!

Rise to the Unknown is a simple 2D platformer in which you collect fuel for an ancient elevator - your only means of making it to the top. Watch your step and be nimble on your feet, as no living being has ever returned from the Unknown...

# Controls
- [ WASD ] - move
- [ Space bar ] - jump
- [ E ] - pick up fuel

Pick up fuel, throw it in the furnace, press the green button to take off and the red button to halt. Rinse and repeat!

games.name: Plumb Bob Rescue
games.body:
![plumb-bob-rescue.png](///raw/749/d5/z/6a724.png)

"Plumb Bob Rescue"

Play as Plum, the little astronaut, out to save Bob, who's gone and got himself stuck.

Navigate around the map - using the checkpoints to help you reach different areas around the cave.

-- SUMMARY AND CONTROLS --

Aim your controls with 'W' and 'S', when you're ready. Press and hold 'space' to charge your launch.

Use 'A' and 'D' to steer your landing. 

Time your release, by pressing 'space' to let go of the rope.

If you're having trouble press 'E' to create a new checkpoint. You can stack them ;)

-- DETAILS --

![lonely-bob.png](///raw/749/d5/z/6a751.png)
Find Bob. He gets lonely easily...

games.name: Deep Dreamers
games.body:
**Deep Dreamers** is a small and kinda cozy action platformer with retro early 16bit-era vibes.
The player is a heroine trying to save a girl from the perpetual sleep, 
fighting nightmares in the deep cave of her mind.


Is my first take into a more action-platform game :)
All the art, music, sound effects etc were made by me

I highly recommend to play it on ITCH.IO for fullscreen size view



Controls -----------------------------------------------

* Move: Arrow Keys
* Jump: Space
* Shoot: D
* Carry/Drop the girl: S
* Drop from a platform: Down + Jump

* Advance text on cutscene: Space

* GAMEPAD is fully supported

To shoot you need to not be holding the girl.

----------------------------------------------------------
Tools:

* Godot 4.4
* Aseprite
* Reaper
* Sourcetree + Github
* Audacity
* ChipTone

Version 1.1:----------------------------------------------

Fixed bugs:
* Body falling after teleport
* CRT filter not displaying on cutscenes
* Stucked out of screen after death
* Brown Nightmare collision shape size
* Girl falling over when drop in a wall
* 4:3 aspect ratio not updated

games.name: Del√©trius
games.body:
üéÆ Nome do Jogo: Delet√©rius ‚Äì Paz em Meio √† Guerra

Empresa: R27 G.P. Gyn;
Instagram do jogo: @deleterius_fgame.r27gp;

üß† Resumo da Hist√≥ria (Sinopse):
Em um mundo marcado pelas cicatrizes de uma guerra recente, um m√©dico recebe uma carta misteriosa convidando-o para trabalhar em uma cidade distante e esquecida. Sem saber exatamente o que esperar, ele aceita o convite, motivado por seu desejo de ajudar vidas e recome√ßar.

Ao chegar, se depara com pacientes que apresentam comportamentos estranhos e perturba√ß√µes mentais severas. Conforme atende cada morador, ele come√ßa a perceber que os problemas v√£o muito al√©m da medicina tradicional ‚Äî h√° algo mais profundo e sombrio por tr√°s daquelas mentes fragilizadas.

Aos poucos, o jogador descobre que essas doen√ßas est√£o ligadas a traumas gerados por fatores como estresse, gen√©tica, nutri√ß√£o inadequada, infec√ß√µes perinatais, exposi√ß√£o a ambientes t√≥xicos e, principalmente, as marcas invis√≠veis deixadas pela guerra.

üí• Objetivo do Jogo:
Guiar o m√©dico em sua jornada por essa cidade devastada, tratando os pacientes, explorando o passado dos moradores e descobrindo a verdade sobre a guerra que devastou aquela regi√£o. Com isso, o jogador aprende a import√¢ncia da empatia, da escuta e da n√£o viol√™ncia.

‚úùÔ∏è Mensagem Central (Moral):
"Paz em meio √† guerra" n√£o √© apenas o subt√≠tulo ‚Äî √© o cora√ß√£o do jogo. A proposta √© mostrar que, mesmo em cen√°rios de destrui√ß√£o, o caminho da toler√¢ncia, da empatia e da f√© ainda √© poss√≠vel.

Inspirado por valores crist√£os, o jogo tamb√©m traz reflex√µes sobre a import√¢ncia da brandura, um dos frutos do Esp√≠rito Santo, como diz em G√°latas 5:23. O personagem principal representa essa luta interna entre julgar e acolher, entre condenar e curar.

üß© Elementos do Jogo:
G√™nero: Aventura / Psicologia / Mist√©rio / Interativo com di√°logos profundos.

Narrativa por fases: Cada paciente representa um caso √∫nico com causas diferentes (traumas, m√° nutri√ß√£o, fatores gen√©ticos, etc).

Easter eggs: Fragmentos escondidos revelam pistas sobre a guerra que arruinou a cidade.

Final alternativo: Baseado em como o jogador trata os pacientes (com empatia ou descaso).

üåø P√∫blico-alvo:
F√£s de jogos narrativos e psicol√≥gicos;

Pessoas que buscam experi√™ncias com profundidade emocional;

Crist√£os e jogadores que apreciam mensagens de f√© e supera√ß√£o;

Participantes de eventos como GameJam que valorizam originalidade e prop√≥sito.

Mec√¢nicas: A parte maioria do jogo as mec√£nicas funconam atrav√©s de clique no mouse e digita√ß√£o padr√£o (portugu√™s ou English)

games.name: Lost In The Abyss - Ê∑±Ê∏äËø∑ÈÄî
games.body:
![‰∏ªËèúÂçï+ÊñáÂ≠ó.png](///raw/cfd/36/z/6a5a6.png)
The daughter of marine biologist Li Xiang has contracted a rare disease, and the antidote exists in the symbiotic tissues of special minerals and luminescent fish in the deep sea floor. However, the government and major pharmaceutical companies refused to fund deep-sea research. When his daughter was in critical condition, he decided to dive alone to search for a cure.
![{16A12A27-D19A-839A-06C1-C9F82F6A8C84}.png](///raw/cfd/36/z/6a52c.png)
This is a 2D vertical scrolling game, in which players will play the role of a father who has to go to the seabed to find a cure for his daughter's rare disease. By collecting resources, making equipment, and fighting against underwater creatures, players will continuously explore downwards and ultimately uncover the truth behind the sinking.

games.body:
https://youtu.be/bi2t4vi86Qw

![image1.png](///raw/efb/36/z/6acfe.png)

![image2.png](///raw/efb/36/z/6ad0c.png)

![image3.png](///raw/efb/36/z/6ad13.png)

Scan your environment and try to reached the end without falling!

# Instructions

- AD (or QD depending if you have *azerty* or *qwerty*) to __move Left/Right__
- SPACE or W (or Z) to __jump__
- Aim and press LMB to __scan__ the environment and discover the reality
- Complete the levels without falling or touching spikes

# Tips

- You can keep the LMB pressed to scan (you don't have to spam click)
- Try to jump a lot to have a better vision of what is going on


# Credits
## Programmers

- slyz
- antonin_granados

- slyz
- Novamono (Dafont)

games.name: A Call from the Void
games.body:
![cover_art.png](///raw/6ee/06/z/6a94e.png)
Your tenth birthday arrives, and you feel the familiar sting of loneliness, a constant companion in the crowded city. All you wished for was connection, someone to understand the quiet hum in your soul. Instead, your eccentric grandmother presents you with a dusty shortwave radio and a worn, leather-bound book filled with strange symbols and codes.

Using your new equipment, who knows what mysteries you'll learn. The deeper into space you go, the more the mysteries unravel.

games.name: Coffin' Time
games.body:
![screen 1.png](///raw/ee6/c5/z/69a43.png)
 **Joe the cemetery caretaker needs to DRILL in order to store all the coffins of the newly deceased townfolks.**


Play here : https://nicolanore.itch.io/coffintime


There are three phases / stages in the game:

**Drill phase**

**Coffin'Time**

**Funerals**



# 1. Drill phase

Use your mouse to point the direction where you want the drill to dig.

The fuel that is consumed when the dirt is removed is limited. Plan accordingly!

You can end the drilling phase manually by clicking the button at the top right.

# 2. Coffin'Time

Use the mouse to drag and drop the coffins to bury them. Be careful, you need to finish your job before the end of the night!

You can end the burying phase manually by clicking the button at the top right.

Tip: You can stack the members of the same family together, in order to save some space. 

# 3. Funeral 

The townfolks come early in the morning to mourn their losses. Let‚Äôs hope they don‚Äôt stumble across some coffins layin in the morning sun‚Ä¶

 

*Credits :*

*Nicolas Lanore*

*Linda Hammoud*

*Alexis Louis*

*Th√©o Walcker*

*Boris Escande*

![screnshot.JPG](///raw/ee6/c5/z/69a3e.jpg)

This game was made in godot 4.4 in 48h for the Ludum Game Jam 57.

games.name: Depth Protocol
games.body:
We are the Jam Gam Gang:

Craig Harrod        - 3D Artist
Jordan Oosthuyse    - Game Designer
Kaellum Alves       - Programmer
Kudkwashe Kambarami - Lead Programmer
Leandro Dos Santos  - 3D Artist
Luke Barrows        - Technical Artist

Depth Protocol is a sci-fi puzzle-adventure game where you play as a stranded space explorer forced to make an emergency landing on a mysterious underground space station buried deep within an asteroid.

The station is abandoned, its halls echoing with silence ‚Äî but hidden within is a power core, your only hope of escaping and continuing your journey across the stars.

As you delve deeper, you'll face a series of puzzles, environmental hazards, and uncover the mystery of why the station was abandoned. Piece together what happened to the crew, restore power to the station, and navigate the depths with caution.

Every step forward is a test of logic, reflexes, and your will to survive.

Uncover the truth. Reclaim the power. Escape the depths.

games.name: Escape From GR0K Tower
games.body:
SUMMARY
-------

This is a simple Tower Escape game where you must avoid traps and find the trigger to open the gate on each floor.

There are 100 floors to escape from and each floor gets harder than the last. There is only ever ONE trigger to open the gate on the floor, there will ALWAYS be multiple traps to slow you down or hurt you.

Good Luck!

Thanks for playing my game!

TRAILER
-------

My youngest sone created a trailer for the game.

https://youtu.be/x4eToNxAvJc?si=a0KK8aYnA8FFLuPX


INSTRUCTIONS
------------
- MOVE LEFT = A or LEFT ARROW
- MOVE RIGHT = D or RIGHT ARROW
- INTERACT = E or DOWN ARROW
- JUMP = SPACE or UP ARROW
- RUN = HOLD SHIFT

X/Grok Factor
-------------

For this game I did a bit of an experiment. To come up with the idea for the game, I used GROK on X to work through the game elements and even had it generate some pseudo code, which I used for initial prototyping. I then continued to work on the game without the help of GROK to completion.

It was an interesting experiment, and I found that it was actually able to come up with several good ideas, but I needed to guide it in order to zero in on what I wanted to make.

PICTURES
--------
![2025-04-07_08-43-48.png](///raw/8f3/1/z/6a230.png)
![2025-04-07_08-44-40.png](///raw/8f3/1/z/6a22d.png)

Avoid mines and keep digging your way down! A [PICO-8](https://www.lexaloffle.com/pico-8.php) cartridge with a Minesweeper inspired game.

![p8sweeper_3.png](///raw/24e/e3/z/6a7a6.png)


![p8sweeper_6.gif](///raw/24e/e3/z/6a831.gif)


# Manual

* A number on the grid means how many mines are around that field. Diagonal mines count as half.

* Notation: a `:` symbol is used in the game to mean "and a half" (+0.5)

| In game | Value |
| -------- | ------- |
|  (no symbol) | 0 |
| `:` | 0.50 |
| `1` | 1 |
| `1:` | 1.5 |
| `2` | 2 |
| `2:` | 2.5 |
| `3` | 3 |
| `3:` | 3.5 |
| `4` | 4 |
| `4:` | 4.5 |
| `5` | 5 |

* Solving examples:

Here you can see that all of the marked fields must be empty because they touch fields with a "zero". The rightmost arrow is also empty because the `:` can only have diagonal mines close to it (otherwise it would be 1 or more).

![431121381-c4785333-4306-4c67-bda5-310de50f2751.png](///raw/24e/e3/z/6a7b5.png)

Now in the next step you can see that the only field left for the `:` must be a mine.

![431121762-e7109731-17fb-46f9-a317-fc0c4ee6d645.png](///raw/24e/e3/z/6a7b6.png)

Here you see that the corner `1` already has a diagonal mine, so it can't have any horizontally or vertically adjacent mines, otherwise it would be 1.5. The arrow to the right is showing how the only way to solve the `1:` is to place a mine there.

![431122432-e183e93a-3c55-4bad-82b8-ed24642b560e.png](///raw/24e/e3/z/6a7b7.png)

# Dev notes

* Unfortunately the board generation sometimes forces you to guess. But that makes the game more high stakes ;) But you can very often deduct things indirectly, so try to use logic!
* I made this in 48h with the Compo rules, but I started on Sunday, so couldn't submit for the Compo on time.
* It was nice to try out a new platform, I recommend giving PICO-8 a try!
* Thank you for playing! Happy to hear your feedback.

games.name: Layered
games.body:
My first Game Jam, and my first game--a minimalist puzzle game _very very very_ loosely inspired by the layers within deep neural networks. It's incredibly short, but it was a fun experience!

![Screenshot 2025-04-07 at 20.03.06.png](///raw/e87/36/z/6abfe.png)

## Fun Facts

- The entire game is written in Rust using a 2.5D game engine I'm making myself (https://gitlab.com/caer/layered), building off of work done by Macroquad (https://macroquad.rs).
- Levels are built with pixel art (https://gitlab.com/caer/layered/-/blob/main/assets/layer-5.png), which is parsed at run-time (https://gitlab.com/caer/layered/-/blame/main/src/tile.rs#L378) into a level based on which pixels are colored (and how).
- All the non-sound assets and art are my own, drawing heavily from my personal brand (https://www.caer.cc).
- The music is by MooMarMouse (https://moomarmouse.itch.io/sweet-little-ambiance) on Itch.io.
- The sound effects are by JDWasabi (https://jdwasabi.itch.io/8-bit-16-bit-sound-effects-pack) on Itch.io.

games.name: Ruby Hole
games.body:
### Summary
The gnomes are trying to get rich off the rubies üíé they find, digging tunnels deeper and deeper as long as their conscience and construction tiles hold out. Exploring the depths requires caution‚Äîno one knows what the gnomes might dig up next üêâ

### Story
Deep within the bowels of ancient mountains, two daring gnomes, Borin Stonebiter ‚Äãand Thrommir Ironbeard‚Äã, labor to create a tunnel that will lead them to treasures hidden for millennia. Despite the elders' warnings, these enterprising treasure seekers decided to begin mining the oldest land. Around them is only the echoing sound of picks and the dim light of torches illuminating the gloomy vaults of the mine. The rock here is hard as if the earth itself resists their efforts, but the gnomes do not despair: after all, in the depths awaits a cache of rubies shining brighter than stars. üåü

Borin, an experienced miner with muscular arms and a cunning gaze, keeps count of his pickaxe strikes, each time digging deeper into the stone mass. His partner, Thrommir, a calculating and cautious master blacksmith, occasionally checks the sharpness of the tools' blades to make the work go faster and more efficiently. Together they form the perfect team: one digs, the other supports, both dream of wealth waiting at the end of the path. üí∞

Each blow of the pick brings them closer to their goal. Each ruby found fills their hearts with joy and hope. And although there is still much work ahead, Borin and Thrommir are confident: someday they will reach their coveted prize and become legends among all gnomes, but at what cost? üíÄ

### Contacts
https://x.com/epiclogogames

https://t.me/epiclogogames

https://vk.com/epiclogogames

art https://vk.com/shkaflavasha


### Tutorial
We understand that a wall of text is a bad tutorial, but we didn't want to give up game features in favor of learning (even though we had to due to limited time), so we'll have to read.

![mouse.png](///raw/f76/36/z/6a34b.png)
use left mouse button for place tile on map, and use right mouse button for rotate tile to right side

![tunnel.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a5b.png)
to build tunnels, you need to connect tiles so that the tunnels on them match

![mush_pla—Åe.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a5a.png)
to build mushroom caves, you need to connect tiles so that the caves on them match

![mush_not_closed.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a59.png)
until all the borders of the existing mushroom farm tiles are closed, you will not receive bonuses for building a cave.

![mush_closed.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a53.png)
to get new tiles for completing the mushroom cave, you need to close all the borders of the tiles already exposed on the field with mushrooms.

![mush_closed_on_border.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a54.png)
the border can be combined with any title, and the side of the mushroom farm in contact with the border is considered closed.

![ruby.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a81.png)
A ruby is just a small ruby that turns out to be right in the rock, no bonuses except for the pleasant feeling of the weight of the pocket.

![hole1.png](///raw/f76/36/z/69a82.png)
Ruby Hole is the main reward for any dwarf, the more rubies the more rubies! You need to bring the tunnel to all the ruby holes you can reach.

games.name: Scavenger Deep
games.body:
![2222.png](///raw/72a/3/z/6adb5.png)

The world lies in ruins after a mysterious industrial catastrophe wiped out civilisation.

Take control of a decrepit boat and an old set of diving equipment, and embark on a perilous journey to the very depths of a contaminated reservoir.

![67657567.gif](///raw/72a/3/z/6ac6c.gif)

Scavenge for scrap and other relics of the world long gone in a desperate attempt to make ends meet, or face poverty and starvation.

![2.gif](///raw/72a/3/z/6ac8e.gif)

**KEY FEATURES**

+ Navigate your boat to discover the best scavenging spots.
+ Manage your oxygen levels and cable length, or face a horrible death in the depths.
+ Keep track of time: as the day passes the depths become darker and harder to navigate.
+ Return the scrap you find to the boat and sell it to cover your expenses.


P.S.
It was a hard challenge for us, the game is pretty raw and ~half of features were cut, but it is at it is.

We hope you enjoy  it!

Feedback and bugreport are appreciated!

"Camp Ketosis" follows Rob, a guy so bored on a Friday night that even a keto retreat brochure (despite his zero interest in dieting) seems mildly appealing. But when he arrives, he discovers the horrifying truth: the retreat is a front for a sentient mushroom colony using keto compliance to brainwash recruits. Luckily, Rob‚Äôs lifelong diet of pizza and skepticism makes him immune to their carb-deficient mind control. Now, trapped in a deep cave, he must fistfight his way through an army of keto-zombies and fungal cultists.

**Controls**

Jump: Spacebar

Move: WASD

Look: Mouse

Punch: Left Click

Efficiency is optional. Madness is guaranteed.

games.name: You Are the End
games.body:
# "The deeper you go, the more of yourself you lose."

You are a hero‚ÄîHumanity‚Äôs final hope‚Äîsent to descend into a cursed land to destroy the source of corruption.
But every step forward cracks the truth open further: You are not here to save the world. You are here to end it!

## A Descent Into the Depths

- Journey through a doomed, side-scrolling world ‚Äî from the crumbling Castle, past dying Villages, the Battlefield, and to the Throne of the End ‚Äî‚Äã where the land itself decays with each run.
- A great Population Counter ticks down ‚Äî not just a resource, but your health, your army, your soul!
- Will you sacrifice the living for power‚Ä¶ or protect the last breath of humanity?‚Äã

## The Cycle of Death

- ‚ÄãDraw a card ‚Äî Good, Neutral, or Evil. Each offers power, each demands a price.
- Lead your army or descend yourself into the battlefield.
- Fall or triumph ‚Äî either way, the truth deepens.
- New prophecy lines awaken.
- Then it begins again ‚Äî with heavier steps and darker skies.

## Your Prophecy, Written by You

- Five lines. One fate.
- Each step reveals a fragment ‚Äî shaped by your actions, your morality, and your sacrifices.
- Will the world remember you as a saviour? Or curse you as the end?

## Controls ‚Äî Commands of a Dying King

- Arrow Keys ‚Äî Walk the broken path, left and right, through ruin and ash.
- Click to Summon ‚Äî Call forth your warriors... at the cost of your people.
- Cooldowns Apply ‚Äî Each call to arms takes its toll.
- Descend as the King ‚Äî When unlocked, take the field yourself.


## Bugs/Incomplete Features -

- Descend of the King is incomplete. It was supposed to turn the game into a platformer TD from a regular TD where you control the King.
- Some issue with enemy type spawns. There are 4 enemy types, each appearing after successive 25% mark.
- The completion of the prophecy.

## If You Fall‚Ä¶ the Kingdom Falls With You.

games.name: Too Fishy
games.body:
# Too Fishy

A 2.5D underwater exploration game where you dive deeper into the ocean to catch exotic fish and search for your lost friend.

### ! The web version has lag spikes - if you are having issues, you can download the native version.
## About

In Too Fishy, you play as a deep-sea diver exploring the mysterious depths of the ocean. Catch rare fish to sell at the surface, upgrade your submarine, and dive deeper to find your friend who went missing in the darkest depths.

Catch fish, sell them, and upgrade your submarine to explore the ocean's depths. Your friend will introduce you to the world of submarine fishing, but be careful! 
The ocean is full of dangers, and you must be prepared to face them.

We used AI tools to create the games music and two of the models. The rest of the game was made by us.

games.name: AM I ORTHODOX?
games.body:
![ld57_banner.png](///raw/01d/a4/z/6af81.png)

Find answers to these questions as I help you explore the depths of your own mind.

[Play it in browser.](https://zungrysoft.github.io/ld57) (Chrome recommended.)

Controls:
- Mouse: Click on a word to add or remove it. You can drag words around if you want to organize them.
- S: Submit your question or skip animations.
- C: Clear your question.
- M: Disable music.

Sometimes the game gets super laggy for no reason. I've only seen it happen on Firefox, not Chrome. If it happens to you, just refresh the page. Your progress will be saved.

Cheats and Misc. Controls:
- Shift + H: Skip the wait for the hint button.
- Shift + P, then reload the page: Delete your progress. (This cannot be undone!)
- Shift + J, then reload the page: Unlock all words. (This cannot be undone!)

Credits:
- ZungryWare: Design, Programming, Writing, Sound Design
- Wyatt Cannon: Music

Post-Deadline Fixes (starting at commit 4c621252):
- Fixed some typos.
- Fixed some misconfigured questions.

games.name: DEPTH FIRST
games.body:
You are an AI core trained by a **CRAZY DR**. Your "Master" believes there is a **HELL**. Driven by a depth-first cursed algorithm, guide your robot through procedurally generated labyrinths: place turn stones to avoid lava flows, activate laser guns to blast through walls. When you finally breach Death's domain, how will the underworld bureaucrat judge this human-led suicide mission?

üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•
# PLAY ON WEB!!!
## Itch.io link: https://passbykamenrider.itch.io/depth-first
üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•üî•

# Tutorial:

# Important Things To Know:

# DFS in this game prioritizes in order ‚û°Ô∏è‚¨áÔ∏è‚¨ÖÔ∏è‚¨ÜÔ∏è

## Basic ControlsÔºö

**DFS (Depth-First Search)** is reimagined as the **"Hellscraper Protocol"** in this game, where the robot adheres to a directional hierarchy of Right ‚Üí Down ‚Üí Left ‚Üí Up, with priority order being the key to overcoming hellish challenges.

üèÜ‚û°Ô∏è**Left-Click to Place Turn Stones: **

Place stones on upcoming tiles to forcibly alter robot's moving direction

üì§üñ±Ô∏è**Right-Click + Hold&Drag: **

Move around to see the whole map

üö∂‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èüß≠**GO Button Starts Pathfinding: **

Robot moves with Right ‚Üí Down ‚Üí Left ‚Üí Up priority after clicking

üîÑüåç**RESET Reinstates the Level: **

Click to remove all stones **(NO LAVA AND BROKEN WALL WILL BE MOVE)**

## Tiles you need to know:

The END, jump down and find it(to find what)

Why does it always appear in the bottom right corner

![ItemKey.png](///raw/0c0/46/z/6a91c.png)

A Laser Gun! what can it do?

![ItemCrackedWall.PNG](///raw/0c0/46/z/6a91e.png)

games.name: Wobble Down
games.body:
# Concept - Story

You're a hiker walking or racing down a mountain, and your only goal is to stay upright! In the distance, you can see deep into the valley, where your hometown lies waiting. But you're not the best hiker, and your posture is pretty wobbly so don't fall over!

The character moves automatically‚Äîit's up to you to tilt and balance in all directions to avoid falling over. The mountain is snowy, windy, bumpy, and full of tricky terrain that will test your reflexes and control. Can you keep your footing and make it all the way to the cozy town in the valley without falling?

## What I wanted‚Ä¶ but didn‚Äôt quite finish (ah, Game Jam struggles!)

I ended up making the level way too big and had to rush to fill it with some content. I had planned to add more obstacles to challenge your balance, but hopefully, it still gets the idea across!

And I couldn‚Äôt really test it. So hey, bugs are free, I guess!

Sometimes the camera is in the ground, ups...

## How to Play

- Keep the balance: W/A/S/D
- Run Faster: E
- Run Slower: Q
- Pause: Escape

You can see the hiker‚Äôs balance in the corner of the screen, or reflected in the character‚Äôs spine posture. The faster you go, the more force is applied to your balance.

![3.PNG](///raw/3c5/e5/z/6a640.png)

## Windows Getting Started

Sorry just Windows only this time...
- Download zip from this page
- Unzip the file downloaded
- Start the WobbleDown.exe

## Tools

- Unity
- Blender
- Audacity

games.name: Luck Runs Out
games.body:
# *Luck Runs Out*

**A game of uncertainty, and the depth of one‚Äôs true feelings**  
_Move with **A & D** or arrow keys_

---

This is the first time I‚Äôve ever finished a game  
And also, my first ever game jam  
And‚Ä¶ maybe, my first time saying things I‚Äôve always locked inside  
  
This isn‚Äôt a game full of mechanics or challenges  
It‚Äôs not flashy, it‚Äôs not clever  
It‚Äôs nothing new  

But it‚Äôs mine,  
a small piece of me,,  

It‚Äôs a mirror, perhaps  
A proof that I did make something  
A reminder of what I could make  

I don‚Äôt know if this game will mean anything to you  
But it means something to me  
And for now, that‚Äôs enough  

---

_Any feedback is deeply appreciated._  
**Thank you for playing.**

*PS. If the web version doesn't work, you can also try the itch.io version:*  
[https://tenzz.itch.io/luck-runs-out](https://tenzz.itch.io/luck-runs-out)

games.name: Chthonic Cacophony
games.body:
Dig deep into the dictionary to help these philosophers sustain their dialogue for as long as possible. Connect their thoughts with the conversation and see how profound their rhetoric can get!

This game is playable in your browser, but we highly recommend downloading and playing the Windows build instead for better visuals and performance.

‚Äã**Content Warning!**‚Äã

1. If you are sensitive to motion or flashing lights, please proceed with caution. The movement of the pillars in the background can be overwhelming for some.
2. Our dictionary is taken from a GitHub repository‚Äã, and has not been vetted for appropriateness. Please be aware you may see some words that could be considered inappropriate.

**Controls**

This game is controlled entirely with the mouse. Left-click on the words coming out of a philosopher's head that match with the ones in the dialogue box to progress.

**Credits**

- Game design and core gameplay programming by puregarlic
- Environment art and visual processing by hextraza
- Character art and additional programming by tepichord
- Music and sound design by Holofoil

**Attributions**

- Fonts used are Redacted Script, Kalam, Flow Block, and Yatra One through the Open Font License
- Roman Marble Column model provided by Ergin ERYILDIR on SketchFab through the CC Attribution 4.0 License
Textures used from Material Pack Stone And Bricks -01 provided by Julio Sillet 3D Art through the CC Attribution 4.0 License
- Julius Ceasar bust‚Äã image provided by Following Hadrian on Openverse through the CC BY-SA 2.0 License
- Marble bust of Emperor Antonius Pius image provided by Snapshooter46 on Openverse through the CC BY-NC-SA 2.0 License

Built using Godot Engine, ProCreate Dreams, Inkscape, GIMP, Affinity Photo, Blender, Openverse, and Ableton Live.

games.name: The Deepest Diamond
games.body:
[Itch Page](https://silliest-goose.itch.io/the-deepest-diamond)

You are a cave explorer looking for interesting samples. Run with WASD or Arrows to traverse the twisting paths! Jump and dive with Space to leap dangerous gaps! Grab throw and put down specimen with E to bring them back to the minecart!

Find and retrieve all 6ish samples:

1. Amethyst Geode - Great to start.

2. Gigantic Bone - Too wide for some gaps.

3. Large Glow Worm - Wriggles too tall for some ledges.

4. Blood Opal - Several tons in weight, you can't jump while holding it.

5. Amber Drop - Sticky to the point you move at a snails pace, you can still jump though.

6. The Deepest Diamond - Deep under the lava, you will have to collect this last.

?. The Silliest Goose - ??????.

Bonus challenge: Speed run
Try and beat the Dev's time : 3:23.693
Or the fastest in the comments : Be the first!
This kinda goes on the honor system, also no geese allowed!

Dev note: This actually came out pretty good in my eyes. In previous years I've had to cut down a lot, which still happened, though to a very lesser degree. This was also my first fully 3d project. I ended up learning a lot about how unity works along the way. Anyways hope you enjoy!

PS. Sometimes it seems you can get stuck on the walls, just try and jump above the block to fix it.

Programing & Art:
The Silliest Goose

Music: Night Cave - Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/

games.name: Cutter of Grass
games.body:
Raw text underneath image!

![grasscutter_info.png](///raw/762/35/z/6aa7d.png)

Welcome to the most satisfying lawn mower experience you never knew you needed.
In "Cutter of Grass,"  you're a beetle-riding droplet, a  grass management expert on a mission to satisfy the grass needing golems. The chosen one, cutter of grass, giver of grass.  

Your trusty steed? A beetle. Not just any beetle, but a grass-cutting machine with an insatiable hunger for the greens. On aerial support you have your loyal Dragonfly, slaving away collecting that freshly cut grass. I am sure he's got the stamina for it.  

Your mission: Navigate through lush, deep grasslands, slicing and dicing vegetation like its all you know.
You're not just cutting grass for the pleasure of cutting grass. Oh no. You're collecting these fresh trimmings to appease the most discerning clients in the botanical universe; rock golems. These rocky road blockers are very particular about their grass delivery service. Want to progress? Better have a bag of grass ready.  

It's part janky racing game, part lawn mower beetle simulator, and 100% pure homegrown grass. The game jam theme was "depth," and boy, did we take that‚Ä¶somewhere‚Äîwe're talking DEEP grass.


Use WASD to control!

A / D - Turn beetle left / right

S - Slow down the beetle (easier turning)

W - Dash!!

games.body:
![Screenshot 2025-04-06 at 11.49.22‚ÄØAM.png](///raw/39b/6/z/699fd.png)

Worms are built to dig. Dig into the depths of the earth to scavenge for nutrients and grow bigger.

Use the mouse to direct a segment and click to lock it into place. 

I had intended this to have a competitive multiplayer element where players raced for the nutrients, but I ran out of time. Right now, you can see the other players but can't interact with them. 

Note: The game seems to run a bit slow on Safari.

games.name: P(urple)thulhu vs SHIPS: Tentacle Trouble!

Dive into a colorful pixel world where ancient beings are more cute than creepy!
Play as a cheerful Cthulhu, a gloomy tentacle beast, or a wide-eyed purple critter with horns! 
But beware ‚Äî even happy monsters have bad days! 

AND THE SHIPS ARE THE REASON FOR BAD DAYS

## **HOW TO PLAY**
Drag - LMB
Rotate while dragging - RMB

Drag the shapes onto the yellow tiles. Once they're covered, Ptulhu will start firing!
Destroy more than half of the enemy ships to claim victory.

Art is created by DCFAPixels during the jam (including water shader, explosion particle effects and etc) 
except 2 sprites for win and lose screen generated by chatgpt

games.name: Shelter from the Blight
games.body:
![screen1.png](///raw/7f5/36/z/6aa01.png)

*The world above is crumbling.*

A relentless storm of corruption rains down from the sky, threatening to consume everything in its path. To survive, you must descend into the depths below, harvesting new resources and building new structures.

But beware, the corruption spreads quickly, and once it consumes a level, the ground is lost to the void. Only by digging deeper can you hope to uncover the secrets of the earth and escape the storm's advance.

The journey begins here... in the shadow of **corruption**.!

games.name: The chronicles of Mr. Marmo
games.body:
# Tomorrow I'll expand this description

![Mr Marmo Cover.png](///raw/fd4/43/z/6ae3f.png)

The mad scientist is not satisfied with having blown up the moon! He certainly lost his marbles, now getting his drainage system ready to drain the seven seas for the treassure that lays in its dephts.

Goal: Via exploration discover all pipe puzzles, connect them and when all are done seek the valve out to drain the ocean. Be careful for the beasts that will harm you, mad scientist. Either they make you drop the pearls you thought were your marbles or force you to restart the level.

games.name: Splorer
games.body:
![CleanShot 2025-04-08 at 03.05.38.png](///raw/aa8/3/z/6af9e.png)

Ahoy Captain!

Thank for taking on the mission to explore the depth of space. Hopefully you'll find the planet you are so desperatly seaching for!

---

In this game, you use cards to combine with other cards to make more cards. Simple, right? You need to fly your spaceship to your target position. For this, you'll encounter different events, such as pirate attacks, ship wrecks and more.

Can you figure out how to proceed and how to reach your goal without dying? Good luck!

---

Info: We opted out of the graphics section, since *most* of the icons were from https://icones.js.org/. We did do a few icons ourself :)

games.name: Forge Rush
games.body:
![6a16d.png.320x256.fit.jpg](///raw/cfe/a5/z/6a5bd.jpg)
## About 
You are a team of dwarfs setting up a forge near the newly discovered underground ruins. Craft and supply explorers with various equipment or else your forge will be overrun with monsters from the depths!

## How to play

Use various crafting stations around the map to craft items that are requested by the explorers, deliver those items to appropriate counter to finish the order. Complete as many orders as you can to upgrade your forge or compete for highscore! Fail to deliver enough orders in time and you will lose!

The Game is either Singleplayer or local Co-op. Get more hands for easier game, we didn't implement player count difficulty scaling!

## Controls

| Action       | Keyboard      | Controller     |
|--------------|---------------|----------------|
| Menu/Pause   | Escape        | Menu Button    |
| Moving       | WASD          | Left Joystick  |
| Dash         | Space         | X              |
| Interact     | F             | A              |
| Take/Drop    | E             | B              |
| Join Game    | J             | Y              |
| Show Recipes | Tab           | Right Shoulder |

## Gameplay

Different stations have different recipes available to them. You need to figure out which station can produce which recipe.

You can use nearby tables as storage places if you run out of time for an order and don't want to destroy a particular piece of equipment.

You can also use a garbage bin to dispose of any item in case there's too much stuff lying around.

There are two stations:

* Crafting bench
* Anvil

## Hey there!

Are you stuck on what type of game to do for the jam? Do you ever feel like the theme is never that interesting? Are you big fan of sleep? Well, fear no more! We have a solution just for you!



Plunge in the depths of your mind and conjure up whacky game ideas within your own dreams. Play a variety of WarioWare style microgames, each with their own slightly different playstyle and artstyle!

Who knows, maybe you will find the perfect idea, or maybe, you will encounter something a little bit more spooky...
Only way to experience everything your dreams have to offer is to keep on playing

games.name: Flatline
games.body:
Cling to life and find the strength to survive in this puzzle arcade.

# HOW TO PLAY

Game supports Keyboard, Gamepad & Mobile controls

+ WASD, DPad, Swipe - Move yourself once in a specific direction spending a charge

+ Blue Blocks - Gives charge, but becomes Red on hit

+ Yellow Blocks - Doesn't Recharge and gets destroyed on hit

+ Red Blocks - Flatlines You

+ Leaving Boundaries - Warps you to the opposite side of the screen

+ White Star - Reaching it completes the level

# ‚ÄãCREDITS

* Mikhail " XpMonster " Prokhorov‚Äã - Director, Game Design, Level Design, Programming & Art

* Alexander " Rainesphere " Raines‚Äã - Original Soundtrack & Sound Design

* Jerem Watts‚Äã - Male Voice Over

* OGma_badparenting101‚Äã - Female Voice Over‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã‚Äã

games.name: Granny's Gotcha
games.body:
![Bildschirmfoto 2025-04-08 um 03.02.04.png](///raw/f90/21/z/6b01e.png)

![Bildschirmfoto 2025-04-08 um 03.02.32.png](///raw/f90/21/z/6b01f.png)

What helps with problems? - Granny knows the answer!
Whether it's a lost contact lens, a runny nose or time pressure to catch the next bus - Granny knows what you need: sweets!
And oh boy, she has lots of them in her dusty old handbag. Whether you like it or not, Granny will provide you with the most delicious treasures she has collected over the last 88 years.


Everyone deserves sweets!
Pay attention to the children's requests. They have precise ideas about what sweets they would like from Granny:
Round, flower-shaped, triangular, oblong, salty, Christmasy, Halloweeny, lollies, chocolate and cookies.
Many of them are even available in different colors: Red, yellow & green.

games.name: Deep Hour
games.body:
![LudumDareThumbnail.png](///raw/165/b3/z/6aea4.png)

Play WebGL on itch.io below!

In Deep Hour you play as an overworked salaryman trapped in the haunted depths of his office building long after everyone else has gone home. Inspired by the eerie liminality of the backrooms, the building stretches into surreal, endless corridors filled with ghostly remnants of corporate burnout.
Armed with only a flickering flashlight, you must venture deeper room by room, using light to capture restless spirits. Face your fears, and descend into the depths of your own exhaustion... if you dare clock out.

Made in 3 Days for Ludum Dare 57. Theme: Depths

games.name: The 7 Questions
games.body:
> In the end... what does the Tree think?

> Thinking about life, the Universe and everything... join me in this calming experience where birds chirp and 7 questions are to be answered... for your story to be revealed

## Play The 7 Questions

## here https://the-7-questions-ld57-by-awesky.netlify.app/

![6a948.png](///raw/659/a5/z/6b3cc.png)

## How to play

### The tree is asking you questions

Or is it the tree? Tree in space? Maybe it's the Universe or gour subcontious?

You will get 7 questions. Instead of giving concrete answers you answer with a colored cube. :spy: 

### The story

Based on your answers.. the Tree will analyze you and will spit out what it thinks. ; )

### Different questions

You will get a randomized set of questions with every run.

### Different answers / different story

After you've gotten the story you will see an *~ Ask me again ~* button. Clicking this resets the game and you will get a set of new questions.

Maybe you could answer differently next time? :wink: 
 

## Out of scope

So many things left undone (begging for a post-compo): 
- effects, actually showing off more beautiful trees / see this post: 
- more questions to come, greater variety of questions, hense more diverse end story


## Disclaimer

**No AI tools have been used or even tried during the development of this game.**

## Dev/programmer stuff

Total coding time is < 10 hours. Total ideation and drawing/trying stuff in Paint.NET was more than that.

- Framework: Phaser3 (Javascript), official Vue template with TypeScript, + obs-disp (my lib for state/object management and rapid clean coding)
- Graphics: Paint.NET 
- Audio: own recording early morning

games.name: Deep Sea Torpedo
games.body:
# **üî± Deep Sea Torpedo**


## **üéÆ Controls**

| Action          | Key  |
|---------------|------|
| Move Forward  | `W`  |
| Move Backward | `S`  |
| Turn Left     | `A`  |
| Turn Right    | `D`  |
| Move Up       | `Shift` |
| Move Down     | `Ctrl` |
| Fire Torpedo  | `Space` |
| Aim  |`Mouse` |

## **üéØ Objective**

- Navigate through **all underwater areas** without being destroyed.

- Avoid **enemy submarines**, **dangerous sea creatures**, and **hazardous currents**.

- Use **stealth and torpedoes** to survive.


## **üåä Features**

‚úÖ **Realistic Underwater Physics** ‚Äì Experience deep-sea movement with currents and buoyancy.

‚úÖ **Hostile Enemies** ‚Äì Enemy submarines **hunt you down** and fire torpedoes.

‚úÖ **Dynamic Environment** ‚Äì Underwater **currents shift** over time, affecting movement.

‚úÖ **Exploration & Survival** ‚Äì Carefully navigate each area **before the next one spawns**.


## **üí• Dangers & Challenges**

- **üî¥ Enemy Submarines** ‚Äì Detect and fire at you when in range.

- **üåä Underwater Currents** ‚Äì Push your submarine, **forcing constant readjustments**.

- **üí£ Limited Health** ‚Äì Taking too much damage means **game over!**


## **üèÜ Winning & Losing**

‚úîÔ∏è **Win**: Successfully navigate through all areas.

‚ùå **Lose**: If your submarine's health reaches **0**.

The old man hired you to find a hidden treasure in a cave, you take a pickaxe and go into the deep cave.

R - Reset level

games.name: Getting Drilled!
games.body:
![Screenshot 2025-04-07 214751.png](///raw/6ac/32/z/6a1b0.png)

![Screenshot 2025-04-07 215045.png](///raw/6ac/32/z/6a1b1.png)

Getting Drilled! is a twist on the classic game Breakout. Smash your way downward through the layers of ground using your high-powered drill. Just like in breakout, getting in amongst the tiles will cause some point scoring chaos. Descend into the depths collecting gems and rare minerals which will give you a large points boost. Watch out for the lava and get as deep as you can in 3 mins.

games.name: Dig in, Gus!
games.body:
Meet Gus, a down-on-his-luck mole and the recent beneficiary of his father's will. Gus inherited his father's massive debt, along with his prized pair of drill gloves. Left with no other option, he descends into the depths of the earth to mine for ore and get rich fast in the hopes of paying off his debt.

## Controls:
 ```
on keyboard
WASD to move
LMB to dig
RMB to fire grapling hook
SPACE to jump.

on a controller

Left Analog or DPAD to move
RB to dig
RT to fire grapling hook
A (XBOX) B(Switch) X (PS) to jump
```

games.name: Deep Exorcizing: A Poltergeist Cleaning Company
games.body:
___Explore an abandoned house and exorcise the poltergeist that calls there its home!___

![thumb.png](///raw/62e/81/z/6b37b.png)

_Deep Exorcizing is a company specialized in exorcizing poltergeists from homes to bring back their former glory!_
_Call now!_ ___666-047-GEIST___ _to schedule an exorcism today!_

Control Maria, one of the employees of __Deep Exorcising__, check the furniture in the house and beat the (un)living hell out of the ghost once you find it!

Some screenshots of the game:

I completely ran out of time with this game, so there isn't a lot of content in the game yet
Lots of programmer art and I didn't get time to write any meaningful text to the game

__Updates:__

Did some quick hot dixes

__Changelog - v0.2 - Hot fixes (08/04/2025)__

__Fixes__

* Fixed some data issues with the haunted furniture in which room, you will now be able to properly find everyone of them
* Now upon dying or defeating the poltergeist you will be led back to the main menu
* Tweaked some text

__Remaining known issues__

* The dialog box are still a bit finicky, try not to spam the interact button or walk while the text is showing. This will be fixed on later iterations of the game

games.name: D.E.P.T.H. - Door Evaluation Protocols & Testing Hub
games.body:
Welcome to D.E.P.T.H.
Door Evaluation Protocols & Testing Hub

Congratulations on your new assignment.
At D.E.P.T.H., we tackle the game industry's most persistent and misunderstood challenge: DOORS.

Your role is simple ‚Äî yet critical:
Test every door. Identify every flaw. File precise bug reports.
Only once every door has passed inspection may you return home.

Good luck. And have a productive workday.

![2025-04-07 16.02.48.jpg](///raw/964/94/z/6a238.png)

Our team:
- **Sylf**: Idea, game design, prototyping and testing
- **Evoenn**: All the art, textures, models, concepts and general vibe
- **Kabbi**: Coding

Huge thanks to:
- [Kenney](https://kenney.nl/) for his awesome game asset pack (we took the door)
- [OpenGameArt](https://opengameart.org/) for non-bullshit asset site (we took some door sounds)
- [Anthelmed guy](https://gist.github.com/Anthelmed/5fcc49a402ad5c81136c73ce96ba004f) for his great code snippet for world-space UI support
- [Tldraw](https://www.tldraw.com/) for great and free collaborative whiteboard

games.name: Tout au fond (at the very bottom)
games.body:
With your submarine equipped with missiles, you must reach the bottom to do what you do best. Shoot things and collect diamonds to gain health and upgrades. 

"Tout au fond" is a tiny submarine adventure that can be completed in a few minutes by defeating the game's boss. I look forward to your feedback and hope you have a great time playing. Thank you for playing our games.

Move with the keyboard or a pad and press C or a controller button to fire missiles.

Upgrade 1: The shield that revolves around you
Upgrade 2: Shorter cooldown for firing missiles
Upgrade 3: Vertical missiles that fire on their own
Upgrade 4: Super missiles pass through enemies.

games.name: Archeologic
games.body:
If archeology was a bit like tetris combined with a match 3 game, it would look like this game.

**Controls**

- WASD to move, hold Left Mouse to grab blocks, Q and E to rotate the camera

or 

- Arrows to move, hold Z to grab blocks, X and C to rotate the camera.

Move around while holding a block to drag it around.

![basics1.gif](///raw/564/1/z/6b31f.gif)

Put 3 boxes of the same type together to make them disappear.

![block_action.gif](///raw/564/1/z/6b32a.gif)

Pick up the bomb to light the fuse.

**The Objective**

Dig down to reach the bottom of this mysterious catacomb and claim your prize. Bombs are your friends in this one.

**Known bugs**

- The exit at the bottom might be flipped around. If all else fails, look for a shiny particle.
- WebGL build has some frame hiccups in the first seconds of the game, but it should be pretty smooth afterwards!

games.body:

### Description
Tower Defense meets Pachinko! Defeat a variety of different Antz with the power of your Plantz! There are 10 different Plantz to choose from and lots of strategic placements! If you're a fan of Plants vs Zombies, you'll love this!

### Useful Tips!

games.name: Dwarvenshaft
games.body:
## HOW TO PLAY:

Click on Dwarves to select them, then click on blocks for them to mine, or have them mine automatically. Once you have enough resources, buy things on the market, such as new Dwarves, to progress faster. Once you get a Drill, you can dig straight down to the next layer, but you will waste the Drill to do so.


## CONTROLS:

* Left Mouse Button: Interact
* Right Mouse Button: Deselect
* Escape: Back to Main Menu


## CREDITS:

* ART, CODE, MUSIC: Mateus Boga
* SFX: Mateus Boga; Footsteps by Jedimichael on Freesound.org; Pickaxe Sounds by WolfOWI, FALCONS_SHADOW and EminYILDIRIMon Freesound.org

**(NOTES: The LD site version of this game does not support saves, go to the Itch version to be able to autosave.)**

games.body:
![The Retreat](///raw/00e/84/z/6a464.png)

***Will you find peace in this cosy hideaway in the depths of the woods?  
Or will you find something else?***

Life is cold and relentless, but this cabin is perfect.  
You. The woods. Just an escape from it all.  
Shame the previous occupant left it in a bit of a state - what were they trying to hide?

games.name: into the forest depths
games.body:
![image (4).png](///raw/444/36/z/6a6ae.png)
You are a postman, but important addressees live in the wilderness, get to them and deliver all the parcels, but be careful, the deeper the forest, the more dangerous it is!
   
 ‚ÄãCombat Tutorial. How to fight?
![1.png](///raw/244/46/z/6ad3d.png)
    1. "Attack" 

First select body part to hit, then press "Attack" button.
Exactly in this order!‚Äã‚Äã

‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãEach body part has stats: Armor - reduces incoming damage. Miss chance - probability to miss.  
‚ÄãHitting same body part repeatedly can sever it: severed legs = easier to hit, severed arms = enemy can barely attack. ‚Äã
‚Äã‚Äã
    
    2. "Try to escape"

Success = enemy disappears forever. Failure = skip turn and take damage

![4.png](///raw/244/46/z/6ae1f.png)
![3.png](///raw/244/46/z/6ae25.png)

This is a small turn-based semi-RPG game created for Ludum Dare 57. Move across the map, meet strange characters, kill ghouls and deliver packages deeper and deeper into the forest. Thanks for playing and enjoy your journey into the darkness!

games.name: Unearth
games.body:
![Cover photo (2).png](///raw/2fb/04/z/698c6.png)



*Lava suddenly rising from the depths of the planet not only awakens the Duggots, but threatens their very existence.  No way but upwards.*

# [‚û§ Play now](https://milestonegames.itch.io/unearth)



![queen.png](///raw/2fb/04/z/6a4b9.png)

## **Description:**

Newly awakened to the heat of the rising lava, the Queen of the Duggots is faced with no other choice but to rise from the depths to escape the threat from below.

Having never before ascended, the Duggots are facing quite the challenge. What secrets are buried in the massive earth above? And how do you dig yourself up without getting trapped below the dirt? 

Help the queen to organise her minions and find their way to the surface!

---

## **How to play:**

**Move mouse to look around**
Or use W, A, S, D keys

**Scroll to zoom in or out**
Or use + and - keys

**Click to select worker**
- Click and drag to select multiple workers
- Press the Space key to deselect all workers

**Right-click to tell worker where to go**
- Click and drag to mark an area for mining
- Click while holding Control to cancel mining

### **Now go dig yourself to the surface!**

![Digger.gif](///raw/2fb/04/z/698c7.gif)
![Screenshot 2025-04-08 025733.png](///raw/09f/82/z/6ae97.png)


---

**Game Development:**

This game was developed by six members of the Dubious Potions indie collective.

All of the aspects of the game where developed within 72 hours of Ludum Dare 57, from idea to final build.

All assets in the game where made by the team.

We had an amazingly fun time doing this! <3

![DigDubPot.gif](///raw/f9d/04/z/62730.gif)

games.name: Fall Off
games.body:
![Cover.png](///raw/9fd/36/z/6b247.png)

https://hb10001.itch.io/fall-off

Game made in ~48h for Ludum Dare 55.

Theme: Depth
Solo dev entry for Jam.

- - - - - - -

üéÆ Controls

    ¬∑Move: WASD or Arrow Keys

    ¬∑Dash (side): Double-tap ‚Üê or ‚Üí

    ¬∑Power Dash (down strike): K or X (Unlocks after Level 2)

    ¬∑Slow Time: Hold Shift (Unlocks after Level 3)

    ¬∑Shoot (downward bullets): Hold J or Z (Unlocks after Level 4)

    ¬∑Start Game: Press any key

- - - - - - -

üíØ How Scoring Works

    ¬∑You gain points continuously while falling ‚Äî the faster you fall, the faster you score!

    ¬∑Defeating enemies grants extra points

    ¬∑Grazing bullets while dashing gives bonus points

- - - - - - -

This was my first time participating in Ludum Dare, and I had a lot of fun!  
I admit the game is far from finished, but it gave me tons of inspiration and reignited my passion as a game developer ‚Äî and I couldn't be happier.

Did I work all night? Sure I did!  
It reminded me just how much joy making a game can bring ‚Äî after years of crunching.

Maybe I'll keep working on it and publish it as an indie game one day.

games.name: Murder for Dessert
games.body:
You're **Brennan**, a detective hired to investigate the murder of Phillip Bezerra in the fanciest restaurant around: *The Grand Apricot*. Talk to the suspects, keep their lines in mind, and point out important inconsistencies and relationships between their accounts. It's up to you to get to the bottom of this case, so dig deep, expose the culprit and bring them to Justice!

## Instructions
Entering *The Grand Apricot*, you'll be presented with the numerous colourful suspects. Click on any one of them to initiate a conversation.

When you do, you'll see a panel on the right-hand side of your screen showing your progress extracting information from them. Click any button with a dialogue bubble to start talking.

During conversations, you'll see a little pin next to the suspect's dialogue box, if you think that line might be important, **put a pin on it** by clicking the Pin icon. This will put that line in your Inventory and from there you can read it, or use it during any other conversation to help you uncover the truth.

If you can no longer get any information, you'll be **BRICK WALLED**, and the buttons will reflect that, move on to someone else, or see if you missed anything!

## Credits

Fupicat: Graphics, music, sound design, story wrangling, dialogue writing.

Kett: Programming, dialogue writing.

[Full list of credits and assets here!](https://github.com/KettLovahr/murder-for-dessert?tab=readme-ov-file#credits)

games.body:
The Descent is an atmospheric underwater exploration game where you plunge into a mysterious cave in search of treasure. Dive deeper with each run, uncover secrets in the dark, and return to the surface to upgrade your gear. Can you reach the bottom and claim the ultimate prize?
(Disclaimer: most art is done by modifying AI assets.)

games.name: Slipping Away
games.body:
Somewhere underground. A cat loses its yarn ball‚Äîand begins to fall up.

Claws out, tail twitching, it dives deeper into the earth, away from the heavens above. The world is flipped, gravity reversed, but the mission stays the same: find the yarn while avoiding scary cucumbers.

Strange caverns echo with memories. Floating debris, gleaming spikes, and lurking shadows pull the cat further from the light. Each leap is a choice. Each misstep, a new fate.

Will the cat find what it‚Äôs chasing?
Or is it just running from what‚Äôs above?

games.name: It's madness, my dudes
games.body:
Yo dude, grab a snorkel or at least a bucket cause we got urgent frog business!
We‚Äôre scared. It‚Äôs dark. But we gotta go deep. Like, real deep. The frog world‚Äôs in danger and only you can save it. No pressure or anything.

![LD57_game_jam_Depths.png](///raw/5a3/46/z/6ae40.png)

The Great Kwan had a dream. Said there‚Äôs some ultra-powerful artifact chillin way down at the bottom of the ocean under like a million tons of wet doom.
So yeah, you‚Äôre gonna have to smash blocks, unlock ancient frog doors, and fight off the deep froggin‚Äô madness. Ribbit happens, bro.

Three totally cracked frogs are already squished inside the bathyscaphe, arguing over snacks and controls. And you? You‚Äôre comin too.
There‚Äôs puzzles, weird noises, and a madness that‚Äôll have you hearin frog voices whisper "ribbit" while you brush your teeth.

![bandicam 2025-04-08 03-17-27-069.gif](///raw/cf6/b2/z/6b153.gif)

Dude, if you don‚Äôt dive ‚Äî who will?
Jump in, grab the hook, and go find that thing before frogkind croaks for good.
It‚Äôs deep. It‚Äôs dumb. It‚Äôs destiny.

![bandicam 2025-04-08 03-11-07-439 (1).gif](///raw/cf6/b2/z/6afaa.gif)
